This place is awesome!  Guacamole is excellent, I've tried the naked and the Guacamole SOL - the SOL is interesting but I'll stick with the traditional.  Panuchos are very good.  The meat in the taco Vampiro was out of this world and they melt cheese between the two outer layers of tortilla with very spicy fresh peppers which adds even more flavor and some nice heat.  Sweet potato and black bean tacos were great too.  Short Rib Barbacoa is incredible!!  Their rice and beans on the side are also very good.  White corn poblano soup is delicious with a little heat.  Good salsa and they gave us a hot sauce that was pretty serious.  All three trips were take out so I can't comment on the service.  Parking is terrible but that goes without saying.  Prices are cheap for what you get.
I just ate there last week and it was amazing! We had the shrimp cucarachas and the Spanish octopus. If you love seafood like me, these are fantastic!

Another gourmet taco/Mexican restaurant, are we saturated yet?   I guess not because I keep going to them all.  Had the calamari coconut appetizer, a little bland.  Guacamole was good, can order multiple types ranging from your standard guacamole to guacamole with fruit and nuts added.  2 tacos, chicken with ghost pepper sauce was good but HOT, and vampirio which was carne asada on a double decker shell.  Chips at the table are full tortillas you break up yourself, pretty good chips and salsa.  Also a cup of beans with the chips and salsa.  A lot of other menu items to pick from.  Go and enjoy.

Ate here with my wife yesterday and overall had a great experience. I had never been in before and I was uncertain of what I wanted to eat. My server ____ I forget her name...but however explained to me how the menu worked and offered some menu items to me that she thought I would enjoy. She was right I ordered a total of four tacos and they were all amazing! The Yellowfin wasn't my favorite, but I am also not a huge fish fan as is. Again it was an overall great experience, and I am defiantly a return customer!

The service was top notch and the food was some of the best Mexican food I've had. We live in an area with many "baja" type restaurants, but none are as good as SOL. I had the Vampiro taco and another at our table had the enchiladas. Both were great!

Want great Baja Mexican while in Scottsdale check out Sol. We had great fish tacos and angus beef tacos. All fresh ingredients and wait staff was fun and provider great service. Busy place so make reservations if eating after 5:30 pm but note no reservations taken less than 3 hours before by phone and online reservations must be made at least 24 hours in advance.

This was my hubby and my first time here and we were so impressed!!! Loved the ambience! Such a cool and fun place. The food was amazing! We started with the traditional guac, which was so good! I had the blackberry/ ginger marg, it was delicious. We had the carne Asada tacos. So yummy! Our server was very good made our time there enjoyable. I can't wait to go back, especially when it cools down, so we can hangout on the patio.
First time here and we will be back! Great food, fun atmosphere and amazing service - ask for Alberto!!
Tried it twice. First time they gave us okay drinks and we asked for seconds and they brought us different drinks. Odd.   Second visit they gave us our Grande Marg in a pint glass...

Great service and great food. Forgot to take pictures sorry! The guacamole had great taste and a spicy kick. Shared the pollo and carne asada taco plates. The pollo was alright but the carne was Bueno. I would order it again. The pork burrito was good, ton of volume. The original margarita had good flavor, fills two full glasses!

Fantastic food (and margaritas!) - great atmosphere - and very cool setting. I'd highly recommend trying an assortment of the street tacos. They are a house specialty and delicious! The pineapple habanero margarita was the perfect companion. I wouldn't come if you are looking for a place to have an intimate conversation as it is crowded and quite loud - but that's what makes it fun!

Having visited SOL Newport over the past couple of years, we were anxious for this one to open.  I want to say this about these 2 restaurants. They are not typical Mexican restaurants that so many people try to categorize them into.  They are a very regional Baja Peninsula/Coastal Mexican restaurant.  They don't serve Fajitas or Chimichanga's. What they do offer is some of the most original menu items from that particular region, including their Goat Cheese and Sweet Corn appetizers, their Strawberry and Serrano Chili Guacamole or their Sol Guacamole are also items you won't see anywhere I've been. All of their Ceviche's are excellent and I give special consideration to their Hot and Raw Ceviche... Incredible. Yes they have Street Taco's and their Vampiro taco's seem to be the big hit, and I would definately agree. Don't be afraid to ask them to change something if  you don't like a certain element, they seem not to mind in the slightest.   The Decor may be typical "North Scottsdale" but it's at home in any "typical Upscale" city or area and they've tried to keep it open, and not too formal and again, original.  Just enjoy the place.  I've gotten to know Robbi, Stacy, and Nicole well enough and better bartenders you will hardly find than these 3. They know the menu and their drinks, and are confident in what they do.

Nice atmosphere.  Food just ok.  Guacamole was super spicy to the point where no one at our table would finish it.  Reasonable portion sizes where you don't have to worry about taking home leftovers.  I ate the carnitas street tacos which were good but the corn tortillas fell apart and were a bit messy.  Special margarita for St. Patricks day looked very festive but was kind of bland.  Arrived at 5pm, hostess said patio was booked full even though it was empty.  When I left an hour and a half later, patio was still 3/4 empty.

This was my first time at this restaurant and the experience was awful! It started when we first walked in the door. The hostess was absolutely horrible. She looked us up and down, did not greet us and simply asked "how many?" When I gave her the number in my party, she rolled her eyes, and said "you can sit here." It table right by the door, when we asked politely if we could get another table in the middle of the room because it was too hot by the door she got upset, rolled her eyes again, and said "if you want that table, I'll have to set it up and this one is already set." When we told her no, she gave us attitude and said "I'll have to set it up." When she finished, she went behind the desk up front, didn't look at us, and said, "your table is over there." And pointed to the middle of the room. When I asked if she could show us to Table she sighed and rolled her eyes, took us to the table, and threw the menus on the table. That was only the beginning, the waiter who took our drink order seemed just as annoyed, and threw the chips on the table, and got irritated when we tried to ask for drink suggestions. The service was terrible, it was hot and only the fans were going, we ended up not eating here because we did not feel welcomed. This place was horrible, I do not recommend unless you want to pay high prices to be treated like an inconvenience. If I could give this negative stars, I would.
great atmosphere and decor, but the food was just blah.  didn't love it. the wait for 4 of us to get served..  took forever.  lots of better mexican food places in town.

Great atmosphere and service was good. Food and drinks were extremely overpriced for their quality. Came for Cinco de Mayo and was extremely disappointed with their $10 "special" for their margarita. $15 burrito was filled with more onions than chicken and got "enchilada style" which was an additional $2 for a tiny SPRINKLE of shredded cheese. If the prices were reasonable I would return again.
Great happy hour place , we go every month ! It gets kind of crowded so make reservations

A group of us dined here last night and we really enjoyed ourselves. We have to praise our wonderful server Amanda. She was awesome - friendly, funny, really knew the menu. We started with coconut calamari, which was fantastic. Then we took Amanda's recommendation and tried the Hot & Raw Tropical Ceviche, which was excellent. Two of us had the Short Ribs Barbacoa - super flavorful.   Ambiance was energetic, and I highly recommend visiting SOL Mexican Cocina.
We got married yesterday.. and had brunch with our kids here. The food was Delicious & Service was great! Will be back for certain! Thank you!! Sherri

First things first! If you have champagne taste and a beer budget this isn't for you.  If you complain about pricing in Scottsdale you can always Go to filibertos where your beef came from a coyote or victims of cartel violence. Anyhow this place is awesome From service to food.  Holden, Gio and Mike are the best servers they have there.  They make the experience ten times better.  Very knowledgable about the menu and drinks.  Their appetizers are unique creations.  I've tried several different tacos on the menu and loved the garlic rib eye taco the most.   You must must must try their Kobe Skirt Steak.  (For those that complain about price do research on KOBE beef. It didn't come from the LA Lakers) They have the best skirt steak in town.   Will def be a regular for years to come.   Thank you guys
Our waiter Arnoldo was wonderful. Food was great. I wish that they offered a taco sampler.
The food was excellent!!  Our server was Arnoldo and he was at the top of his game.  He explained the menu and gave us some good tips.  Will definately be back again, hopefully with the same date.

Excellent food! Great staff but a very outstanding service from Albert, he goes the extra mile for the customers.  Thank you so much and people if you're reading this review try the carnitas street tacos YUMM!

SOL is located in Scottsdale Square, pretty convenient location and you can sit outside and watch the street - so OK but not a nice view. The place is a larger, more upscale Mexican restaurant. The drinks I thought were overpriced, but the rest of the menu is not too bad considering the location.  The atmosphere is decent, fitting to the decor and food. It is loud in here, especially when there is a young kid next to us! Otherwise though, pretty normal for this kind of restaurant.  We had the chips bean dip and salsa, then on to our entrees which were Carne Asada tacos and Grilled fish tacos. The portion sizes were average and the food quality good, but nothing great.   Overall, this is the kind of experience you expect in a chain kind of Mexican restaurant. Nothing to really make it stand out.

Double date with the wife and some friends. Service was average. The beers were over priced for Dos Lager Bottles. We tried 1 of the guac dips and it was pretty good as well as the salsa. I had 1 of the tacos option and they were pretty good. I spent about $70 for the both of us. So be prepaired to dish out the $$$$

The food and service was equally spectacular. The fresh tastes that stimulate your taste buds to the point of ecstasy. Ambiance is perfect for the authentic food. Don't hesitate to make the drive to Scottsdale. Sol is now a mainstay in my top ten restaurants in the valley.
Outstanding food, service and ambience! Had lunch with the family and we agreed, this is on our short list now!

It was good even though I ordered the wrong thing. The burrito had a nice flavor but I didn't like how my black beans were cold while the chicken was hot. This made every bite awkward. The price is reasonable. I'll be going back to try something else. My wife loved her carnitas burrito. We both enjoyed the atmosphere.

Was excited to try this restaurant on our last night in Scottsdale after seeing the amazing reviews. To be honest, it's really hard to mess up Mexican food for me, but this place managed to do it in the most mediocre way possible.  To start, we were greeted by the most apathetic hostess I've ever come across. She pretty much twirled her hair with a confused look as to why anyone was standing in front of her, as if it wasn't her job to greet customers. The experience picked up when we were seated right away on the outdoor patio and immediately greeted with delicious chips and salsa (yum!)...pretty much all downhill from there.   Food: Ordered the chicken street tacos plate. Seemed pretty straight forward, but there was ZERO flavor in the dish. Even after adding some of the delicious aforementioned salsa, the tacos were extremely bland. The rice was basically cold and honestly tasted like something out of a box.  Service: Our waitress acted extremely exasperated the entire time - constantly referring to how busy she was and how many people there were. She ran by us a few times when we first sat to tell us she'd be right back, but it was a good while before she came to take our drink order. To be honest, we didn't see much of her the whole time. When our food was ready, a runner brought it to us and pretty much threw it on the table before running back to the kitchen. When we were ready for our check, we sat there for a good 10 minutes before seeing our server again.  While the atmosphere of SOL was very cool - nice decor and seems like a trendy spot - the service and food left much to be desired. If I were a local, I am not sure that I'd be back to try again. Just not worth the hype.

Great food. They do traditional with a slight twist that adds a ton of flavor. I'd highly recommend the SOL Guacamole which adds ingredients you wouldn't normally expect, like mango and tequila. The flavor is amazing. Service was great, food was well prepared. Definitely a place I'll return to.

Brought my parents here for their 37th Wedding Anniversary and it was such a great experience! The food and service is truly impeccable and probably one of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to a long time. We ordered several of their Taco's a la carte and all were fantastic. Amazing spicy Serrano margaritas to accompany the food. I can't wait to visit my parents and go back to place!

This is some real quality high end Mexican food.  Very interesting menu and great tequila selection.  Deep flavors and great service!   Can't wait to return to try different items.  Not difficult to see why the place is so busy and rated so high on Yelp.
Beautiful setting.  Located on the outside edge of the Kierland Mall.  Great patio and great food.  Parking right next to the restaurant in the parking garage.

One of my go-to places!  Drinks are yummy, food is fantastic, atmosphere is great, and staff is great. I always order the sweet potato and black bean tacos, and they will rock your world, and you'll even do a little dance in your chair.    Overall, the restaurant is very welcoming, and will keep you coming back for more!

This place is super good! No complaints! Food is great, atmosphere is great , drinks are reasonably priced. I wish they sold their tocos individually cheaper but that's ok because the other food is great.

Sol. Or should I say "SOUL Cousina". Taco Tuesday's. I would take a picture of my food but there is nothing left to show you. Oh "Don't lick your plate you will get in trouble" the staff doesn't care but my wife got really embarrassed.  Lol. Cheers

Stopped here while shopping; unexpected. Grabbed street tacos and quesadillas. The service was so so; I clarify that by it being a little slow (maybe I was in a hurry), but my waiter when he was there was attentive and super helpful. Think I was grouchy from shopping; who knows.   My recommendation. If you order the corn, let them cut it and set on the dish. They only put seasoning on 1/4 - 1/2 of the corn. So you are losing flavor. Back home in Michigan there are a couple places that do a similar corn dish, but they have seasoning on the entire thing, which was what I expected.    Other than that, it was a nice place. I have a favorite place back home that is hard to beat, hence the 4 stars. But this place is still good and recommend you stop in.

Excellent service coupled with excellent food quality, taste and portion. Newer style Mexican menu with some classic tastes as well. Pros good food, great service. Cons tight dining room, limited parking in the garage but the valet service was top notch and very helpful, fee for valet plus tip, FYI.

Food was good, but very pricey.  It's a fancy take on Mexican food.  If you want an upscale Scottsdale Mexican restaurant, this is the place for you.  If you want authentic Mexican food, there are better options in town.    I would go back for drinks at the bar.

Are 1st time here.. Armando are server..one of the finest best fucken tasting,mouthwatering carnitas tacos in Phx..  We went there during happy.I was going to order there $20 margaritas.. But are server told me .. Hey.  We have happy hr.. Let me get u a drink that I think u will love..  So I'm like cool.. He strongly recommend that we try there happy hr carnita tacos!! Thank God I did.. Both my wife and I went crazy.. The drink were all $6 margaritas!!!!!  Beauitful atmosphere!! Both my wife and I walked out of there completely full!!!! One of the best restaurants in the state!!  Try it!!!!

Beautiful place & the specialty frozen mango margarita was AWESOME!!! The starter grilled corn  with cheese, chili & lime and the rice were very good.  The beef filet & shrimp taco had a strange aftertaste - sort of a burnt - chemical type flavor that I think came from the grill.  The staff were wonderful

Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, he gave great recommendations and had extensive knowledge about the tequilas. Not only was he smart, he was kind and hilarious! I had the shrimp taquitos, quesadilla, rice and beans! So yummy. I paired it with a house margarita and my friend had the frozen strawberry margarita. I was extremely jealous of her drink as it had real strawberries inside of it and tasted delicious, I will be having that next time. Menu is great, their chips and salsa is AMAZING! The salsa had the perfect amount of heat and spice, I love spicy! Can't wait to come back!!

We had reservations for Valentines. We ordered cocktails ,guacamole and shrimp to start. It took over 30 minutes for it to be served. I ordered corn tortillas with the guacamole. They were ice cold. Food ,and service was very mediocre. Such a disappointment.

Great high end Californified Mexican!  The interior is hip a requirement for the area and filled with all the Scott's typically lunch clientele ... you know know who you're ;). If it weren't 108 out, dining out side would rock here.  Food was great!  Server brought us home dad chips which are whole 4" tortillas which as seamsosned with a smoke and salty something.  They are accompanied by a trio of relishes - salsa and modifiers.  There is a black bean salsa, a mild fire roasted salsa, and a modifier plate so you can season them to taste... habaneros sauce, salt and limes.  Great flavors!  The carne asada plate of tacos was FANTASTIC!!!!!  Smokey, seasoned, JUICY, full... sooo good!  Server was friendly and attentive.  Server recommended tacos ala carte, but at $11-$15 EACH, my principles wouldn't let me do it... the thought of a taco for $13 made my taint pucker like watching Fail videos on Youtube.  Funny, but better when it happens to someone else :). The 3 taco carne asada plate was $15 and was awesome! It's not that the $13 taco would not be good, it's just that it's a taco!  It would be like putting a lift kit on Mini Cooper- you can but why?!     Go and enjoy... you will love it!
Not just tacos and burritos! Excellent salads too ! My fave is kale and quinoa salad with grilled shrimp! Delish.

So first off, giving Sol a star for the food- they have good solid tacos.  Tried the carnitas, grilled fish, and breaded fish tacos, as well as the guacamole.  I would recommend all 4 items, and word on the street is that the ceviche does not suck at all.    Giving 1 more star for the service... and the studly eyecandy (I'm talking about our 2 hot bartenders)    Another star for the cool vibe and look of the place, awesome location in the Scottsdale Quarter.  Good for an after work happy hour, a hot date, or even lunch if you work in the area. Didn't have to wait for a table and there was even open seats at the bar.  One more star for the delicious margaritas and the five dollar off deal for checking in on Yelp!  Knocking off 1 star because happy hour ends at six p.m.  Boo, really?  And, lastly giving one more star because they do have a good taco Tuesday which goes on all evening, and consist of good deals on tacos and margaritas.    Long live taco Tuesday's!!  Tip- come by and check out the Sunday Brunch

Fabulous spot. The goat cheese appetizer and coconut calamari is amazing! The Calamari is the best, fresh tasting and cool presentation, I've seen in the valley.   Highly recommended. Garrett made it even better. Personable, knowledge and fun. Thank you!

Service is lacking here.  We walked in and had to push through a group of teenagers in the way blocking the hostess stand.  Once there the hostess was so focused on her phone that I had to ask 2x for her attention.  She said there was no wait for 2 people and just pointed at a table told me to just go there, ummm ok so I sat outside with my husband and not one person came by with menus or waters.  I got up and got my own menus then flagged a server down.  The server was very nice.     The food is good but overpriced for what you get.  Loved the chrizo and cheese dish it is a must for sharing.  I also got the fish tacos which were tasty but nothing special.  The rice was amazing however I wish they gave more than 1 tiny spoonful of it, the beans were good too but again we had 4 bites of beans so nut much there.     All in all I would say meh maybe just go for drinks and apps.

Hmmm, maybe it was a off night, but I was not impressed by this place at all.  I see a lot of good and positive reviews, so I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt.  I thought the ambiance and environment was fun and inviting, but the food itself was very overrated and boring.  Maybe I'm bias cause my fiance's family owns a authentic Mexican restaurant and I've had so many great Mexican dishes recently, that this place paled in comparison.  This place is located in the corner of Greenway Hayden and Scottsdale road, right in Scottsdale Quarter.  This place is well decorated and looks like a fun place to go, but when you sample the food, the fun stops there!  The prices of this place is very expensive, especially for very simple Mexican dishes.  We stopped by on a Sunday evening, we had a pretty big group, cause it was my fiances brothers birthday.  The service was pretty good, so really no complaints, but it was the food that was the true let down.  We ordered some drinks to start out...and for appetizers we ordered some guacamole for the table.  The guacamole wasn't very tasty and for 9 bucks, you really only get a small sample.  They bring you out some chips and salsa and some sort of bean dip to nibble on while you're looking at the menu.  Since we had a big group, we all were chatting and waiting for others to arrive.  I literally looked at the menu for over 20 minutes and really nothing stood out  and it was very tough to decide.  The dinner menu was very limited, they had some dinner specials, which were very over priced and they had a taco section that they served ala carte.  I wasn't going to drop 8 to 12 bucks on one freaking taco, its principle of it.  So basically if you wanted two specialty tacos with rice and beans, it would of cost well over 20 bucks for a plate.  On the back of the menu they had dinner plates, but most dishes were over 15 and the options were very limited.  My lady ordered the three carne asada taco plate wih a side quesadilla and I ordered the pork carnitas  which was 20 bucks.  I was not impressed.  The meat was served in a little dish and the flavors were bland and the meat itself was barely warm.  It tasted like pulled pork without the smoke flavor.  Not to mention the huge glob of fat that came with it.  I seriously thought it was a joke.  I tried to add some flavors by adding hot salsa, onions and avocados, but the taste of the meat was just awful.  Overall the meal was a disaster.  I would give it a one star review, but the service was pretty good, and the ambiance was nice.   Overall, not my type of place.  Phoenix has tons of great places to try for Mexican food, but if you don't value money and want something different, give this place a try!  I would not recommend this place at all.  Maybe for happy hour and drinks, but definitely not for the food.

Didn't really care for the food, if you're anticipating  tradional Mexican food then it's not for you, more of a food truck Style.  Food was very bland and may adapt well to the Vegan diet.  And if you love fajitas, then this isn't the place for you.  I had the short rib taco,  only 1, less than a palm of your hand, $10.50.  The cost didn't throw as the taste of it.  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.!!!
Had shrimp taco dorado 3 small shrimp, black beans  could use some spice.  Taco had more mango salsa than shrimp.  Magarita was good.

Sat outside at the bar on a Sunday mid-day.  Had a choice between the brunch and lunch menu.  The bartender agreed that the fish taco's were the best choice and she was right.  Good flavor.  I was hungry and ordered two taco's ($8 each) plus the rice and beans.  I should have gone for just one after also getting the chips and salsa they provide.  All in all, a very good place, on the upscale side for a Mexican restaurant but everyone can feel at home here.

Food was very good and atmosphere was nice though  hard to hear across the tables in a big party. There is a $4 upcharge  to make your burrito enchilada style though  your waiter probably  won't  tell  you it's an upcharge and offer it as though it's a regular no charge option as ours did to our table.
My boyfriend and I love Sol and the food was really good! An extra bonus to our night was our server Arnoldo. He provided exceptional customer service and made our experience extra enjoyable! :)

The service was fast an friendly.The waiter was very professional and checked on the table multiple times to make sure everything was okay. However the place feels very small and crowded. The appetizers were okay.the food was really light and tasty. We will definitely come back again.

This place was so good! We opted for the taco Tuesday menu which included 5$ regular margaritas and 6$ skinny. We both got skinny and were surprised how good they were. We also split the animale taco which had carne asada French fries onions and cilantro. Delicious I also tried the chicken street taco, it was made with chicken thigh which I'm not the biggest fan of but they were good.

we had an amazing dinner guacamole was so good I order some ceviche it was so good the shrimp tacos where amazing  , oh and my favorite sweet potatoes  chips , everything was really clean , Alberto took very good care of us I think he made our experience even better

We had great food and great service. Our server was Lorena and she let us know happy hour was ending so we could order a drink at happy hour prices. Started with the coconut calamari and it was excellent. The fish of the day was grouper and it was also excellent. This will be on my list of restaurants to return to
Good tacos.  Different. Nice atmosphere. Beer and wine were both good. Wait person not puking attention.   Rushed they drink order.  Not enough time to decide.  Annoyed I asked about happy hour.

Food was not worth the price. The waiter recommended things for us to get and they were all awful. Everything from the guacamole to the $10 individual tacos. My wife and I would have much rather have gone to Chipotle across the street and not paid $100.
Food and service were absolutely amazing! Server was extremely friendly and made great recommendations! Check this place out, they're awesome!

We went here the other night and ordered some great food but it took a while for us to get it 25-30 min. Had to ask the bartender if he remembered to put it in.  Then after 20 30 min , we got our food. But never got out appetizer. , When I would ask for something it would literally take 15-20 minutes to get like an extra side of sauce out. I was eating slow trying to wait for it, then my food was cold by the time the sauce would come out.   So good food.   Sloooow service.  And forgetful bartender :(.  Think it would of been amazing if the staff was on point.

Really like this place. Excellent enchiladas and tacos, and a lively, yet still classy ambiance. However, I'm a bit of a salsa snob, and I must admit that for as good food as they have, their salsa leaves a bit to be desired.

The food was ok.  Waitress forgot my guacamole.  Wait staff continually bumped into our table.  Great wine list.  Nice decor.  I may or may not try again.  Not impressed by the food. Id go up to Narcisse or True Food instead.
Food was tasty. Service was standard. No military discount and they turned off the armed forces bowl to watch cops. Wow.

So disappointed. Met five friends here yesterday for lunch to celebrate a birthday and my entree was terrible. Let me preface this by first saying that my previous visits here have been good. I ordered something new: the shrimp taquitos from the appetizer menu. They were dripping in grease. When I picked one up and took a bit, my hands were very greasy. It was a bit disconcerting and unappealing. I thought about sending them back but the hassle in a large group wouldn't have been worth it. Don't order them! On the plus side, service was excellent. And they brought the birthday girl the cinnamon nachos with a candle.

The SOL guacamole is delicious! Avocado mixed with goat cheese, pepitas, onions, tomatoes, mango that they mix at your table. Delicious!!!!! Try the garlic ribeye taco, it's. The most delicious taco I've ever had. The canarditas duck confit tacos and the blackberry sauce were divine. The chille wrapped in bacon couldn't have been any better. Rodrigo, our server, was wonderful and helpful. We will be back. A+

My friend and I came here after my appointment at Dolce last Sunday because it was right next door.  It was busy, and they had brunch items! Even better was the nice service (our waiter was really cool) and then they also had someone come perform! The musician was talent and hit the feels with the songs - he even sang a tune from The Little Mermaid. Major win, obviously.   They have a nice black bean dip (complimentary. And we shared the brioche/French toast/bread pudding item. Haha, it was really good. Not too sweet and plenty to share between us.   As far as drinks, I had the mango mimosa..again not too sweet because they use a purer instead of a syrup. My friend had this frozen margarita and mimosa mix, and she really like it!  Happy that we stumbled upon this place. :)

Overall tasty!!  Had a good experience here - enjoyed the atmosphere (warm, not too loud) - and delicious complementary chips and dip!  The skinny margaritas were good but not strong; the vanilla and pineapple infused tequila/martini was great though!  Good service - would definitely return!

Sooo good! The margaritas are great. The food is fantastic. Too many great options so we chose to start with the peel and eat shrimp as a shared appetizer. They were messy as expected and super tasty! The cheese could have been left off, we didn't think it added anything. Then we went with tacos so we could try several. All were great. We would come back anytime! Loved it, and the service was good too.

I went here late on a Sunday night. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the kitchen and bar was open until 10 PM on a Sunday.  I sat at the bar and had Kristen the bartender take care of me. She was excellent, great service!  They have an indoor and outdoor bar as well as a lot of tables. There's plenty of room in this restaurant.  The food tasted good, very fresh, and the service was fast. The drinks were pretty good, and I believe you get a better value by getting the large margarita versus the regular size margarita.    Things can get expensive here quickly, especially if you enjoy a few of their margaritas.   Overall this was good food, good drinks, a very friendly atmosphere and great service.
Great atmosphere, friendly service and the food is fresh and tasty varieties of traditional Mexican dishes.  Love the frozen beer.

This was our first time for me and my husband. We decided to stop by on our way home on a Tuesday evening. Place is very nice. The front desk ladies were polite and welcoming. They forgot to give the Tuesday special for the tacos but our waitress Deborah was amazing, polite, friendly, knowledgeable and quick with the service. She helped us out with our selections, always kept an eye on our refills. I ordered chicken and carne asada tacos and my husband ordered shrimp and fish tacos with the side of rice and beans. Deborah brought some chips with salsa and bean dip for us to start with.  Both were great. Rice were better than the black beans. This was a great meal for the great price and the awesome service. I would love to go back for another taco tuesday!! Cant wait and I hope I get another server just like Deborah, if not her again for the great experience!!!
My most favorite restaurant!! Everything is top notch!  Carne asada, the red rice, black bean sweet potato tacos and goat cheese guacamole are all amazing.

Not only do i love that they have yelp specials for margaritas, their margaritas are awesome!  I am a "skinny" margarita myself but they have a huge assortment of margaritas and tequilas that there is something for everyone.  aside from the goodstuff is the other good stuff- their food!  Their salsa which I believe is made on site, is delicious!  I didnt quite caremuch for the black bean dip but thats just my preference.  The staff is quite attentive and will refil your chips beforeyou realize you even need a refill.  The menu has a good selection but not overwhleming; I like the fried fish tacos, personally.  At night time, I did find the lighting to be a little too dark and actually had to get my iphone out to read the menu.  But overall it was a great experience and I look forward to going back.
Very good and interesting atmosphere. I had the pork carnitas dinner and it was great! Open kitchen is fun. I would return.

For the last several years this has been, and continues to be my favorite restaurant in town for great Baja style Mexican food and margaritas. Try the hot and rot tropical ceviche, naked guacamole, and the cucumber jalapeño margaritas. Service in the bar area can be hit or miss; I have found better service if you sit back at the regular tables. I bring both friends and clients here for dinners on a regular basis. The place is always very clean, the staff friendly, and the restrooms immaculate. While there are several restaurants at the Quarter, I continue to rate this one the highest. Salud!

Food was great and the margaritas were spectacular!  The table service was incredibly slow.  After being seated we sat at the table for 10 min and no waters, no drink orders...  We ended going up to the bar where Lauren the other bar tenders made some amazing recommendations for margaritas.  When re-seated Israel did a great job with great service.  The tacos are great.  They are big so watch out!  Two is perfect.  I will go back for the drinks for sure.

There's nothing I didn't like about this restaurant. The ambiance is great, server (Zac) was knowledgeable and friendly,  food was delicious and the signature drinks was good too.  My husbad and I ordered the sweet corn (similar to elotes) for our appetizer. I ordered the pork carnitas (gluten free) and my husband ordered steak, fish and shrimp tacos (a la carte). We liked everything.
Great atmosphere last night ... local music bartender was fantastic. Drinks were great. Chips beans and salsa were wonderful.

We have been here two times. Both were fun, enjoyable and food great! The place is modern and upscale. Bit loud on a busy night. Had the fresh watermelon margarita, delish! Had the Mexican shrimp really good. We will be back.

Been here twice and disappointed both times.  Food is OK. Guac is over priced. Specialty cocktails way too sweet. Staff not very personable ... I would actually go as far as to say continuously weeded and awkward.  Went there a few nights ago with family and friends and we literally sat there and chatted for an hour before I finally made eye contact with our waitress like "HEY WE'RE READY". Just because we're talking doesn't mean we're not hungry.  She was running around all night just looking way too busy.  Tortilla soup tasteless. Ensalada Sol was good, but I could've made a better salad at home for half the price.. Want to add chipotle shrimp? Don't. Also tasteless and no spice at all.  Apparently the enchiladas and street tacos are good.  Also, the apparent manager reaches over our table to turn on the electric candle... Without saying a word. We all stop to look at him since we had no idea who he was and why he were reaching across the table turning on the candle and then walking away. Try something like "Hi! My name is soandso, and I'm the manager here. How are those margaritas?" ... While reaching for the candle. Or better yet, TURN THEM ALL ON BEFORE DINNER SERVICE ;)   Customer service isn't bad, just weird. Hostesses are friendly opening doors and what not, but when you mention its still happy hour you should give us happy hour menu's as well and there are tables near the door, hold off on the personal chitchat, because I don't care what you're doing later tonight.  ALL SUMMED UP: Food: overpriced (not saying it's totally bad, but it's OVERPRICED) Service: inexperienced staff and way too casual for The Quarter (use proper verbiage, make eye contact, and SMILE... advice applicable to everyone working there, except the young boy who always refilled my water :) Atmosphere: trendy.  I'll go to Chipotle next time.

If I could give a negative star I would....horrible service. On a wed night took them 20 minutes to take our drink order and then after getting our drinks our waiter never came back to take our order. After waiting 25 minutes we flagged someone down and paid our bill. Keep driving past this place not worth it.

I really wanted to like this place - and I did - this is more of a 3.5 that I couldn't bring myself to round up.  I've been here several times. I've ordered several of the fish dishes (fish sandwich, fish tacos) and been pretty impressed, but just not blown away.  The cold ceviche is also quite good.   Our meal came with free chips and salsa, which was a nice added bonus.  The service was okay. It's ranged from the standard "good" to slightly sleazy.  I'm not sure if this is just a Scottsdale thing, but I went to lunch with three (male) coworkers. I ordered a margarita at lunch and the waiter, a younger guy, put his hand on my shoulder and asked if I liked my drink. I just thought it was super weird, but I might be overreacting.
Service was great considering they were busy. Really fast seating and our server was a great conversationalist. Had to leave early but will definitely be back.
This place was great. Good food and service, along with some free parking in a upscale shopping area. The Sol guac with mango was delicious and so was the coconut calamari. Highly recommended.

Blah blah blah what's all the hype about.  Ordered the grilled corn it was cooked perfectly with just enough sauce to piss you off.  Anyone with common sense would serve it with a side of sauce or at least more than the tiny squirt they give you.  Ordered the $18.00 taco plate each taco graciously stuffed with a full tablespoon of meat- what a joke.  Our food was cold and nats where constantly landing in our salsa bowls.  The server Sandra did an excellent job and you can tell she truly believes in the food unfortunately it's overpriced for the portions and lacking flavor and temperature.  There are many other Mexican food places I would visit prior to a return here.  Service and atmosphere are excellent minus the bugs food is C-.  The  couple sitting next to us ordered a sandwich to share the each took one bite  commented on how bad it was and left.  The Carne Asada Tacos had decent flavor and had its moments but nearly every bite was interrupted by a hard piece of chewy fat or something nasty.

Loved the ambiance, loved the food- particularly their coconut crusted stuffed calamari.  This appetizer is heaven.  Sea bass ceviche is delicious, goat cheese balls, mushrooms tacos, guacamole and black beans with pepitas.  All good.   Margaritas were good and strong.  Had a great time at the Yelp event hosted by SOL.  I just can't get that stuffed calamari out of my mind........  Perhaps I won't even sleep tonight thinking about it...... Yup.  A strong possibility.
This place is awesome the queso the guac and the tortilla soup are off the hook... And ask for Arnoldo he's an amazing waiter!!!

If Chipotle served margaritas then this place would be out of business. I was not impressed with anything. The one feature that I liked about the restaurant was part of the building design...the light mist on the outdoor dining.   Food flavor was mediocre. Ambiance was eh. Menu selection was limited.

Popped into Sol Mexican Cocina before a movie one night for Happy Hour.  We were seated quickly, which was great because there was only 15 minutes left for happy hour and we wanted to get our order in before it ended.  Our waitress was SOOO... nice!  She had a great personality and was attentive and informative, pretty much everything you would want in a waitress.  We ordered everything off the happy hour menu, so I can't comment on the main menu, but the happy hour food was great!  The Hubs and I shared the pork tacos and chicken tacos - he loved the chicken and I loved the pork - go figure.  We shared guacamole, which was good, but needed a bit more seasoning.  By adding the salsa, which was served with it, it became quite good.  BTW, love the unique "chips" that are served here... some of our had a ton of seasoning and others had only a little - we liked the ones with just a little.  We also shared the empanadas (I think that's what they were), anyway they were really good.  Overall, we had a great happy hour experience here.  It thoroughly redeemed my not so enthusiastic impression from the Yelp event here (just about the food, not the event).  I can't say enough great things about our waitress - can't remember her name, but she was awesome.  I am sure we will be back soon to try out their main menu.
Hey Hey Hey all my peeps if you want a great experience head on over to sol!!! Great drinks , great atmosphere and delicious food . A burst of flavor that pop in your mouth !!!

My first restaurant visit in Scottsdale was very memorable.  Sol has top notch service with a unique take on traditional chips and dip as starters.  We added the fresh guacamole and were not disappointed. I had the Big Mex salad as a main course and it is one of the best I've ever had.  I hope I have the opportunity to visit again.

SOL Mexican Cocina gets a deserved strong rating from this Yelper!   With a SOL location less than 10 miles from where I live it is funny I had to leave the state to try their brand of Mexican for the first time, bit I am glad I did. I found myself at SOL to attend a business dinner in their backroom with several of co-workers recently and to be fair, the visit was almost entirely positive. The service was both professional and nimble and the kitchen seemed to be firing on all cylinders throughout my meal.  The Guacamole SOL was a Tequila laced version of this Mexican favorite and featured mango, goat cheese, pepitas peppered with cilantro.  The mango adds a nice fresh and acidic kick that really calmed down the Tequila's edge.   For an entree, I decided on trying the grilled Kobe Skirt Steak which arrived cooked to the perfect medium rare. A "Waygu-style" (read: NOT Kobe) cut ot Skirt Steak is plated along with a cilantro sauce, tomatillo salsa, grilled cebollitas & avocado. I was impressed; the steak was juicy and delicious, something I seem to ever be able to find at Mexican themed establishments. In fact, I was nervous ordering but alas, SOL came through in spades.   One area of concern with SOL would be in the mixed drinks department as the Bourbon drinks we a tad weak and the Margarita tasted like something you would get in a red cup on a college campus. I switched to IPA quickly to curb disappointment.   SOL Mexican Cocina is one of those 3 to 4 star "tweeners" but I figure the service and fact they actually know how to cook a steak medium rare deserves rounding up.
Good food. Loved the chips, salsa and the beans. The corn was so yummy! I had a pork carnitas burrito. It was very good.

If I could do zero stars I would have. Felt ignored by the bartender Gio. I sent back back corn tortillas with the appetizer, why not warn me your tacos were only corn tortillas. Then you ignored me and I couldn't even order a replacement meal. Excellent food, terrible service. So bumbed was really looking forward to this place.

Great restaurant for date night. Fantastic ambience, helpful service, outstanding margaritas (try the Watermelon - it was so refreshing) & delicious food. Interesting spin on Mexican - enjoyed the grilled corn & Sol Guac appetizers & tacos. Black bean sides are to die for. I'll be back!

Went for the first time last night and I have to say... I am not a fan. I went with a friend of mine and when we first arrived they said it would be an hour in a half wait. We decided to put our name in and go sit at the bar (and if we got tired of waiting we would just go somewhere else). We ordered our first drinks. I bought the house margarita... and it was one of the worst tasting margaritas I have ever had. Normally with margaritas they are to sour... but this margarita tasted like straight tequila. I asked them to add some sour mix and the bartender looked at me like I had 10 heads (and he didnt do it). He pretended not to hear me. We only had to wait about an hour to be seated. The ambiance of the restaurant is great. The service was great as well. But the food was so so. The guacamole is tasteless and they give these crazy homemade tortilla looking hollow disks. When I tried to break the tortilla up, it just crumbled into crumbs. It was nearly impossible to eat the guac with these things. All I wanted was some real chips. I ended up getting beer battered fish tacos and they were decent... just not wonderful. The portion size was decent. Overall... I wont be going back anytime soon. I am sure that there are better mexican restaurants in the area.

Sat at the bar on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. Nice place with a live cover band playing 90s hits and a friendly bartender.  Food had great flavor and I highly recommend the panuchos and sweet corn appetizers.

Boo. I hate being disappointed and Sol did just that. The patio is great but close to Scottsdale Road so you are hearing the constant traffic. Not even the music (which was a great touch) could block it out. I don't like cilantro so call me stupid for going to a "Mexican Cocina" but when I tell most places if they can make something without cilantro they are accommodating. Here I was told that the chef doesn't like making changes to his recipes. Finally after us pleading with our waiter, he asked the kitchen and they were able to make us a cilantro-less guacamole that was actually quite tasty and is served with some yummy tostadas. For my entree I had some form of a shrimp cocktail that was decent and my friend had his $20 something lobster tacos that he had 2 bites of and said they were so bland they weren't worth eating. I would come back for one of their margaritas which looked delicious but that's about it.
We ate here on Saturday for lunch, and it was o-k...nothing extra special.  Atmosphere - was fun.  I was seated by the bathrooms, so probably not the best place - there was a lot of traffic.

Live music Sunday mornings for brunch!! Great vibe and $3 mimosas!  If you find yourself eating dinner there, you can enjoy authentic platillos such as Shrimp Chile Relleno, Pollo con Rajas, or some Carne Estofado.   You receive great, fun service whether you sit at the bar or grab a table...
Went here last night with a friend and had a perfect dinner out! The food was AMAZING and the service was SPECTACULAR!! Rodrigo was such a delight and very knowledgeable.
If you come here you have got to try the Sloppy Jose and a frozen beer! We came in today for the first time and Veronica was our server on the patio and she was great...we will totally be back.

"I can't move the sun."   Second time here. First time we just had very rude service. This time it was one of the worst I've ever experienced.  We were seated in the bar area. Restaurant not too busy. Plenty of other seats. The sun was blinding my friend's wife and it finally was too much. We very politely asked to be moved and it was an ordeal. 5 or 6 people involved and ultimately the short haired blonde woman said rudely,   "We can't move the sun. It will be gone in 5 minutes."   Wow. I know, right? I can't believe we stayed after that. There were so many empty seats not in the sun. Just her attitude was really unusually bad and I'm as laid back a guy as they come.  Then one of the 4 entrees was wrong. Not a huge deal. They were nice and quickly brought out the correct dish.  At the beginning of our meal I ordered a jalapeño cucumber margarita. Supposed to be delicious. Once our meal was over I figured they just forgot about it. No big deal. As we were about to get the check, the same short haired blonde women brought the drink. This is 15 minutes later mind you. She knew I was going to ask her to take it back.  "Really???" she said as rude as they come with a loud gasp and a sigh.   She did take the drink back.  Then I asked the same short haired blonde woman for our check. She said ... "GOOD." - Wow, I know. She said good when I asked nicely for our check. I said, "Excuse me?" and she then said quietly, "Sure."  I can't believe it. Still left 20% tip as the main waitress was nice and it wasn't her fault that her surrounding staff were all the rudest people you'll meet.   The food is great , but I will never go back there again. You couldn't pay me to go back again. I love mexican food , like to tip nicely, and live up the street. What a shame they couldn't put people in the restaurant who even had a mild interest in being there.

Had the fish tacos. They were nothing special .  Had them sent back because there was no flavor to them. Cocktails were good. Too small and overpriced. Probably will never return to this restaurant. We were very disappointed.
Awesome guacamole. Vampiro taco is a must have. good beer and tequila selection

This was one of our least favorite meals in AZ. It's sort of non traditional Mexican food...like they took your favorites and tried to get fancy, resulting in a twist we didn't really like. For example, they give you a brown sauce instead of salsa for your chips. Plus a lot of the chips come out looking burnt, but it's a seasoning they use that makes them taste different. Great location, cool restaurant, but wouldn't go back.
Best Mexican place I've ever eaten at. Nothing else to say; try it and you'll be convinced too.
Fine location, fine dinning, for vegetarians less choices but veggies quesadilla is the best I ever had.
Really top quality Mexican fare and fairly priced. Great location with lots of seating and very nice Happy Hour with a really nice bartender. Get the peel and eat shrimp!

Margaritas are overly sweet.  Service is annoying and average.  But worst of all this place could kill you.  Despite being a supposed high end Mexican restaurant it seems they feel the need to fry the chips and taco shells in the same oil that they fry the shrimp.  Who does this?   If you have a shellfish allergy your out in half the menu.  If you don't, you can enjoy that lovely fried shrimp flavor.  The rest of the food is mediocre at best.  Skip this chain and find a local legit place.   Not worth the hassle.
They may be known for their speciality drinks but as the food goes it is by far the WORST Mexican/Latin food I have had anywhere. It is way over priced and poor quality. Don't waste your money here.
Every visit we've had really good food and great service. Chips are just okay though. Otherwise a great place for a date night.

I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a while and it did not disappoint!   The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the "chips" ... I know they want to different, but those huge tortillas just don't cut it for me.  They are huge and hard...I prefer them thin and crispy.  Other than that... the food and service were great! Beautiful decor, the goat cheese enchiladas were amazing, and the rice was the bomb!

I don't eat dairy so I asked for the tortilla soup without cheese. It had giant spoonfuls of melted cheese under the broth on the bottom of the bowl. The business associate I met with for lunch was completely out of water as well. The restaurant wasn't very busy to be ignoring drinks. By the time the waiter came back, I just said to forget it. I don't understand how hard it is to do "no cheese". I hope I don't get sick.

Dining alone is not always fun but can be enjoyable- even if it was Saturday night.  The staff did a great job to make me feel welcome.   Chips, salsa & beans arrived. Both had good flavor but no heat. Was given some in house haberno  sauce, which was all it needed. The chips were whole corn tortillas. Too big for my taste and a little sharp on inside of mouth.   My chipolte  shrimp salad was terrific with no dressing. Used some of the salsa instead. Shrimp were a little on the small side but not overcooked. The roasted corn and other veggies on a bed of arugula had lots of flavor.  The salad was HUGE. Picture a box of arugula in the grocery store. Easily shared by 4 people as a starter.   Tried to order a margarita with their special reposado but not sure what happened. Just asked for tequila, aa little lime juice and salt. Nothing else. The result was disappointing. It tasted like lime juice with a splash of tequila.  Inquired with server, but he said it was prepared exactly as I asked.  No offer for anything else.   Will go again during my visit.

Came here hungry after flying in from the east coast. Ate early around 4:30 and it was not crowded. Started with a big basket of fresh chips and salsa. Watch out because salsa has a kick! I had a shrimp Chile relleno with a nice side of rice and beans. Plenty of vegetarian options that my family loved. Would definitely go back

First of all, best Mojitos! It's hard to find a good Mojito in this town for some reason, but Sol does it right. The tacos are great and the ambiance is way cool. The service was a little slow and we had to ask for our server a couple times. We were there on a Monday night and it was not very busy so I'm not sure what the deal was there. I have been in on the weekends as well but have only sat at the bar, which is cool as it's one that's inside/outside. They're typically packed on the weekends and I would recommend a reservation. Overall great spot in the Quarter for Mexican with an upscale feel without the upscale price!

We came for the Happy Hour specials and we really enjoyed it! The Skinny Margaritas were tasty enough for seconds. We had the tacos and the corn as well as the watermelon copitas. The watermelon had a very interesting Mexican salty sauce with limes that finished it well. Very refreshing! Our waitress, Kassandra, recommended the corn and took it off the cob as the table, a nice touch. It complimented the tacos well and was a great sharing dish. Kassandra did a great job with our table, explaining the specialties and making great recommendations! We will be back!

This place has a convenient location in Scottsdale Quarter.  We walked up asking for a table and were told it would be about 20 minutes.  We found a couple of seats at the bar right away and were able to get served very quickly there.  The house margarita was a good choice.  We ordered street tacos for our dinner.  My wife had carne asada and I had carnitas.  Both were very good.  I will say we were surprised that they had quite a bit of heat to them for this being more of a commercial restaurant rather than local/authentic.    Our bartender did a nice job getting our drinks made and the food came out quickly.  The restaurant was very busy with nearly all the tables and seats full.  We would definitely come back again.

Had lunch here last week on a whim. My friend and I wanted Mexican and it had good reviews. I had the shrimp and avocado salad and it was very good. I didn't like the overly large thick chips. They were lacking in flavor as was the salsa. I didn't think the two salsas were that good. The table side guacamole was good but also on the bland side. Vibe wise the place was nice. I would have given 4 stars if the chips, salsa and guacamole were really stellar. I would eat there again.
This was honestly so incredibly delicious. Drinks were on point. I loved the bean dip. My favorite app was the shrimp. Really good food and excellent service.

I love this place or I should say I love their ceviche!  If you like ceviche, you MUST try the Hot and Raw Tropical Ceviche; it is amazing!  Also, be conservative when adding in the fresh diced habanero pepper that comes on top....it will sneak up on you as you get to the bottom of the bowl.   If you are not into spice Sol has, I think, four kinds of ceviche and I highly recommend 3 of them (not a fan of the shrimp one).  Another brownie point for Sol is their complimentary, yummy, unique 'chips and salsa'.  Many Mexican places have moved more towards making you pay for the chips and salsa, so I appreciate them keeping with my all-time favorite Mexican restaurant tradition :)  I have had a few of their entrees as well and the food is superbly made and beautifully presented.  They definitely add a little extra 'Sol flare' to all their food, which usually isn't a bad thing, but you should not be expecting 'traditional' Mexican food while dining at Sol.  My servers and bartenders have always been knowledgeable about the food and pleasant- the other reason I keep coming back apart from the ceviche!  In terms of ambiance this is definitely chic for a Mexican Restaurant- no tacky bright decor and neon lights here!  The patio is also very inviting with misters during the hot summers and it is attached to one side of the bar, making it rather lively if it is hopping.    My one complaint about Sol is the prices are a bit steep for Mexican food (around $13 for 3 tacos, entrees $15-$30 & house margarita $8+), but I guess they do have to pay rent at the Scottsdale Quarter so I will cut them slack on that.  I should also mention they have a decent happy hour from 3-6 everyday, so if you are on a tighter budget you should go then.  Unfortunately my favorite, the Hot and Raw Ceviche, is not on the Happy Hour menu.

Started lunch with the guacamole and it was probably the best we have ever had. We then tried the street tacos, I had pork and the wife had beef. We thought they were ok, maybe could have been a little spicier. Service was very attentive without being too assertive. Will eat here again.

In scottsdale on a work vacation and lucked upon this place during dinner break. The food was great and the service was fantastic. Our server was engaging and efficient and she steered us towards great choices. She comped us a guac starter upon discovering we were visitors from the north and it really set the mood for a fantastic dinner.

I have come here several times in the last year and each time is as good as the last.  The food is just enjoyable, I always get the shrimp taco's.  Staff are always nice and very helpful.  They have  nice outdoor seating although we stay inside it looks very nice especially at this time of year.  Unless something drastic changes, I plan on going back.

This place is a little pricey for Mexican, so hubby and I went for Happy Hour to check it out, and we loved it! Friendly, professional staff and a nice, upscale environment. Excellent Baja-style food -- fresh and flavorful, with no cheddar cheese! Tacos were a highlight, as was the guac. Of course, Margaritas are not Mexican but we enjoyed our share of those, too. We'll for sure be back, and this will be the place we'll take out of town guests who have a yen for Mexican.
Amazing food but service is a tad lackluster. Been here many times and the bartenders ignore customers! No eye contact, walk away, etc.  The food and ambience makes up for the service.

My my my. YUM. I consider myself a Tortilla Soup aficionado and HANDS DOWN theirs is the BEST EVER. Flavors of salsa, sides, soup, tacos..... fresh and inventive.  And our bill was crazy affordable.  Awesome happy hour offering. Service was friendly and attentive. In short,  our new favorite Mexican restaurant!!

My husband and I came to beautiful Arizona for a weekend gateway and decided to try this restaurant based on the reviews. We came to Arizona without our children and were looking forward to a nice sit down dinner to celebrate our anniversary.  We walked in and were received by the hostess who (1)didn't welcome us, (2)was so serious as if she wasn't happy that we had walked in, (3)a simple "hello" would have been nice. I have worked in restaurants before and it's very important to acknowledge the customer(s) and make them feel welcome and she did the opposite. I totally understand that we all have our bad days but it's important not to make others feel unwelcome.  The Food was amazing and our waiter was very helpful. I was debating between the Mexx salad and the Corn, poblano & mushroom taco plate so our waiter suggested that I get the salad and top it with corn, poblano & mushroom. The salad was perfect!!! All the ingredients came together nicely and I can truly say that it's one of the best salads I've ever had My husband ordered the Chicken Desmadres plate and he was very satisfied. Once again the food was amazing and I would definitely recommend this place. It would have been a 5 star review if it hadn't been for the hostess.

Feeling sad, let down by the world? Despondent over a recent hangnail or paper cut? Angry that your boss ignored your fine work yet again? All of these and countless more would be fine reasons to come to SOL and have a Mango Con Chile Frozen Margarita. Sweet, spicy, goes down real smooth. And then you need to have another. And then another. And then another. Unrelatedly, you should definitely have someone drive you here and away from here.  The food was good, I think. I was drunk, I don't really remember. I think I recall it being good. There was some shrimp appetizer where you have to pull off the shrimp's heads. Hey, they're already dead, I say. They don't feel it. They had some delicious corn appetizer, too, and then these cool taco things you can get a la carte or grouped for you, if I recall correctly. Again, I was drunk.  Nice ambiance, friendly waiter. And yeah, get that drink or three of them.
Had the street corn app and sweet potato/black bean taco. Both were awesome! Great atmosphere too.

For me the highlight was the sweet potato and black bean tacos... I am not a vegetarian at all but these things were amazing!  The black bean dip they give you with the chips and salsa is fantastic.  Come topped with pepitas and has a smooth smokey flavor.  The chips are fine but forgettable unless you top them with the dip.  Service is really good which for me is a major draw.  A place with bad service will never survive so these guys are good to go.

I'm far too impatient to wait the wait that's necessary to get a table for dinner or late night service, but I've enjoyed many lunches here. My co-workers and I love the pomegranate and traditional guacamole and chips. I've had their pork and fish tacos and love them both. My favorite is really their black beans. So yummy! They're a little pricey but definitely a great choice when you're looking for something with a Mexican flair near the Quarter.

SO OVERPRICED. Service was good, the food wasn't anything special. We shared a shrimp burrito and out bill was still outrageous for what it was. The chips are whole tortillas which makes eating awkward, you have to break them or *gasp* double dip ;)

My sisters and best friends decided to have a girls trip to Scottsdale. We wanted to try Sol and are we ever so glad we did! The ambiance was relaxing and inviting. Not to mention the inside was beautifully decorated. Now for the best part....the food!!!! All 7 of us girls ordered different dishes and we loved everything. I ordered the chipotle ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. The short rib entree was so tender and flavorful. If you're considering trying a restaurant in Scottsdale. Service was on point. Thank you Sol staff :)
Came in for a drink and some great food. Service was great. Thanks Alberto. We'll be back

This restaurant has great food and ambiance... although unless you want to pay top dollar for mediocre good and drinks you better get there before 6pm for the happy hour which does have quite a good a nice array of tasty items ti choose from. The Firecracker Chicken Quesadilla is definitely gonna light u up and my husband enjoyed the tacos... he liked the octopus one the best!! The quac and shrimp were my favorite.

Alberto was our server and he was fantastic! Very attentive and informative of the menu. The skinny marg was strong and fresh tasting with fresh squeezed lime juice. Got the special guac which was great and the fish and steak tacos. All was good! Would come back again!

I was looking forward to this place having eaten at their Newport Beach location. I was mildly disappointed. The Newport location is much better and the value of the food relative to the price is poor. While the food was good, it wasn't great. The price was too expensive for Mexican food - you're paying for their overhead rather than the food.

I went there for some drinks Wally was my bartender the dudes knowledge on margaritas was about inflated as his ego the man can make a mean margarita and make a conversation with anyone Great service great drinks great food
The goat cheese appetizer is my favorite thing ever! They're vegetarian tacos are super flavorful and the fish is always fresh and delicious. Highly recommend.
The food was amazing! Our waiter was great! Plenty of mimosas and amazing food. The goat cheese appetizer is the best thing ever.
Best fish taco in town by far! Everything is fresh and delicious and Arnoldo is a wonderful host. If you have not tried this, you are missing out.

Service was outstanding !  Food was delicious.  I had the carnitas tacos.  My son had the kids bean burrito and it was huge for a child portion.  My husband had both of the fish tacos. The breaded ones were better.  My daughter had the chicken tacos they were a little dry.  However, the meat was grilled so that is to be expected.  The chips and salsa were good too.  Everything was homemade.  Will go back soon

Fun atmosphere, food good/average, service mediocre, great salsa! Definitely order the sol guacamole with the mango, tequila and goat cheese. Missing one star due to waitress taking way too long to check on us throughout our meal and the food was all good but not "wow" for a foodie. I wish I could give it 3.5 since I feel 3 is unfair and 4 is too generous. 4 it is.

Great central Mexico food. I had the shrimps tacos which are flat out flavor. I have had many dishes here and all are good. Keep in mind, this is not a typical Mexican joint. It is higher in price and unique flavors.   Drawback is the chips and salsa, good, just not what I crave.   Plus is a very cool vibe and amazing flavors. Also, great margs.
Our group of five had a very good experience at Sol. Great atmosphere and service, but expect to spend $30 for a drink and entree. Their chips and been dip are excellent!

So disappointing!  We have eaten here two previous times and it was wonderful, so we were anxious to bring our guests who were visiting from NY here for a great meal. Virtually everything was off. The service staff appeared to be confused about who would be taking our orders, serving our drinks and bringing our food to the table. Consequently, some of the drinks that we ordered never arrived and we received our food orders in shifts!  We were a table of six. Three people were served their meals first. 18 minutes later the other three orders were brought to the table. One of the fish tacos was so raw, it was more like sushi. When our guest finally tracked down a waitress and showed her the taco the waitress agreed it was nearly raw and said she would like to show it to the chef. Taking the plate along with the utensils she went to the kitchen. She returned a short time later and expressed with some exasperation the chef said "some people like it that way, but he will cook another one the way it should be".  Really?  Shouldn't that have been the goal the first time? A taco appeared about 10 minutes later, but now she had no silverware. Fortunately one of the other guests had a somewhat clean fork. Since we were all finished, she ate alone while we waited for her.  I can't help but wonder if their is a new chef and an absent manager. What a shame.

What do I start with..!?! This just hit a spot.. great atmosphere, great service... food was so delicious!! My favorite mexican joint in Scottsdale from now on.. it's a must to try.. don't forget to order margaritas!!

I cannot say enough how much I enjoyed my food at this restaurant. I grew up in AZ and am quite picky about my Mexican food and this place impressed me. It's not traditional Sonoran Mexican food, but trust me you won't be disappointed. We started with fresh guacamole, which of course was amazing. I had the carnitas street tacos with rice and beans. This was hands down the BEST most flavorful carnitas I have ever had in my life. So delicious! I'm not usually very impressed with rice and beans, but the flavor infused in these was so good. Just the right amount of spice to give a good amount of heat. I wanted to lick my plate clean! I loved it all. The service was also wonderful, our waiter was awesome. This place is a must try

Came back and was a bit disappointed.  We sat on the patio and were forgotten about for long periods of time.  The tacos weren't as good as the last time and the burnt shell chips were just as bad and even more oily than the last time.  For the price and quality this place just isn't all that great.  Not sure we would come back again.  The michelada was good.  Thats a plus.
Food did not sit well with our group a few of them were sick the next day. Could have been an off night but we won't be back.

SOL Mexican Cocina was recommended by a local. It's located in the Scottsdale Quarter next to the garage. We went here on a weeknight and there were plenty of parking. The parking was free and valet option was available. They had initially told us that there were a 20 minutes wait; however, we were seated within 3 minutes.   They had a vast selection of margaritas but the beer selection was poor. I can't drink margaritas (tequila = poison to my body) but my friend's margarita looked really good. I had the Carne Asada Burrito. It was the size of a small baby. I was able to bring at least half the burrito home as leftovers, really good as leftovers! The server offered us an option to have it like an enchilada and have the sauce all over the burrito. I definitely took her up on that.  Overall, the service was good and dinner was pricey. $24 with food, beer, and tip. I suppose it's reasonable since this is located in an upscale dining and shopping area. I would come back!

Top grade margaritas, and some excellent guacamole and ceviche.  Also, the tortilla chips are huge and flavorful.  A fun place, and I had chicken ensamole (might be misspelled--it was an enchilada with mole sauce) and that was awesome. Something I'd never had in a Mexican place before.

I just had the duck taco dish.  Basically you get a duck leg and thigh  three tacos, avocado, onions, an orange slice and a blackberry/tequila/errrano sause .  You break up the duck and build the taco DELICOUS  Add some of the pomegranete guac on it and u have a great meal.

First and foremost, the only reason I gave this place a one star rating was because the decor was pleasant to the eye and the owner and or manager came by to refill our drinks. The meal was pedestrian, the wait staff was curt and only polite because it was their job. Finally the hostess hated her life and had an attitude problem because of it. Will not be returning, worst experience I've had. Don't come here,  go to chipotle instead.
Delishious food in a great atmosphere.  Rodrigo was most accommodating and very pleasant.  Would definitely recommend and would come back!

This fresh spin on classic Mexican dishes make this place worth the trip. The menu is sprinkled with all the wonderful foods one who grew up in the south would attribute to that oh so delicious Mexican food they came to enjoy growing up. However, the rich seasoning, zesty sauces, and overall lack of salt make the dishes feel like the splash of jumping into a cold spring on a devilishly hot summer day. I like to get the cheese enchiladas, but let me tell you, my friends, Dorothy is far off the path of yellow brick cheese with these babies. They're rich and creamy but the balance that the verde sauce brings to the concoction edges off the deep lethargic that comes with overindulgence. Also, the balance of corn tortillas and goat cheeses leave your belly full, without the typical gastro-regrets that follow Mexican food. No sir this is not your typically cheap, greasy, Mexican food place. That being said, the waitress admitted to a lot of their dishes being pre concocted and thereby unalterable because of that. So if you are traveling with allergies, or aversions, keep in mind these delicious dishes are not very customizable. Furthermore, no salt goes into anything, they do bring a small plate of it to the table for your convenience. But as previously mentioned don't come here expecting greasy, salty, delicious Mexican dishes.. Instead, meet their estranged sisters who carry delicate, intentional flavors into your favorite labeled dishes.
I love this place!! The mango and goat cheese guacamole is a must. If you want to have Mexican food with a"twist" this is your place. The outside patio is great and the service is fantastic.
The chilaquiles verde for brunch is Amazing with the country potatoes, a nice mimosa and great company from the bartenders nick and mike!

The best mexican restaurant in the entire arizona! The tacos, salad, drinks, and the desert was spectacular! I definitely recommend this place if you want to try good mexican food! Looks Lovely inside and the waiter and manager honestly gave us the best service!

Was looking for a taco tuesday spot near our hotel and found this restaurant on Yelp although I did not see their taco tuesday specials.  We came for dinner around 6pm and found a spot on the third level of the park structure.  We were seated immediately and were pleasantly surprised to see the taco tuesday menu!    Our server was friendly and brought out some chips. We started off with some margaritas which were around $5-7 each.  The chips were delicious! We loved them and even asked for a 2nd basket. We didn't end up finishing because our tacos were brought out shortly after.  I had 2 carne asada and 2 carnitas street tacos with only onions and cilantro. My coworkers also ordered the carnitas, chicken, and shrimp cocktel.  We all enjoyed the food, especially the carnitas and finished everything!  Our bill came to about $45 which wasn't too bad and we left feeling happy and satisfied! Great choice for some tacos if you're in the area!

Fairly pricey Mexican food...except on good ole Taco Tuesday. The lemon chicken tacos were 2 for $3 and I should have gotten four. Big strips of white chicken, some onions and lemon flavor make these tacos simple, but very satisfying. We also tried the naked guac and a couple of $5 margarita's on the happy hour menu. Both had no issues and the drinks were good and strong as well. Unusual start with those tostada chips and the the bean dip and salsa, but once again these two free starters were top notch.    Minus a star for the close tables and seating. Really don't care about Little Johnny's day at school, but it is tight seating up front, so grab a table in back for privacy. The music guy was a nice change, but did not drown out the people right next to me.

Michael took care of us this evening and everything was fantastic!!! Food was incredible. He sold us on all the goodies-- calamari, goat cheese app- chipotle shrimp burritos! Mango salad! We ate so much and everything was DELICIOUS!   YUMMY and served with great attention to detail! We will be back!

I can't tell you the number of times that I've wanted to partake in happy hour but the bar tables are all taken while the rest of the restaurant is nearly empty and the hostess looks at me with an awkward smile.  Annoying.      Such an occasion happened earlier this week and the hostess promptly grabbed the happy hour menu and seated us a table-table.  High points for that one.    Drinks are delicious and I highly recommend the cucumber jalapeno margarita.  They bring a neat little array of sauces and spices for the chips.  My vampire taco was delicious.    Great experience and I will definitely return!

My hubby and I were looking for a good Mecican restaurant by our hotel the Westin. Sol definitely delivered! We ordered the corn appetizer, each had our own taco plates and sangria. everything was delicious. Our waiter  Rodrico was friendly, attentive and great. The atmosphere at Sol is inviting yet modern. We enjoyed the meal and service. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for good fresh food without the high prices of deseo.

Hey everybody,veggie blogger here! Not sure when the definition of vegetarian meant load up on black beans but Sol practices it.  Ordered a grilled veg burrito. Sounded good on the menu since the burrito supposedly should have had onions, peppers, pico de gallo, sauce, and beans.   Dissecting my burrito I ended up with an overflow of black beans and onions on the side with nothing else in the middle. To add to that, I had more beans on the plate with some rice.  Overall the burrito was cooked right to my liking. The salsa that came with chips was flavourful and spicy. Black beans was cooked just that there was too much of it. I would have liked more veggies than beans.   The Don Julio margarita was excellent!! The rice on the side was tasty. Though most of the people on our group didn't enjoy their meal, I think it was good for a one time experience.   But I don't think it's a restaurant I would look forward to coming back for a second time. This place in the Scottsdale quarter was average.

SOL is the best Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale.. I  ask for Cassandra if you can. She is beautiful inside and out. The food represents the best of classic street food and modern cuisine. Highly recommend trying the jalapeño sauce.
