Overall, I wasn't impressed, but it also wasn't totally awful. The ambiance was great, beautiful copper decor throughout. Our waiter was great. The complementary salsa was delicious, but the tostada style chips were a bit inconvenient and I didn't love the seasoning- kind of bitter chili powder. I got the chicken tacos with rice and beans on the side. I find the meal to be under-salted to my taste, but there was no salt on any of the tables. The flavors were bland in my meal.

I had dinner here two nights in a row, while I was in town from Dallas. The first night I tried the sweet potato tacos and mushroom tacos. Bot were excellent, not bland as you usually expect from veggie tacos. I had no need to pour any hot sauce on the tacos. The grilled corn was excellent as well. The second night I was joined by my coworkers, they ordered various tacos but I had the Cheese enchiladas. They were tasty!! You could taste the fresh cilantro in the sauce, not overly cheesy. The side of rice and black beans were good too. Everyone was full and raving about the food by the end of the meal.

Not bad, but the highlight of the meal was the chips and salsa.  I ordered the shrimp chile relleno and there were maybe three shrimp in the whole dish.  Our server was really attentive, but the food was just okay, and everything was pricey.  We had a nice time, but we probably won't eat here again.

We came for dinner on Saturday evening and were greeted warmly by the hostess and promptly seated. Our waitress was Amy who was very attentive, efficient and sweet. They bring chips, salsa, and bean dip to the table when you are seated. A Mexican restaurant must have great chips and salsa and SOL hits the mark completely. I ordered the grilled steak burrito with black beans and spicy slaw.  My wife ordered quesadillas with the sides and all of our food was excellent.  This perhaps may be the best Mexican food we have had in 5 years.   The food tasted fresh and the portions were huge. The manager introduced himself and he couldn't have been nicer, unless of course he bought a round of drinks.  LOL This is an upscale restaurant so the food isn't cheap but it's not overpriced either. This is my new favorite place in Scottsdale.

Came around 7:00 pm on a Friday and were seated right away. I got the pork carnitas grilled burrito and it was delicious! Stuffed with so much meat which is great. I hate getting burritos that is mostly beans/rice/fillers instead of meat.  I didn't care too much for the black beans side, I wish there were another option of beans but it wasn't the worse thing. My husband got some fish tacos and he liked them although it wasn't as filling as my burrito. Awesome atmosphere, I love the decoration and feel of the restaurant.  Not super expensive, although I added like $1 to my burrito by getting it "wet" (sauce on top) and another $2 for some melted cheese. Worth it! Our server was very nice, not overbearing but came by often enough to fill drinks etc. Will definitely be going back!
Had great service and wonderful food.  Waiter made excellent recommendations.  We were not disappointed. Can't wait to go back!

I came here with a group of friends and was highly disappointed. I'm not sure what everyone else was tasting, but this was NOT at all good food. Let alone to be called "Mexican" restaurant. Of course given the area, the food was overpriced for the taste and quality of it. The salsa was watered down and the chips looked like Tostada's instead of chips. I would rather go to Blanco Tacos and Tequilas with better food than to visit this place again. On a good note, the server was nice and also cute.

I wish there were two separate ratings, one for service and one for the food itself. Five star food and three star service. You might think that would average out to four stars but to me, that's why I go out to eat. To have someone take care of me because I cook at home most of the time. I had a fish taco with Gobernador sauce.  Amazing flavored. Their chips are good too... not greasy.

We stopped in here for a late lunch after a long day of travel in crowded airports with 5 billion rude people (ok...maybe only 3 billion) and we were CRANKY. Between the super-friendly manager, and our amazing server Rodrigo...we were smiling and laughing in no time. Then the food came.... two words... Taco Vampiro! This thing was a crazy good combination of flavors that defy true explanation. My husband ordered the Fish Tacos Zarandeado and would have you believe they were better than my Vampiro.....as if.  Extra tip: treat yourself to a shot of the Clase Azul Reposado tequila... very good!

We had a great experience here. The guacamole was delicious and the chips and salsa also came to the table with hot tasty bean dip. Our server was great. Also had the ala carte fish taco which was really good but felt the price was a bit high. Maybe just not used to Scottsdale pricing. Family members thought it was a bit too dark inside. But it was quiet, comfortable and convenient from the Westin Hotel.

Have visited this restaurant 3 times now & all were good experiences.  I enjoy the skinny margarita with a spicy salt rim.  We ordered several items from Yelp reviews, all were very good.  Spicy Ceviche was excellent- but really spicy! We will go back I'm sure

Great Mexican restaurant at Kierland Commons. Especially tasty was the special guacamole with goat cheese and the chili relleno. The service was both friendly and efficient. The short rib barbacoa was fork tender. The sides with the meals were traditional (rice send black beans) and nuevo (quinoa and slaw). The size of the plates were generous. I will definitely check out their location in Playa Vista upon returning to Los Angeles.

Went with friends to Taco Tuesday. When we arrived we were told there was a 20 min wait for either outside or insidde. The inside was totally empty. The hostess said there was a big party and the tables needed to be cleaned, it doesn't take 20 min to wipe down 6 tables. Once we sat down, it took at least 10 min for the server to acknowledge us. When we finally ordered the server was not very friendly. I wanted items on the Taco Tuesday menu and didn't know that carne asada tacos were different than carnitas, both are steak tacos. Also, didn't know that sweet corn is different than street corn. A good server would ask if someone was ordering off the Taco Tuesday menu if the rest of the table is. He did not check back with us once the food was delivered. We had to hunt down the server to get our check and when we told the server that we wanted to split the check she automatically divided it 3 ways, never asking how it was to be split.  I have come here a few times for work and had no issues. Coming here on a personal visit, it sucked.

This place was amazing!! Our waiter Antendo (sorry, excuse my horrid spelling) was just the best! He was very professional and knew the whole menu. He treated us very kindly and was very prompt on filling our waters and getting the food out quickly. He was so sweet! He even made my friend and me cute drinks and took pictures of us. Not to mention the food was amazing! I ordered a quesadilia and it was soo good. I looked too good to eat, but trust me it was even better to eat! I will be coming back soon, and i suggest it to everyone. :) great great food and service. Oh yeah, their cheese is also super good. #ali

Wasn't overly impressed with the food at Sol Mexican Cocina. Went for Happy hour. Ordered a margarita and chicken tortilla soup. Although the soup was flavorful, is was small and not very filling. The atmosphere is cool, indoor/outdoor seating. Pretty busy for a Wed. 3/5 stars
Poor service, sub par food, decent cocktails. There is definitely some room for improvement.
This review is for Happy Hour only. The drinks were good. The food was OK.  Nice place.
Food was below average and the restaurant seems dark and dirty. Service also below average. Wasn't impressed.

The food and service at Sol are excellent!  I'd like to thank Sharon who was extremely helpful to me when coordinating a business dinner for 20 people from my company's management team in October.  We enjoyed the atmosphere of the back room, attentive service, and variety of great food that left everyone full at the end of dinner.

Love the atmosphere ,service staff all professional and informational. The music by solo guitar player was awesome! The food was superb. I tried so many new things..all terrific! We will be coming back for sure !

We had lunch at SOL and were pleasantly surprised. Our server recommended the special tacos ordered individually. In particular the vampiro. He was right. It was tasty and unique. The meat was tender and the toppings were abundant without being over powering. Our children ordered off the kids menu and were happy with their chicken and cheese tacos and red rice. As a starter you get complimentary tortilla chips and a couple of dips. One dip in particular was quite tasty but garlicky. Overall  a tasty meal and decent service.
My favorite place for vegetarian tacos. The Clase Azul margarita is way better and about the same price and quantity as two house margaritas. I love the black bean dip.

While the food is good,  the service here leaves  a lot to be desired.  Took 10+ minutes to get a drink (multiple times), nobody cleaned our table,  and we didn't have anyone come by to see if we needed anything. Too bad because could be a good place.
The food was amazing but wasn't your traditional Mexican food. They added a lighter twist. The atmosphere was great and service was quick. A must go to in Scottsdale, Arizona! Sadly no beer on draft.

This place has great food!  They start with a healthy version of chips and salsa. Baked tortillas and warm puréed black beans and salsa. Delic!!   I've dined here several times, and each time the food and the service have been excellent.   Super nice ambiance, and they have a great Happy Hour!!

Very nice ambiance. They sometimes have live music. Love their salsa and bean dip. Guacamole is amazing . They have a nice happy hour and I also recommend the brunch. Their frozen mango margarita used to be really good but last time I tried  it, i couldn't taste the mango. Love the outside patio and very friendly staff.

I was actually quite impressed with this place. My sister and I stopped in for a quick lunch. We wanted something light and delicious. We were NOT disappointed. We had the seaBass ceviche appetizer. There could have been a bit for fish, but the flavor was delish! Reminds me of my favorite ceviche from Costa Rica. Then, we ordered,  FISH TACO 'GOBERNADOR' wild-caught fish, pan-roasted with lemon & garlic, on a taco dorado with cheese, salsa gobernador, avocado, onion & cilantro, pico & lettuce.  It was light and oh so yummy. The portions are small, but the food was great!

Great Easter brunch!  Ask for rolled quesadilla w huevos & carnitas :-)  Don Julio margarita martini style in a heavily salted glass.  Ah, life is good :-)  First time here I thought eh, 2 at best.  Then the Yelp party made me give it another shot.  It just keeps getting better, seriously.  Sol is in 4+ territory now!  Especially w the terrific live music  Taco Tuesday!  So fun.  The 3-piece band is terrific, I came for the food & drinks but am staying for the music!!  Place has become really quite good. And they have what I think is the best happy hour menu and drinks in the neighborhood.  Greg makes a great Don Julio skinny margarita!  Also love the carnitas tacos and shrimp cocktail (actually more of a ceviche)  Guitarist tonight playing alt rock tunes.  I'm really digging it!  This place is really growing on me. The drinks are quite solid, the food is lovely. Happy hour has some great deals and the chips and black bean dip with pumpkin seeds is incredibly addictive

Had a great time here last night for dinner. My favorite was the Shrimp Dorado taco. The taco was amazing. Also enjoyed my Blackberry Ginger Margarette perfect balance of ginger and fruit. The Sol guacamole is also a must have. Love the atmosphere and the decor. My only complaint was my husband's beans and rice were cold. They need to do a better job making sure these items are kept fresh. Other than that, it's a perfect place for a date night if you want a light meal.

We enjoyed everything we ate!  We had a party of 8 adults with 4 children.  "Spicy" is a little warmer than I'm use to and I can handle a little heat - I took cooling sips of my husband's margarita and all was well!  Nice restaurant - good food - excellent service.

I love their happy hour! Get the corralejo skinny margarita  (more booze same cost, hey I'm on a budget! And I want a good buzz) and the sol guacamole is to die for. Marlena is the coolest bartender. She really makes your experience fun and is super thoughtful. Sometimes I feel like bartenders are just in a bad mood, don't want to be there, not in this case! She is on her A game!   Super easy to park and just walk there. Scottsdale quarter doesn't charge for parking and it's easier than fighting for a spot at Kierland.   This was my second visit so I'm glad both times impressed me! I will be back next time I'm on vacation!

We were seated right away and the service was REALLY SLOW.  It took over 15 mins to get our drinks and about 1 hour for tacos and a quesadilla... Our drinks were never refilled and the waiter never came by once to ask how we were doing how the food tasted... My steak was still mooing! Gross! I ended up eating my kids quesadilla with chips and salsa.

We love this place. The corn was so delicious!  We also liked the tostada style chips they serve with their yummy salsa.  We went for an early Saturday night dinner, as this restaurant tends to get busy later.  I had a shrimp taco that was very good.
My first time here I had a blended Margarita and a taco via happy hour, I came back two days later and had the same thing. Great happy hour, great service, love it here.
Gr8 place for Mexican . Service was good. Drinks were good. Had a couple of the tacos. Very spicy which was gr8 and very filling . Highly recommend

Appetizers and drinks were good. Entrees were awful, service didn't seem interested in helping us. Actually sent an entree back, it was that awful. Place is cute and good ambiance, but all that stops There. Not much good to say about the place other than its cute and in a good location.

This has become our new favorite restaurant! The first time we came here we had the best tacos ever! Make sure you try the Kobe Steak Taco!! We have been here several times with different waiters, they have all been good with service. We usually ask for Garrett, we think he is newer, he is really polite and never lets my drink run low. I don't know how, but he remembered both my wife and I by name! The chips here are different, but very good!! I wish I had more of a chance at the bean dip, but my wife believes it is her personal dish every time... Garrett recommended the calamari to me, I don't know how they make it, but it is to die for and now we get it every time!! EAT HERE, YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED.
Amazing atmosphere, food is yummy, great quality, best service and staff, Arnoldo was our server and made our dining experience so enjoyable, highly recommended!!!

Olé! Not that I need a reason to go out for margaritas and tacos... but having Taco Tuesday as an excuse definitely helps! Aside from the other great places in the valley that have the amazing (and very dangerous) frozen margaritas, Sol has lip-smackingly delicious margaritas!   The moment you walk in and sit, one of the delightful staff members brings you a basket of fresh-out-of-the-fryer house-made tortilla chips with a delicious bean dip and mild salsa (so yum!) And on Taco Tuesday, the special is -- can you guess? TACOS!!! There are a handful of the tacos that are a "steal" on the special menu, and of course, the full menu is always an option if the special deals don't appeal to your tastebuds.   On this particular visit, my best friend and I needed to unwind, relax, and have some girl talk over tacos and margaritas. We both ordered a house margarita with no agave or simple syrup -- yes, we like our margaritas tart -- and we munched on the warm tortilla chips and the dips.   We decided we should get some tacos... because, Taco Tuesday... so I got two grilled chicken tacos and my best friend got two carne asada tacos. Oh.Em.Gee. These tacos are so good!!! Full of flavor, and they don't skimp on the meat! They also give you this amazing hot sauce that is sure to kick up the heat on the tacos a notch or two... or ten. Proceed with caution if you don't like spicy. I do, however, so I loaded up on the hot sauce and woo, it was tasty. (I may have chugged my margarita and water thereafter, but it was a good hurt. haha)  What I love about Sol is that you get good food at a great price, and the atmosphere is wonderful. The staff is superb, attentive, and kind as well. This wasn't my first time going to Sol, and it most certainly won't be my last!

I need to upgrade my review based on my constant return to their happy hour.  They have a very good one.  My hubby and I enjoy having an impromptu date sometimes in the middle of the week and we meet here for HH.  I love the Coctel de Camaron, it is exactly the way I love my shrimp ceviche.  Their skinny Margaritas are delicious, too, and since they are supposed to be skinny I guess you can afford two.  haha.  The other great idea they have now is their Tuesdays Tacos and Tequilas.  Last Tuesday it was a lot of fun.  They had live music and specials on tacos and margaritas.  I am glad I had signed up for their e-mail updates, that is how I learned about this new event.
The BEST calamari! The Con Queso is also excellent.  Best Friday night happy hour in north Scottsdale
Great tacos. Beef was delicious and tender. Shrimp taco was awesome as well. Hubby had the burrito and he really enjoyed it.Yummy house margarita. Salsa could use some work. Fun trendy atmosphere.

The tacos had good flavor but the corn tortilla fell apart pretty quickly and made it a bit hard to eat. We did enjoy the live music and intimate setting. We will return to try something else on the menu!
Best Tacos Ever!!! Point! Blank! Period!!!  and Stephanie our bartender/server went above and beyond in every way!!!! We are going to make this an annual tradition!!!!!!!

This place has gone downhill. I recently took an out of town visitor here and I was so disappointed. I have always loved their food and the margaritas there. We ordered margaritas this time and we got the upgraded tequila. $18 and they were so sweet we couldn't drink them, I swear there was not a bit of tequila in them. The food was still pretty good, that's why I gave them 3 stars. Last year I would have given them 5, but with expensive bad drinks, it ruined the experience. I don't mind paying for good tequila, but then give it to me. Armando was our waiter, he has served us there several times, he is so nice.

This place surprised me! Didn't know what to expect when we sat down but was pleasantly surprised. The bean dip served with the complimentary chips and salsa was awesome!! I've never had anything like it. I got the burrito bowl and loved how they didn't skimp on meat. Everyone else liked there food as well!

The server was very nice.  I ordered a $10 steak taco.  When it arrived I looked for a magnifying glass to find it on my plate.  I'm not a big eater but that was under sized and over priced.  A bad menu idea.

I absolutely love the ambience and music here. The food is fabulous and so are the drinks. It's dark and cave like but it also has a nice flare to the outdoor bar. The chorizo add chicken with a flour tortilla is the way to go. The guacamole is amazing as well. To top it off there drinks are delicious as well. Get a group of friends and come to sol. I'm yet to meet someone who doesn't love the place.
Enjoyed an amazing lunch of drinks and apps! Service was great! I highly recommend this place!

Hands down my favorite place to eat in North Scottsdale. I stay up at night laying in bed craving the guacamole, my taste buds have forever changed because of it. Get an organic margarita, best and most flavorful thing at Sol besides those sweet sweet sweeeeet potato tacos that you won't be able to stop ordering because they are so delicious. Sol will change your life, forever.

I work in The Quarter and all 3 times I've been to Sol service has been horrible! Last night was the last night I will go. It took my friend 45 minutes to get her drink, the manager was busy helping the bartender, running plates of food that had been waiting more than 10 minutes to be served and it was not even that busy. The food is good, I will miss that but it does not make up for the lack of customer satisfaction.

I went in to ask for the general manager's contact information and name but instead was sworn at and threatened to leave by a low end manager, Eric Gross.   I used to love this restaurant, but if you have any issues, the manager (Eric Gross) will just swear at you and tell you that you're wrong. So just a heads up, if you value customer experience and service, don't go to Sol. The manager wouldn't let me even speak and kept cutting me off and didn't even want to hear me or listen to me. I simply wanted an email or a phone number for his boss because of the way he treated my parents. And instead he got defensive and started swearing at me inside the restaurant. When I asked for the information again and tried to speak he threatened me with foul language to GTFO. I truly feel for others who work in customer service like myself, so I try to avoid anything that may cause issues but what Eric did was uncalled for. Their food is not good enough to get treated the way myself and my parents were just treated. Truly the worst experience I've ever had and I was there for only two minutes.

Always have a lot of fun here. Wife is obsessed with their guacamole and I'm obsessed with their coronaritas! The food portion sizes are mainly on the smaller side for the price but there are a few that are bigger. Their carnitas is top notch so I usually always get it

I used to love this place when it was Park Central, but now it is no bueno. It's a huge happy hour hot spot for cool people, but the food is mediocre at best. For example- we ordered chicken and steak tacos on happy hour and all we got were tortillas with meat and cilantro. Really? Gordon bierch serves better tacos than this place. Overpriced and overhyped in my opinion.
When you walk into a "Mexican" restaurant and ask the waiter, " what do you have that is spicy?" and he replies with, "well, we don't really have much spicy food" you're in trouble.
Service was great! The food was o.k., not a big fan of yellow corn tortillas, flavor is overpowering.  Tacos didn't have a lot of flavor.  Margaritas were good.

We came here for a business lunch and left feeling as if we had just enjoyed something special.   As our server Carlos bought us our menu and water glasses, I had already figured out what I was going to order.  I had been reading the Yelp reviews about their delicious Ceviche for $14.00. What caught my eye was the small cuts, almost diced portions of fish.  In some restaurants, it is almost like they are trying to overwhelm you with the size of the cuts.  Not here!  And yes, it was delicious!  Carlos asked how much spice I wanted before he mixed all the ingredients.  First class.  Also while we were checking in on Yelp, we found that there was $5.00 Off one Don Julio Blanco margarita. Thank you Yelp! They were also willing to substitute the offer for their Sangria. Nice!  My friend Richard S had the equally good breaded Coconut Calamari for $12.50. It was excellent!    We split our bill and our lunch came to very reasonable $19.63, including taxes and tip. Next up will be coming here for their Happy Hour and Taco Tuesdays.

This place is my favorite Mexican food. Everything is great there but I enjoy their taco gobernador which is the premium fish taco and buffalada, a mixture of beef, pork, and chicken. It's on the expensive side but the quality, taste, and service are worth it.

Everything was amazing!  The black bean dip and grilled corn are delicious!  As was the seafood enchiladas, carne asada tacos, and fish tacos.  Desserts were divine, and the service was top notch.  Definitely recommend.
Made a reservation through Yelp for a Friday evening and I'm so glad I did. Fantastic food and service!! This has quickly become my new favorite Mexican restaurant. So delicious. You won't be sorry.

This is yet another over hyped and over priced Scottsdale eatery.   Went in today around 4pm with no reservations, we were seated right away and luckily by the kitchen. I say luckily because the line manger who our primary server.  Either we came during a shift change or there was serious confusion about who our server because he/she was hard to track and changed during our early dinner. No introduction, just a different person. Thank goodness being by the front, we were able to request assistance from the hostess stand as well.   Trust me, we were not needy ... Just wanted some water and a spoon.    The food was mediocre; I have had more flavorful food through a mom and pop drive thru.   I will drive 10 miles for good Mexican cuisine and am definitely going avoid coming to SOL if I am in need of a Salsa and taco fix.  I am all for combining flavors and creating delicious fusion cuisine; however, at these prices keep the water glasses filled, check in with your table and when bussing ... Keep the crumbs off your guests' laps.
The best Mexican food I ever had.  Great cocktail drinks Chips and guac and salsa Everything was awesome

Went there on a Friday night at 7. They were out of chips for the rest of the night. First margarita was goof the second one had no tequila in it.  Guacamole was tasteless except for the lemon or lime taste. Street taco were ok.  Couple next to us at the bar said they weren't come back. We won't either.

Great place for tacos and margaritas. Our server Armando was great. He explained what we needs and keep our drinks full. Had carnitas tacos and grill street corn. With margaritas to wash them down. Good little lunch. Hit the spot.

My wife and I the other day went to Sol and it was the best! Food, drinks, and service were all on point and our server Amanda was excellent! Very knowledgeable and upbeat! We had to try the different variations of street tacos because, let's be real, if you're a Mexican restaurant and you can't make delicious street tacos then you may not be in business very long. Our entire meal to say the least was 5 star and we will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items they have to offer!

Great atmosphere and good patio.  Open late which is a plus in North Scottsdale.  The tortilla soup was perfect,  broth base and full of flavor. If you do not like raw onions I suggest you ask for them on the side or a lighter amount added. Carne Asada tacos were good too. Only reason I gave 4 stars is because I lived in Texas for a while so nothing lives up to TexMex! #biased

Food was tolerable, and tasteless.  The chips were actually tostadas that were extremely hard (almost stale) when eating. The entrees we ordered were bland.  The rice and beans had no flavor at all.  Maybe that is Baja style of food, but couldn't find the flavor anywhere. The service was great and the ambiance was wonderful, but I don't think we'll be going to this place again.
Food was very tasty, the service was excellent but the margaritas were marginal.  Great atmosphere and people and I'd definitely recommend.

We've had excellent food in the past but mixed opinions from this party of 4. A good restaurant should have consistently good good. But it was unanimous that our waiter, Brandon, was the worst any of us have had in years.
Not from the area, but checked yelp and tried it. Unbelievably good. Carnitas tacos were incredible. Everything was great. Next time in Scottsdale, I will come here.

Delicious! Excellent service by Lady, she was awesome! The frozen mango chili margarita was so good! One of the best, if not the best margarita I've ever had. They serve a delicious bean dish and salsa with homemade chips before your meal. The table side elote was good, but needed some seasoning. We had the Grilled Estofado and it was delicious as well. The kitchen lost our order but they brought us complimentary guacamole while we waited. The drinks were so delicious and the environment so lovely we didn't mind.
Baja style Mexican. It was ok. Awesome staff and fabulous drinks but the food was just ok.

First of all, the hostess was rude and total B word.   We got there at about 630/7pm ish and there were a few other ppl there waiting for tables, so we went up to the hostess and asked for a table for 2. She said it'll be 20-25 minutes and I replied.. "that's fine." She says "name number" after we gave her a name and a number she says "text you when it's ready" ... from the time I initially asking for a table for 2 to her telling us it'll text us when its ready.. not once did she smile or look up. RUDE!   So we walked over to the bar and found 2 seats, we decided to get a drink there and wait a few mins for the table.. 10/15 mins rolls by so we just decide to eat at the bar instead. But we never did get a text.. so I suppose the table was never ready.. or the hostess that never paid 1 bit of attention to the customers typed in the wrong number.   Complimentary slightly seasoned chips and salsa and a black bean dip. Which was very good.   We order a taco plate, I got grilled chicken street tacos. They were pretty good. Very basic street tacos w/ a choice of 2 sides, quinoa salad, black beans, spicy slaw and rice. I got quinoa salad and black beans, both of which were pretty good. The plate came w/ 3 tacos, its actually more food that it looked.   Remember to as for the hot sauce.. it has a kick to it but pretty tasty!   They have happy hour from 3-6pm, just fyi.

I'd been here before and don't remember regretting it but on this visit the food and drinks were LAME.   Pineapple Serrano Maragrita lacked any detectable taste of pineapple and was just as green as a house margarita. There was virtually no "bite." Really?   Then the Big Chop salad was carnitas had the most bland taste, seemingly under-cooked pork, and fatty carnitas (had to spit one piece out in the napkin-never a good thing). Do they test these meals for great flavor and taste? Apparently not.   Waitress was wonderful and gets an A+ for service recovery, offering me new drink and entree in a jiffy. Nonetheless, I doubt I'll be back.  Sad, since it's an ideal location at a great mall.  Try harder Sol, try harder.

Pretty good place to grab a quick lunch in Scottsdale Quarter.  The atmosphere was cool and relaxing, the service was nice and the food was good and super quick.  The veggie tacos were really good and the chips and salsa weren't bad either.  Hopefully this place will last longer than the previous restaurant.

Ambiance was fantastic, even better was the Horchata Margarita!  However, I could not eat the food as it was so salty.  Why don't restaurants realize us baby boomers are a good portion of the people going out to dinner and we all try to keep our blood pressure down?  Carnitas Street Tacos were tasteless and the tortillas were dripping with steam table juice...  Never again!  Wait staff was excellent...

Over priced and flavorless. The staff was nice enough but they seemed to forget about us. The guacamole was good but the chips were made from cheap tortillas. All the tortillas were cheap even though they show then being made on the menu. The food completely lacked flavor and nothing was salted. Will not return.

I've been here 3 times now, and every time it's been great.  It is the closest I've come to finding the pseudo-Mexican that I've enjoyed in other cities.  The fried fish tacos were outstanding.  Amazing flavor and the ingredients all balanced each other out.  The waitstaff is really friendly and knowledgeable.  I think the restaurant inside is a little dark, a little loud, and poorly laid out.  All the tables in the front are all bar height, so if that's not your thing eat in the back or outside.  The special guacamole with mango and goat cheese was fair.  I'd stick to the regular.

This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants.    You should definitely try the various versions of their Guacamole and their Ceviche.  It is so hard to find a good ceviche besides going down to Costa Rica and they do it well here.  Their specialty tacos are a great option if you want to try various flavors, but the other entrees they have are great as well.    This has a great location in Scottsdale Quarters and has outdoor dining as well.  If you are looking for some great food and margaritas, I would head over to check it out.  At night this place is typically crowded, but it is very easy to find a table during the day.

On recommendation from hotel staff, we stopped in for for a light lunch and drinks.  Great decor and ambience.  Extremely friendly and professional service.  Amazing margaritas -- some of the best I've ever had.  Unique "chips and salsa", fantastic tacos.  I particularly enjoyed the pork carnitas and mushroom/polbano/corn tacos.  Yelpers get a special deal too when you check in.

What a find!! Sol, you make me so happy. Came here on a Sunday on a whim for lunch, and much to my surprise they had brunch from 10am - 3pm. I am a sucker for huevos rancheros, and the claim on the menu, "the best huevos in town" had me drooling.   But, on this particular day I couldn't help ordering the Crab & Shrimp Cakes "Benedicto". Two HUGE crisp-fried crab & shrimp cakes topped with poached eggs & chipotle-orange hollandaise sauce, double-smoked bacon, avocado & refried black beans. RIDICULOUSLY good!! Kids (ages 6 and 9) ordered bean & cheese burritos. Everything was fantastic.   Our waitress was terrific, and really allowed the kids to pick exactly what they wanted and even offered to let them "assemble" them. Very cute and appreciated. Service was fast, efficient, and friendly.  Washed it down with a glass of sparkling wine. Live music in the background. Yes, I best believe this was the best unexpected 2pm Sunday brunch I've ever had!! I could definitely make this a habit.  I cannot wait to head back for some happy hours and the huevos!! Great addition to one of my favorite spots around - Scottsdale Quarter. Man, I love this town.

Great staff! FAB food! LOVE that you can ala carte the tacos and add or take away from what you need. Beans..yep. Beans .. Nope. Margaritas .. Icy.. top shelf .. Premium.. strong! Who's driving again??? Love the way that the flat shell is brought instead of greasy, carb laden chips all taken from some plastic bag and greased down and tossed before you with some jarred salsa. I love this place. It brings class to the cocina. I always get the Mezcal chicken tacos. Eat one. Bring the rest home for the next day. Splurge on the beans and flat shell and salsa. Tres bien!
Short wait time. Server was attentive and helpful. Had the guacamole and the sweet potato/black bean tacos, but were delicious!!

Great patio, good happy hour, love the carnitas tacos.  Good drink selection... interesting options... had some jalenpeno margarita of some sorts...  Nice upscale place with a very friendly comfortable atmosphere.  Located in Scottsdale quarter just east of Brio... if you turn in the parking garage off Greenway parkway it is just to the left of the parking garage entrance.

This is my second time at a Sol restaurant and I have had a great experience both times. The service has been stellar and the food was excellent! Alberto made our experience memorable. He knew the menu well, was very pleasant and talkative, making us want to come back! He also gave great recommendations.   We're vegetarian, which they had a full menu to accommodate. We tried all 4 veggie tacos, the squash and sweet potato being our favorite! The sweet corn side is fresh and light!   We highly recommend this place!

Made a reservation for anniversary...both the times they accommodated a larger party and moved our reservation to a table on a side - bad table!!! Really stupid and thoughtless reservation staff. Good food- bad waitresses

My husband and I were vacationing in Scottsdale for a week and had not had any food that blew us away. We were looking for some really good food to eat on our last night and decided to try Sol. This was the best decision!   First let me say that our server, Marlena, was amazing. Very personable, attentive, fun, and full of life. She gave us great drink and food selections and made us feel so welcomed. She was one of the highlights of our visit in Scottsdale.   Now to the food and drinks which was all so incredible! I had a blackberry ginger margarita which was so flavorful and strong without being overwhelming. My husband had the $5 margarita which was a special through the Yelp app and he also enjoyed his. For an appetizer we had the corn which was very similar to Mexican street corn. The flavors were good and my husband really liked it. I think it could have used more cheese and spice but it was still good. For our entrees we had the Carne asada tacos with rice and beans and the shrimp quesadillas with spicy slaw and rice. The tacos were very good but the shrimp quesadillas were out of this world. We could have eaten those all night. The flavor combinations were so unique. The rice was your typical rice, the slaw was very lackluster, but the beans were pretty good.   If you're in the area definitely give this place a try. And if you get Marlena be sure to leave her a good tip because she's amazing.

Sol has a great selection of authentic Mexican dishes that aren't just your average taco.   I was adventurous and got the grilled quail, a tad over grilled, I tasted a bit more char than bird, but overall very succulent. They also make their own monster tortilla chips at Sol...among things that look better than they taste, but they deserve an E for effort.

We had a wonderful experience at happy hour. Armando our server was excellent. Very attentive knowledgeable and fun. Food was delicious. Homemade tortilla chips. Ceviche. Grilled chicken street tacos. Their margaritas were good too. We will be back. Their music and ambience was very fun.
The food is pretty reliable - but the service was terrible!   Not sure when I'll go back....

It took me some time to get here after their open, but since I went a month ago, I've been back four more times - taking different people with me each time to experience their great food! The menu is full of unique food combos and everything I've had has been great, so I just want to keep making my way through it! The patio is right on Greenway, but it's still a nice place to enjoy one of their many margaritas! The staff is friendly and keeps their cool when it gets crowded on the weekend nights, but unfortunately was slow the last time I was in on a pretty dead Thursday...guess they're not a fan of patrons just drinking a few beers and watching a game.

Food is awesome, Love the Sparkiling Pomegranite!! Will be back just for that. Also the manager stooped by our table and said hello, Nice touch Danielle. Thank You for the outstanding experience. We Will be Back

One of my favorite upscale Mexican food restaurants in Scottsdale for sure! Their rustic decor makes for a romantic and intimate setting, and their Jalapeño Cucumber Margarita is the best I've ever had! We tried some if the Warmed Goat Cheese, with roasted peanuts, the Coconut Calamari (best calamari steak ever) and their Grilled Sweet Corn, all of which were outstanding! They also bring out a black been puree mixed in with roasted tomatoes that's very tasty. I also tried a few of their tacos, the Filet & Shrimp El Jefe Taco (my least favorite tbh, didn't taste like filet that's for certain), the Short Rib on Blue Corn Tortilla Taco (definitely my favorite) and their Canarditas Duck Taco (a deep-fried duck leg confit on a tortilla, build-your-own style) that was different. We were do full and happy after, which is the best and the worst feeling ever haha we'll definitely be back.

Visited SOL while on a business trip in Scottsdale with my team and we loved the unique flavors and vegetarian options that were available. The decor was very cool and provided a nice, relaxed atmosphere to wind down from a long day. The food was excellent - I had both the shrimp taco and the short rib taco, and they were amazing. Would love to come back and try more of their selections!

Excellent Food. My wife and I had the Kobe skirt steak, Shrimp Tacos and for an appetizer Guacamole Sol. Must admit I enjoyed everything. Our waitress Amy was simply phenomenal. She is very friendly and made great recommendations. If you visit Scottsdale you must try this place out.

Nothing special. Bland and just ok. Our party of 7 ordered different items from the menu and we were not impressed at all. I was expecting something better from a $15 burrito or tacos.  I will not go back. 2 stars for the location!

Came here for a work event in the back room but enjoyed the margaritas - had a regular one as well as a cucumber jalapeño which was very tasty. I also had a few of their street tacos (a chicken, pork and steak) which were good but nothing really to write home about.  Although I don't live in the area, the place this is located in seemed pretty cool and the restaurant had a cool vibe to it as well. If I were to come back I'd probably try it out again in the regular restaurant.

I have been here a few times and I am never too impressed.  Scottsdale prices, and odd presentation detract from my overall experience.  The tortilla chips here are whole tostada rounds, meaning you need to break them yourself, they are also quite thick.  The guacamole has a bit too much lime for my taste and not enough spice.  The tacos with veggies could have used a bit more filling.
Love this place...they hit  home run here...great atmosphere, happy hour mmrnu is over the top, margaritas are made perfect and the crevice on the main menu is a real treat...
The food is very unique. And tasty . Tacos are great but i live the calamari very fresh

I've been eating at this place every week for the past couple years since I meet with my networking group here. I'm always impressed with the servers; they are always on the ball and rarely mess up orders. The bathrooms are always clean and tidy too.  The food overall I enjoy. One of my favorites is the Carnitas Taco's. The flavor of the pork is very good with just a little spice... I ditch the corn taco shells and instead pour the meat over some rice and beans (yum!). The salsa is mild-medium so pretty much appeals to all tastes. Really the only menu item I've had that I think needs work is the tortas, specifically the bread they are served on... it's just too much bread for the amount of food inside the sandwich. Not to mention it's tough for the average mouth to even get the entire sandwich into it. I still order them from time to time but I end up making them an open faced sandwich and toss 1/2 the bread. They have an excellent patio to dine on year round too and it can accommodate a lot of people. They have a bar area out there, table and chair setups and even some cool couch configurations for larger groups.

1 star for ambiance.   Service was terrible. Barely saw the waiter.   Waiter also stated all food was made from scratch, but when we tried to modify one of the dishes, he tells us the food was pre-made earlier in the day.   Ordered the chicken burrito, which was 90% beans.   The "wet" burritos were barely covered in sauce and the sauce was dried onto it.

I visited SOL on a recent trip to Scottsdale.  Wow! Such a pleasant surprise to have wandered upon SOL after seeing a movie at iPic Theaters. Despite it being 'off-season', SOL was busy on a Monday evening which was a great sign.  Our waiter, Rodrigo, was fantastic...very attentive, friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and was more than willing to give us his (honest) thoughts on the dishes we were considering.  The (free) seasoned corn tortillas, instead of your typical tortilla chips, were unique and so delicious.  Our party had the butternut squash taco, sweet corn, carnitas street tacos, and the carnitas platillo with sides of black beans, spicy coleslaw and rice. Absolutely NO complaints, every dish was fresh, hot, and the flavor was on point.  My aunt, who lives in Scottsdale, said the butternut squash taco was the best taco she has ever had!  Even though I was full, I managed to clean my carnitas platillo, too good to leave anything behind.  The ambiance is great and we being able to have a conversation without having to compete with loud music and/or other customers.  You won't regret your visit to SOL so go now!

My girlfriend and I recently went to SOL and were blown away by their happy hour. We discovered SOL using the Whistl app for iPhone. It's great if you are a foodie like my girlfriend and I!   We shared the naked guacamole ($6) and the Baja Shrimp Cocktel ($7) and I had the SOL House Margarita ($5). It was a great lunch for the both of us. The guacamole was very fresh and had a great consistency. By far we like the Baja Shrimp Cocktel the most. It was very citrusy and the shrimp was delicious. In fact, it was so delicious, I was debating whether to just start drinking it from the glass before more chips came! It also tasted like it would make a great bloody mary mix, if you're into that sort of thing.   We would both also recommend the Pork Carnitas Street Tacos (2 for $4.50) and the Blanco Tequila Flight ($7.50) if you are a tequila enthusiast!   Overall we had an excellent experience, the service was also terrific. Thanks Whistl for letting us know about these great deals!
Great place and Drew provided outstanding service!  Atmosphere and good food...what more do you need?

Was in town for a bachelorette weekend and a group of us girls decided to come to SOL. First of all, the restaurant was beautiful!  We started with the grilled sweet corn, naked guacamole, and chorizo con queso. All were so delicious.  For dinner, we had the Wildfish Esquites, Ribeye, but our favorite was the Short Rib. It was so tender and flavorful. We ended with the dark chocolate bread  pudding and it was mouth wateringly good!  Such a wonderful experience. Service was friendly and attentive. Our margaritas were fresh and on point. Even the manger Ron came over to check on us and was so welcoming. Thank you team SOL for the wonderful experience!

Horrible.. The food was NOTHING to get excited about. The steak and shrimp lacked seasoning. The Pico de gallo was chopped tomato and onion.. No flavor.. The street corn is better from a vendor on the streets of Los Angeles. They said the food is based on Mexican in Baja. Baja would be ashamed!!
Very Nice Place, exceptionally good Margarita's & Food!!!

We tried Sol Concina about a week ago on a Saturday night. The disinterested hostess sat us right in the doorway to the patio under a vent that felt like an industrial fan blowing on us. No big deal. I just asked if we could be moved to a much more comfortable table she walked us right past in the first place.   We ordered. Then waited. And waited. About 45 minutes later we caught the waitress and asked about our food. I guess they lost the ticket. They got our food to us pretty quick at that point.   Two bright spots. The manager came over to our table and he handled things well. Picked up desert and also took some money off our bill. The food was also decent.   Those two bright spots convinced us to go back for lunch today. We never made it past the rude hostess. I can deal with disinterested but she was awful. A family came in behind us and she was just as short with them. The strange thing was that the same manager was only 10 feet away and didn't seem to notice a thing. We couldn't have felt less welcome so we left.   Amazing how much damage a 'hostess' can do. The manager seems good at customer service but maybe not so good at managing staff.

Sol keep doing what you do and you will have a life long customer all the servers are friendly. I could drink enough of the house margaritas to kill my liver and still have a smile on. Honestly sometimes the fiancé and I just come up for chips & salsa margaritas. Also the chicken quesidilla is the bomb diggity. They also have really good bfast menu.
I like the atmosphere of the restaurant but not to keen on the menu. I think the calamari is my favorite dish.

The food was amazing and the service was great. I had the lobster and shrimp tacos and the grilled sweet corn with the strawberry, Serrano guacamole. They have an impressive selection of tequila and great variety of margaritas. The only thing I will say is that the food did take some time to get to us ( like 35 minutes) but if you've ever gone to brand new restaurants, teamwork and timing is shortly acquired after opening week. I highly recommend this this place if you want good baja Mexican food and great service.

No complaints, I would not call it amazing but for being in this part of Scottsdale, this joint is actually surprisingly good and chill. Okay it's not hardcore true Mexico but it's fair, clean and tasty, they have a very good tequila selection and legit dishes.. is a safe bet for decent value. All good.
Great food. I had the fish ceviche fresh and delicious. Awesome costumer service is always a plus. I'll be back soon to try out other items that caught my interest.

If I base my review on just the tacos at their price point two stars is accurate.  Their were lots of things I did like about SOL Mexican Cocina. They present you with above average salsas and and spiced toastadas. The margaritas were good and strong but maybe pricey.  ($10.50 and $13.75) I loved the warmed goat cheese with salted peanuts and that sweet hot chipotle syrup it was like whipped cream cheese but tastier and all that sweet salty and spicy went really well together. It is worth coming here just for the goat cheese. The grilled corn was good! Not the best I've ever had but GOOD!  They are accommodating to vegans and vegetarians. Service is above average as our server Amanda was very knowledgeable and informative and seemed well trained.  Now the tacos.  The tacos are Baja style street tacos. They are very small tacos.  My husband had the sampler plate and I ordered two ala carte tacos so together we tried five kinds.  We tried chicken, beef, pork, fish and vegetable. For the most part the tacos were just meh but the stand outs were the pork and fish tacos. We spent $30.25 on 8 MINI TINY tacos. The chicken was the most undesirable but passable. The chicken was sort of dry and not so tasty. The beef one could have been more flavorful but was OK. The vegetable (corn & rajas) taco was full of just mooch as it lacked flavor and texture. The wild caught fish taco was yellow tail on my visit. The tiny taco was tasty but the fish was over cooked ($7.50) and it seemed expensive to me for such a tiny taco with very little fish in it.   Your best bet is to come for Happy Hour and take advantage of it.

Great looking place!  They start you with a bean dip, salsa and real tortilla chips.... Great!  After that it all went downhill with the corn chowder soup. I is supposed to be freshly made...NOT!!!  It was cold and the cream had a crust as if it had been seating for a while...  The Mexican chicken salad is totally bland and lacked any flavor!  Of all our choices of places to eat in Scottsdale....  This will not be be it again!   For chips and guacamole... Maybe....

Great spot for a fast meal! Food came out so quick it would make your head spin.  I enjoyed their grilled taco plate. Generous portion of fish and fresh toppings. The spicy cole slaw and black beans were great accompaniments.   The grilled chicken burrito looked delicious as well but my date didn't  care for the red sauce they use for enchilada style.   Good service and beautiful decor.

Great food for a great price on Taco Tuesday!  Regular menu items are on the expensive side, but street tacos and margaritas on Taco Tuesday can't be beat.  Love the chips and salsa/dip for a complimentary starter, and the pork carnitas tacos and the fish tacos were super yummy.  My guy had the carne asada tacos and the chicken tacos and loved them.  We had excellent service as well, attentive but not pushy.  This place has a great ambiance, dim lighting and live music made it a fun and cozy date night!  I highly recommend, we will be back!

This place brings back true Mexican cuisine in North Scottsdale. I'm excited to go back because the food and service were outstanding! I wish I remember our servers name so you could request him, but he was from Spain and had two daughters. If you read this I hope you made the trip back brother. Oh and you must have the street corn...unique and delicious. Thanks guys for a great time

Perfect place to enjoy California inspired Mexican food, delicious margaritas, and a amazing tacos. Alberto gave us a tour of the menu and recommended the most delicious food and drinks. World class service, yummy food, and the perfect atmosphere to catch up with friends. Highly recommend Sol! Ask for Alberto :)

I had the opportunity to try SOL at Monday's yelp party.  I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food, but this was different.  I fell in love with the calamari and the dipping sauce it came with.  It was large pieces of calamari with a crispy coconut breading.  I could have eaten that alone all night.  I also loved the mushroom quiesadilla or something like that.  Delicious.  I also like the goat cheese dish and I'm not a fan of goat cheese.  My only complaint is the ceviche... A little to sour and too much onion.  Other than that, I would recommend SOL to a friend.

Tonight was my first time here. Alberto was our server and he was wonderful!  Although it was really busy, he was very attentive and helpful in guiding us through the menu.  Chips and salsa, guacamole, and ceviche were really good.  We wouldn't order the tacos again.  Overall, I'd probably return for happy hour.

If you like jalapeño in your drink, michelada or a Paloma,  you're in the right spot. Started at the bar and the bartenders were excellent!  It's an indoor/outdoor bar, nice when the weather is great. Great Tequila selection.   Had the Calabaza empanadas with side of rice and Mexican corn. Food was yummy and so were the black beans. Service was friendly.   Would definitely return, cool spot.

I have eaten here from time to time for over a year and a half now, and I am always amazed with at least ONE of the items I order.  The hard part is consistency of menu items for me.    I had the Sweet Potato and Black Bean tacos... they were OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!  Unfortunately, the ceviche that i'm accustomed to from them is usually served in a giant bowl with beet chips and a variety of other fixings, which is NOT what I received, and it was definitely a bummer.    If you've never been, you should definitely go, and if you are only looking for cocktails, I had a watermelon margerita, and a blackberry-ginger margerita yesterday that puts their competition to shame.  Go check it out!!!

What can I say about Sol Cocina that hasn't already been said!  The overall ambiance is vibrant without being over the top loud.  Great choice of classic rock music, and the service is top notch!  Alberto was very attentive, menu knowledgeable and great engagement.  I had the Viper Tacos...amazing grilled chicken with the right amount of spice and extras!   Come one come all!!

We were on our way to another restaurant when we walked by SOL and decided to try it for lunch.  The ambiance is so cool and unique that it drew us in (good date spot).  I ordered the fish tacos which were tasty, but I thought it was a tad expensive for lunch (I'm one of those who will eat CHEAP lunches, but doesn't mind splurging on dinner... yeah, I don't know).  I believe we ordered the azul margarita which was pretty fresh and delicious.  I'm giving three stars because there was confusion with which margarita was being ordered and I thought we had ordered one size, but a bigger size was brought out so the bill was a bit of a shocker.  The service was okay.  I'm not sure if I'd go back unless it was happy hour and/or I was already in the area.

I have seen this place before on my trips to the area. Stopped in tonight for some good Mexican and drinks. Was not let down at all. There is a good selection of traditional plates to choose from. For me, the selection of tacos is really good. You can order 1 or a dozen and you wouldn't be disappointed in any. My favorite, the filet and shrimp taco. Probably the best taco I've ever had. Also a great selection of drinks from the bar to choose from.
Pretty darn good food,and I will say it's a nice atmosphere inside and outside seating.service was good all around good.. I tell ya the Spicy coleslaw was delish

First off, you MUST have a reservation here on weekends. I have gone a few times without one and left because the wait is always long.  So I made a reservation one night and we got in right away.  The ambiance is great. Casual Mexican restaurant. Service was fast. Drinks were perfect.  I want to focus on the food. It was SO good that I left there feeling super full because I couldn't stop eating it.  We tried the Hummus and it was to die for. So amazing. Got Tacos as well and they were great.  Let's just say we went to the movies after and I almost went into a food-coma.  Overall, excellent restaurant. Just make a reservation!

Taylor our waitress was very kind and helpful, she guided us in what to order and her suggestions were amazing the whole family had a good meal, the chips and salsa were delicious they gave us a wide variety of choices, I loved how their tortillas and salsa were homemade and they tasted really good!

I've gotta be honest, I was really torn on how to rate this restaurant.  For food, hands down, 5 stars.  For service, I was going to say 1 1/2 stars originally, but in the end they "redeemed themselves" a little, so i'll be nice and say 3 stars.  And for people watching, it's 3 1/2 stars.   I was visiting a friend in AZ and she and her girlfriends took me there.  It was a Saturday night and the restaurant was packed.  We went to the outside bar to grab drinks while we waited for our table.  The cucumber jalapeno martini was mmmm-delish!  Had the right kick to it.  Problem was the bartender put our drinks down and then abandoned us before we could pay.  When our table was ready, we attempted to pay but the bartender became completely absent.  Fearful we would lose our table we started to walk away while stayed behind to explain to him that we would like the drinks transferred to our dinner bill.  I wasn't around to hear the rest of the exchange, but let's just say I was told that it wasn't pleasant and in fact the bartender was very condescending.   Once at our table, it took about 20 minutes before anyone even came over to greet us and/or ask us if we wanted water, guacamole or even place our order.  When someone finally did acknowledge us, it was only to tell us that he is not our waiter, so we waited an additional 10 min and then when the same guy returned he quickly admitted that he was in fact our waiter (okaaayyyy).  The food itself was fantastic.  Their guacamole is truly gourmet as they add goat cheese or something to it that makes it decadent.  They also serve it with mini fried tortillas instead of chips, excellent choice.  I had a two taco combo with their sweet potato black bean taco and shrimp taco dorado.  It was excellent.  Then we topped it off with their Banana Dark Chocolate Bread Pudding which was truly out of this world scrumptious.  So just when I felt were all in a good space on this restaurant, the weirdest thing happened.   The manager came by and asked us if everything was ok -- a nice move and not unexpected -- but then he muttered "So was it worth the wait ladies?"  Felt kind of backhanded to us.  In the end, the waiter came over and told us that the dessert was on them for the long wait, which we definitely appreciated.  in the end, I'm hoping that our experience with the staff was just a result of us catching the servers on a bad night!  I would absolutely recommend this place because the food is just too good to pass up!

Whoa what a difference since the last time I was there! We shared a couple of dishes and I it was so delicious I couldn't stop eating, literally. They changed the chips too and they're much better now! Great foo, great service! So glad I gave them another chance and have the opportunity to update my 1 star prior review to 5!
Muy delicioso! Superb service, fresh, authentic food and nice atmosphere. We had the guacamole, and street tacos. Tasty and good quality all around. Muchas gracias!

One of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale!  What a great find. Super convenient location. Great service. Excellent food and reasonable prices.  Loved all the varieties of guacamole and the peel and eat shrimp were delicious!!! Can't wait to return and try more of the dishes.

One word: fantastic!! From the service to the food this place delivered.   The chips and salsa that they start you off with is a little different than normal. The server gives a tray with lime, salt, and something hot to mix in if you'd like to add heat the the salsas! They have a standard one and a black bean one. Our server told us we'd fall for the black bean and we did - you will too!   The actual entrees came efficiently. We didn't wait longer than 10-15 minutes. I had the carne asada burrito with the quinoa salad & jalapeño slaw. Oh. My. GOD. If you're a quinoa fan definitely get the salad!!!! I swear it's the best thing I've had in a very long time! The burrito itself was great especially with a little salsa and guac smeared on the side. The $14 price tag really isn't asking too much - I ate half the burrito (yay lunch for today!).   All in all, I'll be coming back here. It's a little far for us to frequent often but it's a nice spot in Scottsdale that isn't too hard on the wallet. We paid $37 (without tip) for two entrees and a margarita (we checked in on Yelp so we got $3 off the drink).

Stopped by for a light lunch.  Really liked the vibe of the restaurant.  Nice decor.  The waiter was very upbeat an informative.  Started with the guacamole.  Made at the table.  Left two large chucks of avocado and it was not seasoned well.  Ordered grilled fish tortas.  It had a distinct charred taste that I really didn't care for.  My friend had the fish torts as well and thought he swallowed a bone.  I started chewing more carefully and found a bone.  We notified the waiter and he assured us that had never happened.  Without our asking, the waiter had the manager come over who again reiterated that it had never happened before and he generously comped our meal, even though we insisted that he did not need to do that.    We decided to give the place a try for dinner later in the week.  We were again disappointed.  Same problem with the guacamole, and it was not mixed thoroughly, with the first bite one of our group had being very salty.  I started with the tortilla soup with chicken and was very disappointed.  Probably the least flavorful tortilla soup I have every had.  I followed that up with the Carnitas Street Taco Plate.  I found the food bland, lacking flavor with nothing good to say other than it was filling.  The other three guys with me did not find anything that might make them want to return to Sol.  The service was outstanding, however.  Summary:  Great service, great ambiance, great service, blah food.  AVOID.

I was in Scottsdale again for work and having tried everything in this shopping area and the wait at another place was 45 minutes (on a Tuesday!) we found SOL and tried it!  The tacos were really good - our waiter suggested the sweet potato and black bean - it sounds odd, but it was YUMMY - I wished I had ordered two of those!  I also got the three meat one and it was good, just too big to be a street taco, I had to use my fork.  The skinny margarita was really good as well.  The only down side was how LOUD the place was - it was just me and a friend and we could barely hear each other, the overall atmosphere was really cool and it was a fun place, but the live music at 7:30 on Tuesday wasn't necessary :)  I will definitely try it again and order other tacos that looked good (but the sweet potato one will be hard to beat) :). Our waiter was attentive but not pushy and did a good job, we were seated quickly, so I can't complain at all about the service.

Stopped in for a few drinks before meeting my sister for a  shopping date. I had the cucumber jalapeño margarita and it was amazing!  I've tried and can't copy these at home. Guess I'll just have to keep coming back.   Even their chips and salsa are amazing. I haven't tried their food yet but if their food is as good as their margaritas, I'm sure I won't be disappointed.

Great Happy Hour at the bar. Enjoyed an excellent frozen margarita made with a premium agave tequila. Yum! Bartenders were very informed on the many quality tequilas Sol has to offer. Perfect to enjoy with the Baja inspired happy hour specials. The Chilie Gordo pepper appetizer was amazing. Of course we never pass on the large, tasty chips and gourmet guacamole. So good...
Best Mexican food in Scottsdale. Steak burrito served we "wet" with melted cheese on top is great.

was pretty disappointed that the goat cheese enchiladas are a seasonal item on the menu. we come here only for that but decide to give it a try and glad we did. our amazing server armando suggested we try the warm goat cheese appetizer, and it was life changing. best thjng EVER. my favorite restaurant in all of the quarter and kierlands. will definitely be back soon and ask for armando :)
Margaritas were excellent. Chips unique as they're taco shells. Loved the salsa, bean dip, and guacamole. Tacos excellent.

While my daughter was attending a birthday party across the street, a couple of the dads and I decided to escape the estrogen-driven affair by grabbing lunch and some drinks at SOL.   When I walked in, I was very impressed with the vibe. It's dimly lit, but not TOO dim, giving it a nice intimate feel. Now, being three husbands seeking respite from arguably the most estrogen-driven place in Scottsdale (Girly Girlz), we weren't looking for "intimate". So, we found our way to the bar.   The bar at SOL is very cool. Half of the bar is inside the restaurant, while the other half is outside on the patio covered by awesome red awnings. The middle of the bar is where the bartender makes her rounds. Directly above the bar is a beautiful hanging shelf loaded with tequila from wall to wall. On the far right and left sides of the bar (both inside and out), there are televisions. We tried to find a seat out on the patio side, but the weather was so nice this day, there wasn't a chance we'd find a seat...let alone three.  So, we ended up inside. No biggie. We could still feel the breeze flowing through the bar from outside. Like I said...the bar is VERY cool.  We debated on whether or not we wanted food. But, after seeing the menu, what choice did we really have? From the brunch menu to the dinner menu, literally everything sounded amazing.   Being that I'm TRYING to eat healthier these days, I gravitated towards the skinny grilled chicken burrito. It's essentially a grilled chicken salad wrapped in a flour tortilla. It sounds simple enough...but trust me when I tell you that the taste is FAR from simple. It was also quite large. I REALLY wanted to eat the whole thing by myself, and I absolutely could have. However, the burrito was so good, I would have felt guilty if I couldn't have shared the other half with my wife. I feel like she would have missed out on something amazing in life had she not been afforded the opportunity to taste it. When I brought the other half home to MY better half, the look on her face when she took a bite of it was all the proof that I needed to know that I had done the right thing.  The food and atmosphere are fantastic. Our service was mediocre...but, it WAS really packed...especially for a Sunday afternoon. Though, it was right in the heart of March Madness. The burrito was so good, it kind of covered up the lackluster service from the bartender.  One other detractor, at least for us, was the placement of the televisions. We appreciated the fact that the televisions were there, but they were definitely not equally visible from every seat at the bar. In fact, if you end up having to sit in the middle of the bar (like we did), you'll have to crane your neck VERY awkwardly if you want to see either television.  One last note...SOL does not have beer on tap...just bottles. I'm not sure if that's a plus or a minus. I just found it interesting.

The interior was beautiful but the food....not so much. We went during lunch and three of us had different meals. None of us liked what we ordered. For the price, I think not. And to be honest, even if the food was cheap I would still say no thank you. Good try though. PS Don't expect salt and peper shakers because they don't have any.

The service was outstanding and the food was very fresh and better than expected.  The bean puree is delicious. I ordered the Taco Vampiro and the Beer Battered Shrimp Taco both were amazing. I have to say  they may have been the best little taco's I have ever had...Everything is made fresh there everyday... If  you like Mexican food or not I would  not miss having lunch or dinner...

Had a very nice dining experience here.  The menu is a few notches above the average Mexican restaurant, for sure.  Lots to choose from.  I had the short ribs which were deliciously tender and savory.  My husband has the pork carnitas which he also enjoyed.  We both had the spicy slaw as a side--and, yes it was spicy.  Kids chose tacos and burritos and both plates were demolished.  Lots of margarita choices.  Mine was okay--no matter where I go I find them a bit too sweet.  Server was good and knew his stuff.  Always bothers me when servers can't explain items on the menu or don't know what's in a dish.  The adjacent shopping area looked like a good place to spend a few hours but we were there later on. Sunday.  Def recommend.

If you're a fan of Macayo's like my elderly parents, you will not like this place. Mom & dad don't want to go back here.  That's fine because it means more food for me when I go. :)  The server sets everything up by explaining that they're more of an interior Mexican restaurant so things aren't necessarily spicy. However, most of the food that I had came with a healthy burn so don't think you're in for a gringo experience. The bean dip was a nice touch and the salsa was excellent.  My only quibble with the meal was I expected more of a stack from the stacked enchiladas. There's only one layer to them. I expect a couple of layers when I order something like that.  The margaritas aren't cheap but they're good.
My favs are the shrimp taco dorado, street corn, tostadas with bean dip, shrimp chile relleno and the list goes on!

Great atmosphere. Waitress was very informative but overall service was just average. Looked like they kept having server meetings. Had to go the bar and get my own drink once.  Food was good but not great.  Did street tacos...very tasty but have had better.  Margaritas we're very good.

Aah, I am a little torn on the stars... More like 3.5. I liked the food and the service was good but... This ended up not being the best experience.  Our server was very nice and friendly, the food we ordered was good, the location is nice, no issues with parking and we went for a walk around the block afterwards.  But... I always ask for a booth when we make a reservation and I think they do not have booths, but we were seated by the bar on a tall table... ok, my bad for not protesting but I did not think the table/chair arrangement was comfortable.  I wanted a steak, and I thought I had seen steak on their online menu, but the menu we got had just tacos, tortas, etc. I asked to get the full menu but apparently we had a misunderstanding and I was told that was it... well, not. Later I found out we got the lunch menu, hence the lack of dish options.  Aaaaand, there was a delay with our appetizer. Our server apologized and we told him it was fine... the delay. However, once we finally got it (queso/chorizo/mushrooms), the rest of our food came right after, so we didn't fully enjoy either and the table was quite crowded.   Chile ancho and pumpkin seeds (pepitas) seem to be a very big part of their menu and I enjoyed them very much.  About the chips, I would not call them chips, they are more like full or half tostadas, with sprinkles of chile. Salsa and black bean dip were tasty.  Appetizer: The queso was good, with chorizo, mushroom and raw jalapeno slices. It came with 4 yellow corn tortillas and I think that was my favorite food. I had a 'taste' of the corn/poblano soup and I did like it a lot too, but the portion was super tiny, The container was pretty much the size of the soup spoon. I was expecting a full cup, but oh well, I cannot claim to be deceived, the menu says 'taste'. This item was in fact really good, like liquid 'tamal de rajas' : ) I also had the grilled calamari and while it was good, the marinade tasted quite sweet and I did not like that part. Hubby had the garlic chicken torta and he thought it was OK. About sides, we had the spicy slaw (kind of bland and blah... I did not think it was spicy and did not find it flavorful) and the cranberry quinoa, which was good mainly because the cranberries were very sweet. : )  For dessert we shared a 'blondie' and it was delicious.

Outstanding flavors and service at this spot. The filet and shrimp street tacos are definitely worth trying. For heavy meat eaters, you must experience the braised short ribs. Very tender and seasoned to perfection. Our server Ed, topped off our experience. Young man with huge culinary dreams and very funny. We learned that the chef hails from the Newport Beach Ca store, which is frequently featured on the hit Bravo show The Housewives of Orange County. She is definitely bringing her "A" game, with respect to the quality control of each meal. Only negative, you can tell the restaurant has only been open for about 10 days. However, time will cure that.   Ed and Carla Henderson NV

SOL Cocina is one of my favorite Scottsdale Quarter restaurants because it's upscale Mexican food in a classy, romantically lit setting accented by stone walls and comfy seating. Stellar service elevates the meal, which is what my friend Beth and I experienced on a recent invitation to try new menu items by chef Deborah Schneider.  Manager Jason and server Taylor expertly guided us through the menu and made fantastic recommendations for my vegetarian tastes and my friend's inclusive palate. We paired our meals with SOL's House Margarita ($8.50), a perfect balance of Agavales Blanco, freshly squeezed orange juice, sour mix and a splash of Patron Citronge Regular. The drink wasn't too sweet or overpowered with an alcohol taste, making it a refreshingly cool classic choice.  For food, we started with the Guacamole Sol, made with mango, tequila, onions, goat cheese, pepita and cilantro ($10.75). The appetizer is one of the restaurant's most popular, and I love the flash of a table-side preparation. My favorite part of the Guacamole Sol was the goat cheese, which enhanced the guacamole with a nice tangy flavor. Every table gets housemade chips and salsa, with crunchy mini tostadas to break apart and dip into sauces.  We also tried the Grilled Sweet Corn ($6), half-sized ears slathered in butter, lime, chiles, cotixa cheese and a chipotle drizzle. Be warned it's an appetizer that's a bit messy to consume, but Beth said, "The corn was cooked just right, with a creamy and tangy chipotle sauce that made it different than any Mexican corn I've had - in a good way." I liked the topping, as well, but I think it'd be so cool if there was a kernel-only option to keep fingers clean.  SOL has an extensive menu of a la carte tacos, with new offerings including the Grilled Agave-Chile Shrimp Taco ($11), which comes with a whopping three large shrimp and guacamole; and the Viper Taco ($6.50), which comes kicked up with a spicy ghost chile and chipotle salsa, avocado and onion. Our server was gracious enough to suggest an off-the-menu sweet potato taco, which was bursting with veggies--"It was delicious, coming from a non-vegetarian," Beth said--and Beth also tried the Taco Vampiro ($8.50), which had the most tender carne asada she has ever had. "The double-layer corn tortillas, held together by the serrano chiles, cheese and scallions, helped keep the meat and toppings from falling out, which I appreciated. The taco had just the right mix of meat, guacamole, cheese and other toppings," Beth said.  For my meal, I tried the new fall version of the Goat Cheese Enchiladas ($15), made with menonito and jack cheese, green salsa, queso fresco, cotixa cheese and crema. I definitely loved the three-cheese stuffing, but if you're not a sauce fan, ask to go easy on it, since the dish was swimming in sauce. I loved how fresh the entrée tasted, and it was a huge portion.  We were too full for dessert, but if you save room, try the new Pastel Tres Leches '1921', a house-made white cake soaked in cream, evaporated milk, and 1921 tequila liqueur ($9.50). Other new menu items include red pozole, oysters and scallops dishes, shortribs barbacoa, and a grilled agave-chile shrimp torta.

Muy beuno! Between the atmosphere, food and drinks, all I can say is...muy bueno!   I am so happy that Sol decided to make the Scottsdale Quarter home. This is the perfect restaurant to visit for lunch during an afternoon of shopping, or for a date night later that evening!   The vibe here is calm, cool and collected. It's on the darker side which makes for a cool escape on a hot day. I can't wait for the weather to cool down so I can take advantage of their nice patio as well!   I love the drinks here, especially the skinny margaritas! They have the perfect amount of carbonation which I love in a cocktail. The bartenders are super friendly, as is all the staff!   Now let's talk about the food. I love the food here! It's quite simple. This is delicious Mexican food. The table-side guac is creamy and comes with large tostadas! Throw in some of their spicy salsa and it's sublime. Their carne asada is some of the best I've ever tasted thanks to their seasoning and tenderness of the meat. I also absolutely love their fish tacos! The sauce they use with the combination of cabbage and fish wrapped up into a tortilla is second to none. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! I also like how they sell the tacos individually on the menu. This means that you can order one fish taco and one carne asada, or whatever combination you feel like! Each taco is about $4 but be warned, they are filling!

SOOOOO nice I had to try it twice! Whenever I am back in the Scottsdale area, I like to eat my old but goodie spots but also try out some new ones! I went to SOL at Scottsdale Quarter a few nights ago and had their Chipolte Shrimp Tacos, it was so good that I had to go back and this time I ordered their grilled burrito.
