Great food, service and atmosphere!!! I ate my TJ Grilled Shrimp Caesar salad while watching the Cardinals and listening to live music. Yep, I'd say today was a good day

Just love the ambiance and liveliness of this place.  Make sure to check this place out on Taco Tuesdays, then order the Carnitas Street Tacos with Naked Guacamole...  Great drinks and live music, so that pretty much covers it.

Nice setting, great crew. Terrific food. A group of 7 women went here for Happy Hour and all agreed it was one of the better places we have been.  We have been attending happy hours monthly for 3 years.
SOL made us want to go on vacation. The food was wonderful, try the elotes or grilled corn....YUM.  Drinks were on point, service was fantastic. Rodrigo was the best server!! We will be back.

After not going here in over a year after the worlds worst experience with the worst server ruining my bday dinner I decided to give it another try and pleasantly surprised! The food, service and staff were amazing! Ask for Arnolodo if you go, he's extremely knowledgable, outgoing and takes pride in Sol!!! I will definitely be returning with family and friends :D    Great happy hour as well!

Slow service (poured our own water/went to bartender for requirements). Undercooked fatty steak in the tacos that primarily tasted burnt. Rock hard "chips" and a weak excuse for salsa. Went with a party of 4 and none of us enjoyed our meals - salads, carne asada tacos and chicken quesadilla.
Nice place but the food is mediocre. Typical chain quality.

Came across this place while walking around scottsdale quarters. I wasnt that hungry so decided to get some guacamole and drinks.  My partner ordered the carne asada tacos and a churro type of dessert that of course I tried. The waitress was friendly and really knew her menu.  I was taken back when we asked what do we need to order to get these grilled onions and chiles that were featured in the menu photos and she said they don't make those and wasn't sure why it was in the menu in the first place, disappointing.  They first bring you the chips with some salsa and a black bean dip and a water glass container . The chips are more like tostadas that you must break apart and dip. I liked both dips even though we were iffy about the bean dip at first we ended up ordering another one.  The guacamole sol definitely had a twist to it with a bit if mango and pumpkin seeds. You must mix it yourself, i felt it was missing a little bit of salt and lemon so added some from the condiments they bring to your table, mind you that second salsa is spicy! I ordered a michelada not knowing it would be huge! It took me along time to finish it. It wasn't the best michelada I've had, it was slightly watered down but I finished it. Now the carne asada tacos they were plain didnt have much of the condiments you would find in typical mexican tacos.  The tortilla was definitely a downer. I wish it was more of a home made tortilla taste rather than the grocery guerrero tortillas.  The atmosphere was great nice and cozy, with some music playing in the background and some plasmas to watch sport.  We were seated in the outside patio covered by an orange tarp so dont mind my photos with the odd lighting.  All and all I would go back and try more of their specials. The grilled corn looks delicious!! Oh and if your looking for a cheap meal you wont find it here.

Just ok. Very good, healthy and natural food but a limited menu. It wasn't that busy during lunch and I got the impression it wasn't that popular. Food is good, but there's nothing about it to make it stand out and it definitely isn't inexpensive
First time dining here and everything was awesome from the food to the service. Would recommend and return. The ambience here is also awesome.
Understaffed. Good food. But service was not good. Don't think I would come on a Friday night again.

A co-worker had mentioned this place so we decided to check it out. It's pretty close to work, so we have been here both for lunch and dinner. We've tried numerous items off the menu, so I'll highlight what we liked the best.  - Guacamole Sol: avocado, mango, goat cheese, and pepitas. This is delicious but it's really unnecessary. Don't get me wrong - I love guacamole but the extras don't really add to it. I'd be fine with their Naked Guacamole.  - Coconut Calamari: calamari steak with panko-breading and coconut. This is delicious! The calamari is huge and super tender. We've ordered this a few times.  - Spicy Chicken & Bacon Salad: walnuts, avocado, cherry tomatoes... mmm. This salad was delicious! The chicken wasn't too spicy and it was very moist and tender. I'd definitely order this again.  - Taco Vampiro: double tortilla stuffed with melted cheese and carne asada. Yum! Little overboard, honestly, who needs 2 tortillas that are stuffed with cheese? But really good.  - Ensenada Style Fish Tacos: your basic fish tacos. We ordered the red rice with this and the red rice is delicious. It's flavorful - definitely not bland like some restaurant's rice.  - Carnitas Street Tacos: the pork was super moist and tender.   While waiting for your food, they bring out salsa, black bean dip, and chips. All are delicious.   The location is pretty easy to get in and out of - as long as there is parking in the parking structure next door. Once you park, the actual restaurant is really close. We've never had to wait for a table, which is nice. The hostess and waiters are extremely nice and helpful. We'll definitely be back!

Margaritas are great. Ceviche is amazingly fresh. Guacamole is different but good. Wasn't really a fan. Chips and Salsa was good. Tad spicy but that's normal for a Mexican restaurant. Crispy Calamari was amazing. Tacos were greattttt. I could go on and on. Just go and please try a little of everything.
This place is really good.  Also, really expensive.  Great margaritas and great food. Service not too shabby either.  Overall a great time.

Incredible food and great service. Very impressed by the wide variety of unique dishes and the staff was great.  A younger couple of boys were are waiters and very good at explaining the dishes and their personal thoughts on the food. the Shrimp appetizer was incredible. Chips were whole corn tortillas cut in half and served warm. very nice ambiance and decor as well.

In terms of all these modern Mexican mini-chains, Sol falls somewhere in the middle. It sort of just blends in amongst a sea of similarly-styled places and doesn't really offer anything that particularly stands out as special. In some ways, Sol is without a Soul. But whatever.     We've been to this location twice. On both occasions, we ordered a "flight" of tacos, which wasn't on the menu. This was more of an accommodation made due to our desire to sample various taco styles. Although I'm not even sure if tacos are their specialty.  Their carne asada is decent, having that smokey flavor that I've always liked. The chicken and carnitas are standard. Rice and beans are different than what most places serve, but I don't consider either to be memorable.  During our second visit, we decided to try their Sol guacamole. I really like the inclusion of goat cheese, as well as the various other additions. It's good, but not particularly great given the ten dollar asking price. And any guac that hits or exceeds the 10 dollar mark should automatically be great.  For dessert, we've ordered their banana-dark chocolate bread pudding, which is very hard to go wrong with. They offer a tres leches and a "blondie" that we would most likely try upon returning. Although I seriously doubt their leches is comparable with what we've sampled elsewhere.  Don't go in here expecting an "authentic" Mexican experience, as it's more along the lines of a modern/corporate take - with a heavy Baja influence. Not that there's anything wrong with that, I guess. I just don't see anything here worth getting enthusiastic about.  It's worth a try or an occasional visit, but I don't really see it ranking up with some of the other options that can be found deeper in Phoenix.

In a place where strip malls makeup the majority of restaurant (or any other) destinations, it's hard to distinguish between the good and the bad. This place is definitely the former and a really solid find. Our waiter was phenomenal, giving us detailed explanations of anything we asked about the menu. Speaking of which, terrific menu. Very inventive and clearly a tremendous about of care was out into its design. Food is fantastic. Ceviche was some of the best I've had, which is a fete considering we're no where near the ocean. Tacos are also a home run. This is definitely a diamond in the rough around here. Also great for just drinks and apps. Highly recommended.

I have been to Sol on more than one occasion and each time I go I REALLY want to love this place... It has a sexy vibe and great drinks but their food and service really in my opinion leaves room to be desired... And lets be honest this place isn't cheap! But I am Huge huge fan of their cocktails, their grande clase azul margarita is amazing, and is enough for two to share and also a fan of their farmers market margarita.   On my most recent trip we started with the Ceviche Sol, which is served with sashimi-grade fish, fresh squeezed lime juice, pico & serrano, sliced avocado and served with their highly addictive fried tostada chips. This dish was the best dish of the night and I really think they do a great job with their ceviches. The flavors were balance and the fish was very fresh. Entree wise I did the Lobster & Shrimp Enchiladas, portion was huge but was SUPER fishy and almost like the lobster and shrimp was about to turn rancid. It really lacked any great flavor and just needed something, and for $24.00 i just felt kinda played. A girlfriend got the crane asada burrito served "wet", she said the same too, it needed some spice. Tried to order dessert and they were out of the bread pudding. Our waitress was also no where to be seen.... She dropped the check and disappeared for a good 45 minutes.   If your looking for a great margarita and a quick appetizer Sol is your place, but anything beyond that... There are better options

Just had happy hour last night at SOL here in Scottsdale. I was a little disappointed, because several reviews raved about the Happy Hour. Yes the chips, salsa, and beans were good. We had the chicken & pork tacos as well. Not as filling as one would hope. The service in the beginning was pretty sluggish. Lots of staff standing around and talking (managers too), but empty waters, chips, and drinks. It was 4:45pm in the afternoon, and maybe they don't ramp up till 5 on the service. Still hungry after the tacos, the bartender recommended another dish, that was a HUGE FLOP. They charged extra for some cheese, bacon, and mushrooms, BUT there was no bacon, 2 mushrooms, and a very small amount of cheese. Just saying the quality was very lacking. It got a bit better as time went on, definitely expected a better experience.

This restaurant is amazing!  The ambience is great but the food is terrific.  I love the specialty tacos, especially the sweet potato one.  I added chicken to mine and it was the best taco I have ever had.  The chips are homemade and warm.  The guacamole is delicious.  I highly recommend eating at Sol!

this restaurant has the best appetizers and deserts I have ever had. the chef Pablo is an amazing cook and knows his way around Mexican food. he made the desserts very fancy and unique and beautiful. my favorite dessert is chocolate  bread pudding, it was extraordinary. and the cucaracha shrimp appetizer was just to die for. very glad I came here, no regret.

Nice place, watermelon margarita was excellent.  Carnitas street tacos were great, fish special was excellent.  Sweet potato taco was loved by our vegetarian friend.  Traditional guac was lacking in flavor.  Nice servers.  Drinks were slow from the bar and they weren't crazy busy.

Our 4th visit to the restaurant  Great food, horrible service!! Ordered an appetizer but didn't receive it The server (Amy) wasn't too concerned over the error. Tried to order another rounds of drinks but she disappeared  Finally showed attention to us when it was time to clear the plates and deliver the check.

Came to Sol last Wednesday for the 1st time, and I must say that I was very impressed by it.  First, they give you complimentary chips (more like home baked seasoned tostadas) with fresh salsa and bean dip.  You can tell that the salsa is homemade, so it was a nice start to our meal.  We also had 2 specialty tacos (which were delicious) and the pork carnitas.  Let me tell you, the carnitas were out of this world good!  Slow roasted and oh so flavorful....I was seriously considering taking whatever man or woman made them home with me so I could have more at my disclosure!  But the main star of the night was definitely the service.  Our server, Sarah, was absolutely sensational!!  You could tell that she was busy (it was pretty packed in there), however she took the time to explain and recommend the dishes, and even gave us a brief tequila class.  I have never had a server that was so passionate about tequila before!  It made me really want to learn more about the pairings , process etc that tequila can provide, so I definitely plan to come back in order to delve into this some more. :)  Overall, good food and outstanding service!!  Can't wait to go back to enjoy the food and learn more about tequila!!

Food poisoning. Do I even have to write more? Ordered take out on Memorial Day and saw the fried duck leg taco which sounded unique and different, along with one other taco. Woke up at about 3am sick to my stomach and got ill about 12-15 times. Needless to say I won't be back.   Not to mention extremely overpriced at $8-10 for one taco  à la carte.

I think the carnitas were amazing but the chips could be a little bit better. The service was sub-par.... We got here around 9:30pm and didn't see a server until almost 20 minutes later. He did give us house margs for $5 though!! We will be back ;)

Great Mexican joint in Scottsdale commons. Nice area to walk around and for shopping as well. Have iPic and the Apple Store there as well. Restaurant is modern and  has a bar. Drinks are awesome. If you check in w yelp you get a 5 dollar margarita drink coupon. Their street tacos are really good esp carne asada. I tried to order the wild fish but they were out of it.  Staff are friendly and helpful. Went with my twin boys and they were extremely accommodating. Would also recommend for a date night or happy hour.  Great place for lunch. Came here on a Wednesday afternoon. We were seated right away. I got the garlic chicken torta which was excellent. If you like spicy get the ghost pepper Salasa. Our waiter Alberto was amazing and helpful. If you work in the area would highly recommend coming here.

Love this place, especially for Taco Tuesday! They have the best fish tacos, which make me really want to visit Ensenada! All of the servers are super nice and explain the menu items super well. Alberto was our server tonight and he was super friendly. He was always checking up on us and making sure we had what we needed.

Overpriced, not authentic but comes with the territory.  It's Scottsdale, and when your in an upscale neighborhood it always seems the restaurants do not feel they have to go the extra mile towards pleasing their customers because they will always get more.  I'm giving a 3 star because our server was very friendly and she was a real person. The food was ok.  If you want to eat at a great restaurant at the same prices, try The Mission in Old Town! You will not regret it.  It's only 5 miles away.

We went here on a Saturday night and they had a 20 minute wait, no problem because we could have easily spent an hour walking around the area. The wait was just what they said and once inside we immediately liked the ambiance of SOL. The waitress was pleasant and we were off to a good start. I liked the salsa and thought the tortillas in place of chips was a nice touch and delicious too. We ordered the goat cheese and mushroom appetizer and it was a win as well. Now the part that let us down: We ordered the carne asade street tacos and the fish tacos. The fish tacos were just so so and the carne asade bordered on rubbery. It left the experience as disappointing. Especially for ordering what seemed like a signature dish. We might go back sometime, but we wouldn't try these dishes if we did.
Love this place! Alberto is amazing, such a friendly and outgoing server. Happy hour here is where it's at!

Bland. Overpriced. Great vibe and cool spot for drinks, and I mean cold, so bring a jacket.  #carne asada burro was a bean burro with a few a slivers of meat. At $15 I expected more. ##red rice bland and boring.  #black beans same. #fish tacos mush. Were they fried? Breaded? Who knows! #house margarita boring, too much ice. Not sure why (probably because it was just so boring), but I was distracted by the ice-machine ice. Very firm, doesnt melt, decreases the drink volume, done in 4 gulps. Taffer would be proud.  Rubio's easily puts Sol to shame.  Ho hum.

It's a nice place to eat and have drinks with friends or family.  I always order the ceviche and on Tequila Thirsday a flight of what's on special.  The food is good and prices aren't crazy so it's a pretty predictable place to eat. The manager has stopped by every time to ask how the food was and thank us for coming in which I appreciate.  The bad reviews seem all over the place sooooo, to break it down, It's definitely not On The Border but it's not La Hacienda, it sits somewhere in the middle closer to La Hacienda and I think most people will find it predictably good like myself and enjoy it.
The food & ambiance are excellent. I particularly enjoyed the Shrimp Cucarachas and the Hot &  Raw Tropical Ceviche.  The best baja Mexican cuisine in Phoenix!
Don't generally care for Mexican However, the food was excellent  The service was very good  Prices were okay
Everything we tried here was amazing. I had some family visiting from out of town and this place did not disappoint. Try the ceviche, you won't regret it.

This place is horrible. I always avoided it for food, it's just bad especially with so many other options in the area. We decided to go for just drinks and after one round our server abandoned us. Never to be found again. We finally asked someone else to close is out after waiting 30 min in hopes someone would come. We awaited another 15 min as he attempted to find our ticket. We received the tab, no sorry, no anything. We quickly closed out and left. I will NEVER come back, with Eddie Vs, Zinc and North dominating the service and food in that area there's no reason to ever even go back.

Food is very good- reason for the reduced stars is that we asked for the GRILLED SWEET CORN to be cut off the cob. the bartender said the chef refused to do it but she'd get us a steak knife so we could do it ourselves. she said other people have asked and the chef refused. i said - go ask the chef. he still refused, so i said, no thanks. seriously - it's a nice restaurant not a picnic - i don't want to eat a greasy corn cob with my hands and have all that stuff stuck in my teeth. and it takes 2 seconds to cut the corn off the cob but it's going to be really messy if i do it at the bar myself. not sure what the reason is, and while i don't think the customer is always right - i don't think this request; especially since others had made it; was too demanding or burdensome.

My dad told me to find somewhere casual with good food and a super fun vibe, and that's what I found! First off, I'm a margarita on the rocks kind of girl but the frozen one is delicious so when I go back ill order that right away. Secondly, the burrito was a nive size and you get two sides with it Incase you're extra hungry. Thirdly, our waiter Alberto was the most helpful guy I've run into in these parts! Will definitely be coming back next year when I'm in town for spring training, thanks Sol and Alberto!

Any restaurant who brings you a tequila taster before a glass of water has something special going on! I was quite excited for my margarita to arrive. It took about 10 minutes for the drink to arrive. The assured us the drinks were scratch, but boy oh boy, they weren't good. I had just come from another local restaurant that had excellent drinks and horrible chips, salsa, and guac.   This place was the exact opposite. The food was great, and the drinks just didn't taste quite right. I sent my drink back and they brought a me a different version of the same drink, but it was still a no go. I didn't finish my margarita, and neither did my friend - that's saying something.  I'll be seeking out a hole in the wall next go around.

I organized an event for my company at SOL Cocina last month, and we had an amazing time.  Their private room in the back of the restaurant was completely private and spacious, with rustic décor and great lighting.  Shelly was our contact, and she made the menu planning easy - we had a family style menu and everything was delicious.  Get a hold of Shelly Hayes for your next event if you just want to lay back an enjoy your event (*drink in hand) instead of running around like a chicken with your head cut off making sure everyone is happy.
One of the worst in Scottsdale. The few dishes which were good have either been removed or modified. Unfortunately nothing tasted good. This is definitely my last visit.

Environment is very nice .. Staff not too friendly .. Service was not so good .. Food was really good .. I ordered chicken enchiladas and they forgot to add chicken took my plate and brought it back with the chicken on the top of my enchiladas still rated good but I know this is not how it was supposed to be .. Not pleased

First of all I am appalled that anyone actually thinks this is good Mexican food. Obviously anyone thinking so has never had quality Mexican food. There is not a lot of cultural diversity it seems in those who reviewed the restaurant and maybe that's because anyone who is Hispanic would not consider this to be authentic Mexican food.   Bland fusion of wanna be contemporary takes on Mexican classic Baja dishes at best...save your money. It's as authentic as Chipotle across the street. Any idiot can make better guacamole or margaritas. Here is a Latin word to describe the food and drink "desabrido".  The place is pretty and what you would want a Mexican restaurant to look like but it's sad that they think that's enough for the average consumer.   Our table ordered the naked guacamole which anyone can make it was do blah the tostadas it came with where good instead of your typical chips. But the salsas weren't even as hot as the waitress claimed (she said it was a 10 on a scale of 1-10). My tween ate it like nothing it was so bland. The puerto Nuevo shrimp tacos had no seasoning or flavor and the presentation was terrible. The Baja shrimp tacos had none of the avocado sauce the menu claimed and the margarita was watered down and had no salt.  The waitress forgot to take our drink order and we had to ask a busboy for drinks. She also forgot to come back to our table and we waited 40 minutes for the check. I don't mind paying for good food but hate over paying for mediocracy. Really I've had better Mexican food from food lunch trucks.
3 tacos 30 bucks. Saw one the pictures said I'll have this.  big mistake my fault 30 for three tacos?
Took girlfriend for her birthday dinner and was pleasantly surprised. Service was spot on and the dinner was great too.

FABulous!  Met a girlfriend for lunch here yesterday. Great location.  Parking garage right next door.  The chips served before the meal were okay. Not great. Bean dip pretty good. Salsa quite good.  I ordered their beef tacos, it was REALLY good! The meat was tender and cooked perfectly. I don't recall what type of pepper was on it, but the waitress suggested that I get them without it and with the pico sauce on the side (because I'm not a fan of hot spicey). She made the right call, the tacos were perfect without it. I tried the pico sauce and again she was right... even it was too hot spicey for me. I pulled a few of the tomato chunks out to add a nice kick of flavor.  I'll be back. Just won't waste my calories on the chips on the front end!

I've only ever been here for lunch (including today), but I've always found the food to be pretty good! The ambiance is nice on the patio or in the dining room, making it a great place all times of the year. I've only ever ever experienced great service as well. The only slight complaint I have is the price and size of portions. For example, their chicken tortilla soup might be the best I've ever had, but it's almost 9 bucks for a bowl and they don't offer a cup portion. Their chopped salad (which in my opinion really needs an added protein) ends up being about 16 bucks once you add meat to it. These portions are HUGE, which is fine if you're sharing, but totally unnecessary and wasteful otherwise. I'd rather see a more reasonable portion and a more reason price than what they currently offer. I would certainly recommend for lunch, dinner, or happy hour nevertheless!

Out for a relaxing meal with my much-loved wife. Ordered a bunch of appetizers - several hot. All brought at the same time. OK.   Guess what? A minute after the apps arrive, so do the mains! When I squawk that we haven't had a chance to even sample all of the apps, I am assured by the server that the mains can be "kept warm" until we are ready for them. In other words, no fresh ones for us! But, hey, take your time!  Worse still, the food was meh. The chips were actively bad. I mean, this is a Mexican restaurant. In Arizona! Come on!  Diners, why waste an opportunity to enjoy a good meal. Don't bother with this place - you can do better.

I came here years ago and just now returned. We came here for lunch. The chips and salsa were good. We were not too hungry so we ordered some tacos. They were excellent. I don't know why it has taken me so long to return. I live out of state but visit frequently. I will be back!

My work buddy brought me here for my last day of work lunch. He raved about it for a while and finally got to take me.   The decor is really nice and I loved the front entrance with the wood! The food was yummy too - really big portions (at least for me) but everything tasted amazing. I am not usually a huge fan of Mexican, so I tend to go with basics I know I like and try others food to see what else I can get myself into. I had the quesadilla - I know standard and probably boring, but it was really good and big enough that I had it the next day too! My friends had tacos and they were both delish! One was chicken and the other pork if I remember correctly.  We rarely go to that area since we live in Arcadia, and the only reason I was up there was because I used to work there, however on the off chance we are in the area, I would love to take the hubs as he enjoys that cuisine very much!
Great restaurant. I enjoyed the decor a lot. Although it wasn't authentic Mexican food, was still very good. Loved all the food, service was great and I plan on coming back!

I went here for my birthday and had the greatest time ever!! Arnoldo was our server and was the greatest server ever!!! He gave us two free desserts on him for my birthday and he was just the sweetest! Definitely this is the place to go if you are celebrating!

We had dinner at SOL two of our seven nights in Scottsdale. Love the food and the Blackberry/Ginger Margaritas!! Some of the must haves on the menu: Peel and Eat Shrimp, Beet and Watermelon Salad and Kobe Beef Strip Steak!  Luckily we are returning home to Orange County so I have SOL Newport Beach and Solita in Huntington Beach - yummo.

This is in my top two Mexican restaurants (the other being La Santisima in Central Phoenix). The menu at SOL is unique, but delicious, and not so derivative of authentic Mexican that anything is lost. The service is prompt and kind. The atmosphere is kid-friendly, but still a little up-scale, and you can't beat their happy hour on the patio.

If I could give the food four stars and the service one star, I would. That being said, perhaps I went into this restaurant on a bad day. Initially, the service was great and our waiter, Rodrigo was certainly trying his best, but the dining experience fell short and the horrible service was a distraction from the great food. At one point, I had to wait fifteen minutes to have my glass of water refilled as I tried to catch the attention of a waiter and watched the table next to us have their glasses refilled twice. To say the least, the experience was odd. For such a nice (and moderately expensive restaurant) a couple of the servers had terrible adequate. Personally, I go out to eat for the entire experience. If I had wanted good food, I could've made it for myself at home...dining out should be about more than just an expensive meal and attractive decor. I don't think I would go back if given the choice. Ultimately, despite the good food, SOL Cocina left a bad taste in my mouth.

Was looking for a new spot to check out for dinner and stumbled upon this place. First impression....the girl at the hostess stand, was very much not the hostess and didn't seem to have a clue what was going on. Somebody finally came over that understood what was happening and seated us on the patio. Our server was great and attentive. The chips and salsa are different than what you expect, but delicious at that! For dinner, we ordered the pork carnitas and chicken quesadilla. Everything was outstanding. The prices are a bit steeper than you would expect at a typical Mexican restaurant, but that is because this is not typical. It is more authentic and less Tex Mex. I would love to come back and try some of the other menu items.

We stopped in for some lunch with friends.  This was our first time here.  Service was very good, attentive and well spoken.  The food was very good, I had the carne asada street tacos and my wife had carnitas street tacos.  The table chips and sauces were great.  Overall this was a very great experience, we will be back.

Excellent margaritas. We Started with the tableside shaken Grande Clase Azul Margarita and an appetizer or of the Chile Gordo and the Sweer Grilled Corn. All were excellent. The Chile Gordo however is only for one person, sharing is a little sparse. Next we split the Carne Asado Street Taco plate which was excellent. Great atmosphere, great service.  We will be back.

4.5 Stars  Tried a few food items:  *The tortillas and salsa - surprised the salsa wasn't spicier. The bean dip they also place on the table was tasted but it lacked any flavor so after one taste, I didn't go back for another.  *Guacamole Sol - bursts of flavors and I wish we ordered two! *Chorizo and Mushroom Queso - by far a favorite thing we tried but eat it while it's hot. When it gets cold it's not the same and it's not as tasty.  *Grilled Sweet Corn - flavorful and just enough grill taste.  *Street Tacos - we ordered the shrimp and steak. The steak was okay but the shrimp with the mango salsa was bursting with flavor.  *Peel and Eat Shrimp - our second favorite of the dishes we tasted. The shrimps are a great size, the seasoning is lick-your-fingers delicious.   All of the dishes were amazing. We also tried their Cucumber Jalapeño Margarita. Yummy. The only down side to our experience was our server. He wasn't very attentive and we had to ask other servers passing by for additional items.

Came to SOL Mexican Cocina for Tuesday date night for some tacos. We had gotten there and waited for a table and was quickly sat outside as asked. When we sat down we ordered some drinks and some happy hour food. There was live music coming from the inside but had speakers so we could hear from outside. When we got the food our street tacos seem to be very salty. Taco deals are a good deal, but the only downfall is that they're over salted (the pork, chicken, and beef). The service was fairly good, only had forgotten the side of sour cream which came out extremely watery. Might come back to try other menu items since we live so close by, but would definitely have to skip on the tacos.

I've been here several times, each time I get something different, I grew up on mexican Pueblo food, the real rustic stuff, nothing will ever compare. However, this place comes close with their tacos, rice and frijoles a la olla. The mole could use a little spice. But I love the pumpkin seeds garnish. I'm spanish I eat alot of hot stuff...this is the only thing missing from this menu

Sat at the bar. Female bartender Devin was really nice and friendly. Decent tequila selection (expected though). Ceviche and goat cheese peanut dishes were awesome, but the chicken tacos were a little dry and needed salt.  All and all, I would go back.

I had the beer battered taco, the filet and shrimp taco the house margarita and mango con chile margarita. My fiancé had the cucarachas (shrimp) and the duck taco and the fish tacos..  well the duck had this sauce that was sweet with a little spice , avocado and I kept going for his food, that duck was perfect. My beer battered shrimp taco was my favorite! And my steak and shrimp had avocado and chile I put a little lime and it I finished my food despite on how full I was, it was mouth watering. Quick service although the restaurant was completely full and very nice manager on duty made us and every other customer feel cared for. Must've been a smooth night because the vibe was just perfect. Casual enough, fancy a little but I didn't give it 5 stars for nothing.
Great happy hour! best sweet potato tacos ! A little pricey for Mexican but so worth it
Great food! The guac with mango and goat cheese is a must. I also recommend the spicy marg and the carne asada quesadilla.

My boyfriend and I came here on a friday night for the first time and were extremely pleased with our service and food. Arnoldo went above and beyond with his recomendations and overall knowledge of the menu. Arnoldo helped us to decide on every item and we devoured everything! We loved our experience and definitely will be back.

Nothing to write home about.   The service and ambiance are fine. The naked guacamole, bland. The street tacos, cold. Although  they have a nice variety to choose from.   We ordered some carne asada and garlic mezcal chicken tacos. The charbroiled chicken was rubbery and tough. Like chewing an eraser. I had to check it several times to see that it was cooked thoroughly.   On the plus side, the salsa is very good. The sides, quinoa-great, black beans, tasty. Spicy coleslaw, great.   It wasn't that busy, yet the food was substandard. Sorry.

I love this place!  One of my favorite restaurants in the SFV.  There margaritas are awesome and the signature lava Bowl   "Special of the House" for two or three is amazing! Great atmosphere and good service.  You won't be disappointed.

made a last minute reservation here. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. the atmosphere was fun for a Saturday night, definitely both couples and groups of friends enjoying themselves. however, the food left something to be desired. our tortillas were too chewy/tough to be enjoyable and the fish in the fish tacos was too dense (not flaky). Maybe a good choice for meeting friends for apps and drinks but don't come for just the food.

We had a delicious dinner after being at a conference all day. We were seated immediately and the ambiance is beautiful.   Our waiter was beyond fabulous and he made some recommendations. Our server greeted us and then brought us black bean dip, salsa and chips. The dip was very good and it comes with all meals. I ordered the strawberry margarita and it was so dang good. I ordered that based upon all the Yelp reviews and it didn't disappoint.   For the entree I ordered the naked burrito with carne asada and my husband ordered a shrimp burrito. We also tried the elote corn. Everything was delicious and it was so much food. Although I ordered mine naked it came out regular. I ended up just eating the inside of the burrito which is what I wanted.   I recommended this place to my colleagues the next day. If I'm ever in Scottsdale again I'll be back.

Decided to eat here after passing by multiple times. Apparently on Sunday, they have live music which was great. They guy had a great voice. Our server Lane was awesome. I had a watermelon margarita that was great. The other people in my party had margaritas too. They had nothing but good things to say about them. The food is made fresh from scratch. We ordered all kinds of tacos and quesadillas. Food was great. The only issue was the portion size. Trust me and get 2 orders of whatever taco you decide on. Other than that no complaints. We will definitely be returning.

Dined here with a few of my friends and took advantage of the happy hour specials.  We ended up going on a Tuesday which happens to be Taco Tuesday there.  Should be mandatory of every Mexican restaurant to have Taco Tuesday specials.  We started with the mushroom and chorizo con queso which was good.  Had the 6 pack of street tacos for $11 which was a great deal.  The beer battered fish was the best, the the chicken taco was a little dry and the pork has pockets of fat that were very unappealing.  Also added a viper taco.  It was supposed to have ghost chili on it.  While it had a bit of heat, definitely wasn't anywhere near the hottest item ever had.  And for $7 just for 1 taco I did feel cheated.  Overall it was ok.  Happy hour items/prices are pretty good but would not be all that happy paying regular menu prices.

My manager and I came here for dinner on a Monday night while she was in town. I had never been here before, but had passed by it many times and was excited to try. We arrived around 6:30 and there wasn't a wait for our party of 2. We decided to start with drinks and apps and catch up for a bit before ordering dinner. I had a large house margarita which was good. The black bean dip and tomatillo salsa they bring out was very delicious, though I wish they had normal sized chips as opposed to the tostadas that they have to break. We also ordered the naked guac, which was really good but very very small for the price.   For the main event, I decided on the carne asada tacos and we shared an order of grilled sweet corn. The corn was really good, I'd get those again. The carne asada tacos were okay. We waited a little longer than normal for our food and it wasn't hot, but not cold enough for me to complain. I may have enjoyed them more had they been hotter. Our server was great and I liked the atmosphere. I saw they have live music some nights and a pretty good happy hour so I'd likely return.

Great food. Tried it for the first time at the Yelp Sol Train event. Was able to try the guacamole, chicken quesadillas, carne asada as well as pork carnitas street tacos and frozen margaritas. The food was all really flavorful, however a the mushroom quesadilla and pork carnitas tacos had a surprising and unexpected kick to them. Food was great though. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other menu items!

Stopped into Sol from hearing a bunch of great reviews! Well those people were not wrong! The atmosphere, food, and service was great! I went on a whim and asked our bartender Wally to just choose our drinks, appetizers, and entrees for us. He did not disappoint! Also made us some killer margaritas and was very knowledgeable on all of their tequilas! Can't wait to go back! Wally kicks A$$!
Recently moved to Scottsdale and love Mexican. Stopped here just to try it out. Was so tasty. Had fabulous tacos with sweet potato in it. I will be coming back. Very good

The food was just okay. The taco chips were tasteless and too thick. The menu is very limited and although we were there early on a Saturday night, the waitress came back to tell me my meal was sold out. She should have known that before I ordered. The décor is very pretty, but the acoustics made conversation difficult.

Poor quality black beans taste horrible.  Ordered the chicken burrito in which I could not find hardly any chicken. The guacamole dip was extremely small for the price. Finally you will die of thirst by the time they get around to filling your water glass. I also asked for small extra salsa which was ignored.  Please go elsewhere as you will be disappointed on multi levels.
Awesome place.   Worth trying to see if it's your style.   Great service and food.  Reasonably priced.   No complaints

Loved the ambiance, the service and the food.  Checked in with Yelp and got the $5 Skinny Margarita, which had a perfect blend of tart and sweet. Once seated, you are welcomed with a basket of small saucer sized tortillas, some sprinkled with what appeared to be chili pepper and some without. Alongside the tortillas, come the salsa and the bean dip. oh the Bean Dip!!!! It was one of my favorite parts of the meal. The bean dip is warm and so rich with flavor. I loved the roasted pumpkin seeds in the bean dip with gave it a wonderful nutty flavor with a crunch. The salsa was so-so... lacked a bit of flavor. I think that's why they also give you small plate alongside the salsa with a trio of salt, habanero sauce and limes to kick it up a notch.   I ordered the Goat Cheese Enchiladas. oh my! I loved it. The enchilada sauce was perfection. The sauce was such a well balance of citrusy-tangy-salty, I could lick the plate. Side dishes were spicy coleslaw and the quinoa. Both which were good but not something memorable.   Hubs got three different tacos. Which I wasn't a big fan of. The tortillas are not hard nor soft. They come out slightly toasted which if you don't eat them fast enough, gets very chewy and tough. I did like the Viper Taco though. It had that simmering seething heat that I love. The beans and rice were meh.  Service was good and informative. The ambiance was cozy and romantic. I liked the open kitchen concept as well.

The best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. Blends so many unique flavors and serves the greatest chips and salsa/bean dip. I could not recommend this place more. Excellent service. The staff is very flexible. We made our reservation but got there a half hour early. They seated us almost immediately. Must try!
Fromosas. Enough said. Still the food is amazing! Corn on the cob appetizer is a must!

Came here to meet up with my friend and her boyfriend and was able to snag a bit of space at the bar- it was a PEREFCT Arizona evening, so it's awesome they have an outdoor bar. The ambiance and lighting is wonderful! I like the open kitchen too. Its a little tight space though inside it seems like.  I got a drink (Strawberry Basil Martini) and the cocount calamari which I 100% recommend! Their chips and salsa are amazing too!!   I just googled to try to figure out which drink I got and found out there is one in Newport Beach?! So close....  Convenient parking too :)
The Duck was delicious.  Crispy, flavorful and not greasy.  Staff was friendly, informative and patient as we had a baby with us.

Ok. Meh. I hate that word, meh. It's something that reminds me of Minnesota. But so does this place. I don't know why. Our server was attitudinal. The food was hit and miss. I felt like they were all about the $$. I need to pay now. For $45.21, I'm all full. That's all I can muster.

Delicious food, excellent service, beautiful decor!! My boyfriend and I had an amazing experience!! I recommend the mango mimosas and chilaquiles! Love it!! Oh and they have live music! Such a nice touch!!

Had lunch at SOL.  It's touristy.  Very touristy.  So that means we had slow service and overthought, overpriced food.  Almost forgot the weak, expensive margaritas.  SOL is the last place I'd pick if I wanted a bite to eat at Scottsdale Qtr.   It wouldn't even cross my mind if I wanted Mexican Food.

We went here for happy hour because we thought they had a pretty good hh menu. sooooooo....The interior of this place is beautiful! The service was good. 3.50 for all beers, heck yes! Onto the food I go; the tostadas and salsa was pretty good, nothing special. my boyfriend ordered the shrimp cocktail which was ok, nothing to rave about, I actually like the one from food city better. I got the shrimp "cucarachas" ( it was kind of disturbing they were calling it cockroaches) anyway so it came it and it was whole shrimp with eyes and everything...they looked like cockroaches :/...they were too spicy to enjoy.   The prices for the appetizers didn't seem bad until the portions came out. The portions are able to fill up a 3 year old. It's definitely overpriced for less than mediocre food. Brio next door has a better happy hour and better food.
No Air Conditioning.... Hot and Humid inside..... Sweating while trying to spend time with friends.....  just asked for check. Going to a Restaurant that has A/C..

Had reservations for dinner - requested patio seating and the staff had a reserved table waiting for me and my lady when we arrived. Or server Stephanie was awesome - food and drinks fabulous as expected. Thanks for making a special evening!

Sol was a really pleasant surprise during our vacation.  It has a great ambience with indoor/outdoor seating and an indoor/outdoor bar.  The food is super inventive Mexican fare and incredibly flavorful.  I especially loved the short rib tacos, and their guac is to die for.   The tacos came with a quinoa salad with cranberries that was wonderful. Amazing cocktails as well.  Definitely not your ordinary Mexican restaurant!  Highly recommend.

I was not greeted never ever greeted I sat out side had to walked in to ask for help the blonde with the fake boobs told me to go outside to the bar which there was no one at the bar this is worst service ever ever ever ever in a restaurant that bitch should be fired or this restaurant need to be shut down March 21 2018

This was our fourth time dining here and have always enjoyed our previous experiences. This night was extremely disappointing.  We took friends with us, that had never been there, and we were very embarrassed.  We had no problem with the service, but the food, at best, was mediocre.  Everything came out cold.  I ordered the carne asada tacos, which is something I have ordered before.  The tacos were wet and soggy; the rice and beans were also cold, and half the amount of which is normally on the plate.  I don't know if they have a new chef, but this was a waste of time and money.  If we decide to go back, it will be a while.  It is a shame because this is a very nice venue.

Was not impressed.  This restaurant is located in a trendy shopping plaza, surrounded by trendy and boutique stores.  I should not have been surprised by the dining experience but I was.  The restaurant smelled of fish, not pleasant cooked or spicy fish, but just plain fish.  If I had been eating at the pier this would have been ok, but even after I got home that evening my clothes even smelled like fish.  The food was supposed to be trendy mexican, but I got more of a hipster feel from it.  They just tried too hard.  The salsa's had a little flavor but were not unique.  The appetizers had great presentation but again the flavor was not unique (coconut calamari and guacamole sol).  The salad (ensalada sol) was not memorable.  The street tacos; chicken was dry, the pork was greasy and SALTY, I stayed away from the beef.  The server forgot my dessert.  Wouldn't recommend it, won't return to it.
Loved the corn appetizer and the garlic grilled shrimp with red rice was amazing. Only con is that it's a little loud but that would not stop me from going again.
Great tacos! And, the calamari appetizer is a must have. We really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Try the quinoa instead of rice and beans for a change. You won't regret it!

We really enjoyed this place. Tacos are amazing. Bar service is prompt and attentive. Gio is a fantastic bartender. Extremely knowledgable about tequilas. Very friendly. We will be back specifically to see him!

I did not have a problem getting seated.  True, the place was almost at capacity.  Service was excellent.  Loved the black bean dip provided with the corn chips.  My wife tried the carne asada quisadilla.  The taste, presentation, options, and quantity we're great.  The side of couscous (probably misspelled) was excellent.  Nice atmosphere and adornment.

I have mixed feeling about this place. I saw so many four star reviews so I decided to try this place.   When we walked in we were seated right away by the host. The place was decorated very modern with dim lights. Lots of large tables for big parties. The host told us that our server was too busy to help us so he was going to serve us. First time I've ever heard if this. The host was able to tell us about the menu and was very helpful. The place had lots of people but wasn't that busy. We were the only table being served by the host. I thought this was strange and we saw the server. I didn't think he was that busy to take our order. Oh well so be it.   So I ordered the Carne Asada Street Taco Plate. This came with 3 tacos, black beans, and rice. I wasn't too impressed. I thought it was pretty bland. No taste at all. My son had the Grilled Chicken Burrito and it came with rice and beans. The Burrito has huge. I tried a portion of this and it was as bland as the Street Tacos. My wife had the Ensenada (fish) Taco Plate and she was not impressed either. At first I thought it was just my dish but after trying everyone's dishes I got to say the food was just bland.   So since our server was our host, it seemed like we were ignored a lot. The server bypassed our table and filled all the other tables except ours. We all recognized that and thought that was very rude. After we were almost all finished then the server started to take care of us. Filled our cups and gave us more chips. Little too late.   I don't understand why the host had to serve us. There was a table after us that got seated and their server helped them out. Why were we targeted only? This didn't help make our meal enjoyable and the food just didn't seem up to par.   All I have to say is I'm very disappointed at the service and food.

Great service that you can count on. Everything on the menu is great and be sure to try the appetizers. The sweet corn and coconut calamari will be a full meal for a couple on date night and the entrees are made like mom was in the kitchen with lots of love. Definitely try the short rib entree if you're a meat lover and you'll be impressed. The sauce is the perfect spice level for even the weakest taste buds with tons of flavor. We will be back and recommending to friends and family.

Had to give Sol 5 stars simply because of the super friendly and helpful staff.  Food was good, had the street taco fight which consists of 6 tacos and an order of guac.  While I have had better Mexican food for cheaper it was still very nice, fresh and was all well made. Atmosphere was nice and pleasent except that they kept opening up a side door to do cleaning which let in a lot of unwanted cold air. Normally I would knock down a star except for the great staff.
I like this place, service was good the waiter was great, me and my wife tried the tacos they didn't disappoint. The chavela's were good,  It was a nice place to go have a drink and some tacos .

Absolute disappointment to have a lunch for 8 people. They ran out of bean dip and drinks and then upcharged us for jalapeños and cheese. Slapped the menu and the bill on our table and didn't even ask if we would want dessert. No apology and management didn't care. They had some bridal shower or party in the back room and didn't care of customers sitting in the front. Then why keep the restaurant open? there are so many places to eat in the valley. Food was good but service get ZERO points.

I love this restaurant!! I have been a fan of the Newport Beach location for years. Scottsdale definitely did not disappoint! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The drinks are fresh (worth the extra wait for the tasty Cucumber Jalapeño marg). And the food? Goes without saying, it's CRAVE worthy. This is a new location, so I expected the usual growing pains. But overall, a great dining experience. Welcome to the neighborhood, SOL Cocina!

We were in the mood for some Mexican style food this weekend and after discussing some options decided to stop at SOL and wow are we happy we did. I'm giving this place 5 stars all around for the service, food, drinks, and interior. We started off the night with some margaritas which I had the cucumber jalapeno and pineapple serrano which both were spicy with a little sweetness they were great. They start you have with their round crispy tortilla chips and some bean dip with salsa while you order. For the entree I had the grilled fish zarandeado tacos which were packed with flavor and had pineapple as well. The great thing about the food is that SOL focuses on the quality of the food and not so much on the extras like cheese and sauces etc. Everyone in our group were exceptionally pleased with the entrees and appetizers. After the meal we had saw that there was a 100 year old Grand Marnier on the menu and had to see what it tasted like. It was so smooth and delicious! Sol is a one of the restaurants at the quarter that you must try and no matter what you try you'll be happy with and if you not sure ask the staff they were great with suggestions and pairing. Overall a wonderful great experience and we will definitely be going back.
The food was excellent - nice music for Mother's Day. Probably would get even better service when it is not a holiday, but overall, a really great place to go.

Great Mexican food.  I had the Carnitas and they were spot on.  Very Tender and moist with fantastic flavor.  My wife had their chicken quesadilla and she being the queen of quesadillas said it was the best she had ever eaten.  It was good if i don't say so myself.  Staff very helpful and friendly.  Restaurant is very clean and the bathrooms are immaculate.  Very highly recommended!
This place was great.  Good atmosphere, great service and tasty food.  I would recommend checking this place out.  Try the quinoa cranberry side salad

The restaurant has a nice ambiance to it, the food was presented spectacularly and best of all it tasted delicious. Our server Katie was awesome, you should request her the next time you come in. Thanks for a great experience!

I came to Sol because i had been searching The area for a good margarita, which is surprisingly hard to find, and let me tell you they did not disappoint. I had the Jalapeño/cucumber margarita and it was amazing. The entire experience was great. Everything from the chips to my carnitas torta was amazingly good.

The food may be good, but I wouldn't know since this place asked me to wait for over two hours to be seated for a table for three.  To be fair, we went in on a Friday night around 7:00 with no reservation.  There were quite a few people waiting for tables and the restaurant was overflowing with people.  I placed my name in with the hostess and was informed it would be a 45-55 minute wait.  Fair enough - seems like a reasonable amount of time to wait on a Friday with no reservations. We wasted time by walking around Scottsdale Quarter and having a juice drink at True Food. We ventured back to Sol and were able to find a spot at the bar.  I had the skinny margarita, which was tasty enough, but nothing special. My guy had the house margarita and he said it was average.  After an hour of waiting, I went to check on our table. The hostess said it would be another 25 minutes for our table to be ready.  We were enjoying the people watching, but growing hungry nonetheless. We decided to wait sice we had already waited this long.  After another 35 minutes, my beau, who is not as rational as I am, went to speak to the hostess and was told it would be yet another half hour. At this point we were looking at a two hour wait with no end in sight. How could we trust them not to ask us to wait another 30 minutes? We left, but not before my cranky guy chewed out the manager. Maybe you could chalk this up to the growing pains of a new restaurant, or the inability of a young staff to properly gauge the wait and manage their tables, but my experience left me thoroughly disappointed and I will not be going back to try the food any time soon.
I thought SOL was very good. The chips and salsa is the best part (HA) but the food is great as well! Very impressed with the service. I will be back.

This was our first visit to this restaurant yesterday, and it was an outstanding experience. Although it was a busy Saturday afternoon, the service was still absolutely outstanding. The food was high-quality, with fantastic taste. The atmosphere inside of the restaurant is superb. You can choose to self Park adjacent to the restaurant, or utilize the valet parking directly outside of it. I would highly recommend this place.

Great service, manager came to check in with us a few times which was nice! The margaritas are delish! The coconut calamari is awesome! The prime rib tacos were the best ones of all the ones we had. I didn't love their chips but it seems like a lot of Mexican restaurants tend to have chips that I don't love. Otherwise, great place!!

Very disappointing!! Waited 20 minutes for a table. Was seated ii front of the live performer, it was so loud, hard to hear anyone at the table talk and even had to yell to place an order. A server brought us the wrong food and then brought our food to the wrong table. Placed it in front of those guests and then realized it was wrong and brought it to our table which kinda grossed me out. My steak taco was completely inedible. It was soaked in grease and the one bite I took it just tasted like grease so I sent that back. The street tacos were small and covered in cabbage that made the whole taco bitter. The complementary chips were good, salsa was good, bean dip was bland. I gave two stars because the server was very understanding did not charge us for the grease Taco and brought the check quickly so we could get out of there'. Wouldn't go back.

Great atmosphere, food and service. The guacamole is so fresh tasting. I had the shrimp quesadillas and my husband had the chicken burrito, both entrees were flavorful and filling. Great spot for date night or happy hour with friends. I would definitely recommend SOL to visitors as it has a warm Spanish style feel.
Food so authentically Mexican, Trump would want to build a wall around it! ... Sit at the bar because Wally the bartender is fun, engaging and he pours some mean drinks!

Just a quickie update. 2013 is the year of the taco. And I was in the area and was craving lunch from SOL Cocina.   I ordered first a beer, Victoria. This is a Vienna Lager style beer. A light beer basically. My man brought me tostada circles dusted with spices, and salsa on the side. I ask for the Carnitas Street tacos, three of them showing heirloom pork slow-roasted & shredded, chicharron, avocado, onion & tomatillo salsa. $11.  Then I want a shot straight up of Ilegal Mezcal Respo, an untamed, exceptional handcrafted, small batch tequila. $18.  Today, I simply enjoyed a very comfortable house with a vibrant menu full of authentic Mexican flavors.

Good decor, good location...........that's about it. After we were told it was a 45-55 minute wait we headed to the bar. We were at the bar for a good ten minutes before a bartender came over to help us. The main bartender working outside, wouldn't even acknowledge us let alone get our drink order. This was noticed by all the other bar guests who were commenting on it. One even suggested that if we showed cleavage we would get quicker service. Then our beeper vibrated signaling our table was ready...............oh but apparently it vibrated "accidentally". When we finally got our table, we waited for our waitress Tracy to come over. That was another 10 minutes of waiting to be greeted because she could not handle the 6 tables she had. She was perfectly nice, but service was slow and food was average. Nothing about this experience would make me to again for this type of food and definitely not this type of service.
The margaritas were very good and the tacos we're pretty good as well. I loved the volcanes taco, and surf n turf taco.  Fun ambiance and would recommend for large groups
Everything was delicious! Besides the Queso dip. I hate stringy cheese. If it were creamier like fundido, it would be better. I had the jalapeno cucumber margarita and it was amazing:)

Food was a four star rating BUT I almost walked out before I ordered. Our waitress was so condescending, rude and was rushing us to order. If it wasn't for her that it would be a five star rating. If you like service from a waitress that makes you feel small as she holds her hand on her hip tapping her foot anticipating you to order stupidly, then this is the place for you. Although the chile rellenos were off the hook we will NOT return. Carmen made our $257.00 dinner for four disappointing and unforgettable for all the wrong reasons.

My family and I came to Sol last Monday evening. Based on my last visit I suggested this place as food and service were excellent.  This visit was not very pleasant as our server I believe Veronica is her name was not very attentive.  We had to wait a while before she came to the table and then she kept coming back very far apart. She kept going to chat and laugh with another young lady which seem to be friends or family.  We felt very disappointed as she spent lots of time with her ignoring all the guests around.  On top of that when we asked questions her demeanor was awful and arrogant.     Food was great with lots of flavor.  I usually only write positive comments, but this has being stuck on our minds and it has being the theme of conversation for a couple of days.

Rarely do I write 2-Star reviews, so I'll try to make this as constructive as possible:  SOL is good for large groups and they accept reservations online. Their staff will call the day of to confirm your rez and even seat your party if the entire group isn't present at the time of your reservation.  I was visiting Scottsdale and had family in town as well, the location and easy reservations system on a Saturday night seemed like a win-win.  The menu of drinks far outweighs the food, which for a 30-something adult is fine. Probably not so much for my retired parents or teenager cousin. We all found something to order and food came out relatively quickly, which was great for a busy evening with a big group.  The worst part of the night is when they lost my Dad's credit card. The bill was presented, I watched my Dad put his card in the bill folder and somewhere between the table and the register/POS system, no one knows what happened.   Our group spent 15 minutes searching the dining room with cell phone flashlights looking for a black credit card. Our server and the manager did some investigating as well. No luck. They did find a credit card at the hostess stand but it didn't belong to my Dad, which was actually less comforting at that point.  Eventually our meal was comp'd but the manager never spoke to us and the server just gave up looking. There was an exchange of contact information in case the card was found, but my Dad canceled his card ASAP and never did hear back from the restaurant.   Mistakes happen, that's to be expected anywhere. How it was handled (aka customer service) wasn't so great.

I'm vegetarian and the black bean and sweet potato tacos were good. Not over the top good, but good nonetheless.  Chips and dips brought to the table were good, but the "chips" were  tostada shells that you had to break apart, which was weird.  Service and ambiance were great, but only 3 stars for the ok food, which was overpriced (even for Scottsdale) and forgettable.
This is an incredible place to gather with friends, have margaritas and everything on the menu is fantastic!

We had a party of 10. They're very busy (good sign) and were able to get us in with one day notice. We had a variety of dishes. Major highlights were the fish tacos, the Vampiro, the chile relleno, the carnitas street tacos, shrimp tacos, short rib tacos. Service was excellent and we am were all commenting on how we were excited to return. We highly recommend SOL Mexican Cocina. Do the specialty tacos!

As my daughter was about to drink her glass of water - she noticed a bolt/screw in the bottom of her water glass! What was the worst part of this --- our waiter, each time he showed up at our table, was blaming my daughter for putting a screw in her glass. He said, how many more bolts do you have in your pockets? I get it--I can see where you can find the humor in this situation -  but it got to the point where he was obnoxious on blaming her - which ruined our lunch. The final straw was when he removed her plate of food from the table, and even took her fork searching for more bolts - saying "is there anymore in here?" Wow--really??? WE DID NOT PUT A SCREW IN OUR WATER?! It was rude and uncalled for.   We loved our guacamole! We split a delicious steak burrito steak. The steak was cut into small pieces and was just not enough of it for the price. We had house marg and pineapple and couldn't tell the difference in flavor.  We ate here April 5 2017, for lunch on the patio, our waiter was male, had brown hair and glasses.   Yah - we got "screwed" .... !

Was in town visiting family over the holidays and we went to SOL for the first time; so great!! It was brunch time so I ordered a mango mimosa and the crab and shrimp eggs benedict. The food was different and such a nice change from the typical tex mex I am used to having. Everyone that I was with loved SOL and their food!

Had an amazing evening with my husband while visiting Scottsdale. We were looking for a unique, nice restaurant and ended up choosing SOL. We're SO glad that we did. First of all it's in a really cool location, but also on a somewhat busy road. We sat outside, and were seated quickly on a Friday night.   We started with the $5 house margaritas using the Yelp deal. They were tasty. Then we got some chips, salsa and beans complementary. The beans were a pleasant surprise. Then we ordered the coconut calamari. It was honestly hard to pick which appetizer to choose...they all sounded amazing.   So the coconut calamari was probably the best fried calamari we've ever had. It was huge, and perfectly crispy but not overly oily or anything. And the sauce was a spicy lime sauce I think? It was sooo amazing. I'd highly recommend this appetizer over anything else here just because it was so good.   For the main course, I ordered the fish dish, this time it was a Grouper fish covered in crusted almonds on top of a bed of this corn soupy thing. It was seriously amazing. It was also so different than anything that I'd ever ordered at a Mexican restaurant which is exactly what I was going for. The corn soup thing was like full corn kernels in this creamy salsa ish soup. Yeah it was awesome.   He ordered the carne asada burrito. It was also really good, he couldn't even finish the whole dish because there was so much food. He loved the meat and the flavors in the burrito.   Overall this place has the portions of your classic Mexican restaurant but literally everything is homemade including all of the 20+ sauces. Highly recommended!!

They are always busy so  if you don't make a reservation it's quite possible that you will have to wait a while.  They have a good food.Not the best but good.  Pricing is okay too but when compared with food that you get there price could be cheaper.

Yep, A-OK. I guess I had high expectations with the hopes it would be up to par with the Mission in Old Town Scottsdale. Not even close. The tortilla soup I ordered was nothing to write home about. The guacamole was just OK and the tostado chips were cold and not very easy to break which was too bad because their salsa was really tasty. They should consider chips that are easier to dip into that yummy salsa. I would have given this place 2 stars but the salsa was good and their Jalapeno cucumber margarita were both really good. I will probably come back just for the margaritas.
Here for taco Tuesday and it's delicious -- Shrimp tacos are my favorite and the skinny margarita is so refreshing ! Great service by Alberto !! We will be back :)

I made reservations for an inside table, they sat us outside.  We requested inside and there was an attitude.  Maybe they were trying to help us out because inside was about the same temp. As outdoors, but it wasn't pleasant.   Our waitress was attentive, but the food was pretty mediocre.  I will say that my drink was very good....but the food...meh.

Tonight was my third time coming to Sol Cocina. Each time the service has been so good and spot on! It really makes for a quite enjoyable experience. The food was so fresh and full of flavor! We had the ceviche Sol as well as several tacos. The taco vampiro is definitely my favorite as well as the jalapeño margarita! Overall I highly recommend this restaurant  I haven't had this good of service and level of attentiveness even on a busy friday in a long time!

3.5 stars!  My friend and I ordered the SOL Guacamole and their fish tacos at $7.95 eah! I love their fish tacos! They are fresh, flavorful and tasty! I will admit though, earlier I made my own guacamole. The guacamole I made was from an organic avocado with fresh diced roma tomatoes and chopped onions. Maybe it is all in my mind, but I did not feel that the guacamole was organic or fresh at SOL. Maybe I was expecting it to be more flavorful? The chips they had were fresh though and I felt healthier than most. I would definitely come back to eat the tacos though!

I had the shrimp Chile relleno and my husband had the Kobe steak. Both excellent. Had a couple margaritas that were also very good. Our server Eric was very helpful and helped us choose the churro for dessert. Overall an awesome experience. We will be back soon.
Great restaurant. Excellent food at fair prices.   One of our favorite restaurants in Scottsdale!!

The food here has been top notch every time. Not a place to grab a quick bite, but the atmosphere and food are worth it. Pricing is right in line with most other sit-down Mexican restaurants.  Their chorizo cheese dip is great and so are the Tortas.

Was in Scottsdale with my wife on our vacation and Sol was recommended to us.  Nice live music and a very crowded dining room during happy hour... overall it was solid mexican fare with nothing that was overly great.... Basic fare at a fun place.
Food was ok. Service was very slow. They seemed to be understaffed and the bar was severely backed up.

First time visiting, Sunday afternoon lunch. Very pretty restaurant, with unique decorating inside and out. They had a guitarist/mandolin player doing a solo set which gave a nice ambiance. We had their special 'Sol' guac which was tasty, and more than enough for two - avocado, tequila, mango, etc. A specialty taco and a burrito plate for the entree. Everything was fresh and delicious. Even their table chips were high quality and the salsa/bean dip was a nice compliment. Also sampled a house margarita - nice and strong. Friendly staff that helped us with the menu and showed us their shelf of tequilas above the bar. Price was a medium, but it's in Scottsdale Quarter so it should be expected to cost a bit. Would recommend and return.
Sweet potato and black bean taco is a must try! I'm a meat lover but the flavor is amazing!

The comp. salsa and been dip with tostadas was a fun and tasty way to greet us at the table.   Excellent guac with unexpected ingredients like pepitas and goat cheese - delicious!  We're not big into rice/beans so the ala carte tacos options were perfect for us. Each one was packed full of flavor and really, really tasty. Be prepared to spend $30 on 3 tacos (if you like the steak/shrimp options like we do).   Dark Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding was just OK, nothing to brag about and I would not order it again.   Overall, a fun twist on Mexican cuisine with some traditional and unique ingredients.  We'll be back.
Love this place. Best tacos I have ever had. I definitely recommend it to those who are taco lovers.

I had lunch at SOL with a coworker last week. It was ok. The staff was very friendly and overall service was perfectly acceptable. The vibe of the restaurant is very trendy and upscale. They start you off with chips, salsa and bean dip. The chips were weird and tasted burnt almost, but the salsa and bean dip were good enough to cover that funky taste. I had the Eggplant Torta and my coworker had the Carne Asada tacos. My sandwich was good, I would order it again as long as the grease level went down a notch. The side salad was boring as all get out. The $11 price tag seemed reasonable since it was a large portion.  My poor coworker...$15 for 3 tiny dried up tacos that didn't even taste decent. He was really unhappy with his meal.  We had high hopes for SOL, unfortunately it just didn't measure up. Bummer.

I have been to this restaurant twice in one week. I must say first the atmosphere is awesome! I love the casual environment. The service was a ten both times. The food is amazing! Everything from the wild fish to the carne Assad tacos to the coleslaw! Delicious!! Will definitely go back!

Coconut Calamari which is large chucks of meat.  Almost the size of fish sticks!  Delicious and different.  I also love the fish tacos and goat cheese dish.  Not your typical Mexican food......Great food, staff, and location.

What a great find in Scottsdale!  The tacos are creative, well-prepared, and delicious. I had the short rib and blue corn, along with the sweet potato and black bean tacos. Superb!  The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Park in the free garage next door.

Used the yelp $5 off coupon for a Don Juilo margaritta. It was ok- very tart (as the waiter described) not my favorite. I had the duck taco. Presentation of the duck was very nice however it had 3 slices of avocado, raw onion, a lime and orange slice which was very disappointing. It is supposed to be a taco.. why not put  some type of slaw on the side, maybe a unique salsa?? The duck was very tasty but the 'side' item was poor. Would not order it again.
Only tiny tiny issue - if you ask for a patio table via Yelp you most likely will not get one. I was advised at check in that you have to call.

We had a lovely experience on Saturday night...My boyfriend had been here before, I had not.  The server (Rodrigo?) thanked him for bringing me. Server was so friendly, informative, and helpful with my choice.  I had the hot and raw ceviche...Off the chain....Bf had the chicken salad with Avocado vinegarette that he loved and looked delish. Margarita was delish, and the Mexican chocolate cookie dessert was light and lovely.  Will be going back for sure.. oh oh oh...and the music was perfect... Thank you for a wonderful night..

This place gets five stars for service. The hostess and bartender were really nice, and our server, Leah, was over the top. We took forever to order because we were so busy talking and happy to see each other we didn't look at the menu for awhile, but she was great about it. My tortllla soup and fish taco were excellent. She also brought us complimentary dessert because we were celebrating a birthday and engagement. The noise level in the restaurant is low enough that you can have a normal conversation and the decor is really relaxing. Prices are reasonable. Highly recommend

Dined at SOL for lunch with my mother on a Saturday, and was pleased to discover brunch was available.  Armando was our server, and he was very attentive, friendly and made great recommendations to accommodate my food restrictions.  I had the skinny margarita for $5 for checking in on Yelp.  Warm chips, delicious bean dip and a very tasty fresh salsa were a great start while we leisurely read the entire menu.  We shared the naked guacamole, which was a portion perfect for two.  Mom ordered the crab cake Benedict, with eggs poached firm.  This was a beautiful dish to behold, and she really enjoyed the flavors and crispy bacon.  I considered brunch but then decided on the carne asada taco plate with rice and spicy slaw.  The carne was cooked to order, clearly not made ahead, and the steak bites were still pink inside.  Very tender and flavorful, the 3 taco portion was impressive when compared with the tiny tacos at an un-named Mexican restaurant in nearby Kierland Commons.  The rice was as expected, but the slaw was delectable, with pepitas mixed in and a tangy spicy bite.  We thoroughly enjoyed this meal, and proclaimed we would return!

This place was very good.  Great bar with half inside and half outside.   Friendly service and overall great meal.  Try the classic azul margarita.   I had the grilled burrito and it was very good.  Came with a spiced Cole slaw and it was spicy.  They can really hear it up if you want them to.  Salsa was very good.  Bean dip was ok but I am not a big fan of bean dip in general.  Parking is right next to this place.  Very convenient.   I would definitely go back and may end being a staple when in this area.
The service was slow and the food was cold.  The servers are Always rude. Tried a few times and won't go back

If your visiting from another state, try harder for a good Mexican food experience.  I love the Quarter but this place does not represent great Mexican food and or service.  I went with four friends to celebrate National Margarita Day!  The food is over priced and worse yet, it wasn't hot. Service was nice but sloooooow.  We all ordered the same margarita twice and the second one was remarkably different than the first.  The waiter wrote it off to a "different bartender."  So...... there are different recipes depending on who makes it?  Good thing Starbucks doesn't operate this way or they would be out of business.  A $13 margarita should be kick ass.  These were not!  So... if you want overpriced mediocre food and drink with nice but slow service, this is your place.  I'm not sure if you can recommend places in comments but try Dick's Hideaway, Barrio Café, heck, even a little dive restaurant!  Oh, I and I hear the Mission is good.  We will try that next time!
This place just keeps getting better.  Their Kobe steak is awesome and their tacos & ceviches are absolutely delicious.
This is now my favorite Scottsdale area restaurant. I loved the unique takes on Mexican with atypical dishes and combinations. Great service and a nice atmosphere as well.

This has been the single worst experience at a restaurant ever. If I could, I would give them a zero star.  1. We were told we had a 50 minute wait when it ended up being 15. We went out of our way to come over here and they couldn't even estimate our wait time correctly.  2. While we were waiting we got some drinks at the bar. When our table opened up, the bartender acted like we couldn't transfer our bill to our table and tried to charge me for all of our party's drinks.  3. We ordered the sol guacamole and ceviche. The sol guacamole was disgusting and we switched it out for the naked. The ceviche never came.  4. When we sat down we asked for extra salsa and black bean dip. Never came.  5.
