We ordered several tacos since it was taco tuesday. My friend who lives in Phoenix raved about this place and couldn't even eat her sweet potato and black bean tacos. Another friend literally threw up less than 10 minutes after starting eating the Vampiro/Butternut Squash.  6. Another person of our group wanted sour cream. It came out warm, runny, and gross.  7. Our waiter took our order and left us. Another person who was delivering food had to give us more water and give us the sour cream. Our waiter only ever came to check on us after we asked for the manager. That really shows how much he cared about our service.  All in all, I do not recommend this restaurant. I mean, unless you like throwing up.

I am a taco connoisseur, with that being said Sol in the Scottsdale quarter is amazing. Let me start with the service. Arnaldo was easily in the top 3 servers I've ever had at any restaurant... Carmen at Sol is in there as well. When I first came here I ordered a bunch of tacos easily 15 and said no cilantro at all. With my request he did it and the tacos basically came plain. He then saw the upset look on my face and told me how their sauces were made with cilantro and he wanted to make sure I wasn't allergic. Once I told him it was OK he came back with all the sauces and made them table side and explained every one perfectly and they were delicious. Kudos to Arnaldo. Carmen has always put a smile on and has recommended great apps and is just an overall great server and a pleasure. Oh and now they both recognize me when I come in. THE FOOD... To die for. From apps to specialty tacos even down to the street tacos for taco Tuesday. The dessert... LA Guera is addicting and I usually get one to go. (Also the banana chocolate bread pudding)  Thanks guys!

I sat at the outside bar for drinks with my friend while visiting AZ. I ordered a beer Margarita...Was a little confused why the margarita and the beer came separately but whatever....The atmosphere was good, corporate/higher management was obviously visiting while we were there, they were circling the restaurant and asked us if we were okay a million times. But the weather was beautiful and we got to enjoy chips and salsa with our Drinks, so it was a good visit overall.

We came here tonight for dinner. We had Alberto as our server, and he was great! I had the chicken grilled burrito, YUM!! Also, the qeuso appetizer and the Yelp check-in skinny margaritas were very good. We'll definitely be back :)

Came to Sol Mexican Cocina expecting great Mexican food but while is not bad it is not the best either. Had the chicken fajita torta and it was ok, could have had more flavor and seasoning. The service was very good and the ambiance is nice. The burritos are so big that are not as appetizing as they could be. Giant does not mean better in my humble opinion, as long as they are flavor full they can be a bit smaller. I will come back and try it one more time.

Mexican with a little bit of flare. Got the short rib taco which was excellent.  The price was over $10 so I said to the guy that must be one big taco.   Actually it wasnt.  Bigger than those from Taco Bell but certainly not the biggee I was thinking I was getting for thy price. Worth the experience.

I'm surprised how difficult it is to get a good margarita in Scottsdale but I finally found it at Sol. Don't want sour mix? No problem! Fresh fruit? Done. Some different? How about basil?  The good is also very good. We had chips, guacamole, shrimp tacos, quesadillas, pulled pork burritos. All good.   Great vibe / energy as well.

The service was great but their food was just ok. I enjoyed my tacos and loved their quinoa salad. I tried making a reservation through Yelp but the restaurant didn't have my reservation, not sure if the systems are sinked. Despite not having the reservation was seated right away.

Prices are a bit expensive; however I had the shrimp burrito and WOW you get a lot of food and sides with it. Well filling and very tasty. I have heard the tacos are the best from multiple people and intend to try those next.

Really love this place.  Came in for a late lunch a few weeks ago and shared a plethora of tasty mexican goodness.  Started out with the seasoned tostadas + accoutrements of black beans, salsa, hot sauce, salt, lime.  Yum! The Hot and Raw Ceviche was impressive as well as delicious!  They have just the right acid/fruit mix going on. It comes in a giant glass with sweet potato and beet chips which are equally as delectable.  We also ordered the Street Taco Flight.  Make sure you sprinkle some of the salt, lime, and hot sauce on them.  It makes them so much better!   The greatest thing is you don't feel like you just ate a ton of bricks when eating here. Everything is really fresh and light and refreshing.   Even the chocolate bread pudding was really good.    I'll be back to try more!

I have eaten hear several times. The food has always been very good as well as the service. This place is good for large parties. I brought company out of town guests over 10 people and they accommodated us nicely. My husband and I were there just the two of us and it was equally enjoyable. We'll return
I'm in town for a business meeting and came here from all the great reviews. We had the BEST service! Thank you Beto!!! food was amazing and the atmosphere was  great! Highly recommend!!

I am a Mexican Food snob. This place was phenomenal!!! Damn, I might have move to Scottsdale just to eat here every week! The guacamole with Mango and Goat cheese was some of the best I ever had. The shrimp tacos were great too. Fabulous atmosphere and impeccable service. Great place for date night. You gotta try this place!

It's hard to believe it's taken me this long to try and review SOL. I am not much of a happy hour guy but SOL happens to be listed in the top ten places for happy hour in Scottsdale which piqued my interest.  The decor and ambiance are great with light music and very attentive service. I started with a frozen strawberry margarita which was delicious and included fresh strawberry pulp and puree. The menu is quite extensive and varied but only one item caught my attention for consumption: the duck carnanita, a scrumptious deep fried duck leg confit served with three small corn tortilas enough to make three of your own little tacos accompanied by a blackberry sauce, chopped onions and avocado...it was truly a mini feast...and enough to warrant ordering a second one !  The finish ? as brilliant as the rest: a banana bread dark chocolate bread pudding with cinnamon crema and freshly made whipped cream...enough was enough well maybe not I was naughty enough to wander off the premises after signing off our check to go grab a small latte a Press coffee down the street !  Overall, I was very impressed with SOL and it was my very first time tasting Chef Deborah Schneider's cuisine and I must say she is truly a master of her craft !

I have been coming to SOL for about three years now on and I don't know how I've never tried the Fish Taco Gobernador before!!!! It is sold a la carte, and it's well worth it. This taco has wild-caught fish, pan-roasted with lemon & garlic, on a taco dorado with cheese, salsa gobernador, avocado, onion & cilantro, pico & lettuce.   If you love fish tacos, you're missing out if you don't try this one.   The atmosphere at SOL is intimate, low lighting, live music at times. Great to catch up with family, friends, or a nice date night. They've really thought out the decor and design of the place. One of my faves.   They also have great Taco Tuesday options and pricing if you're on a budget.

Definitely not impressed. We stopped in for lunch on a Saturday. The weather was not too bad because of sprinkling so, we sat on the patio. Mistake! Our server was slow and lazy. She took our drink order, pushing the sangria and margaritas. After dropping off lots chips and little salsa, she disappeared for 20 min.  She returned after I stuck my head in the dining room, only to tell us they were out of the red sangria but could make me a white. (#1 how do you run out of sangria in the middle of the day, in a Mexican restaurant, when you're NOT busy and you were pushing it special and #2 if you can 'make' me a white sangria, why not a 'red'?). So, I played along. Mistake #2. It was terrible.   We ran out of salsa rather quickly and while I had her at the table I asked for more. She returned with another basket full of chips, but no salsa. When I reminded her what I asked for (and what we did not) she said "oh, someone will be bringing it right behind me." Seriously?  We ordered the carnita tacos and Ensenada fish tacos. Food was average at best. Fish tacos were just ok. Pulled pork was cold. Rice was dry. And so was the experience.   We won't be back.

Sol is located right off Scottsdale road.  The service is super friendly and speedy.  The restaurant is a modern version of Mexican food with a twist. The corn appetizer was amazing.  The carne tacos were tasty, I wasn't a huge fan of the tortillas so ate the meat only.  The tortilla chips are Sols own version.

Been there only three times. Always happy. Food and experience is amazing. I love to get the Strawberry Margarita there because they make it with real strawberry chunks. It's like having Luxury Mexican food. Highest quality you can ever get. Yummy. A must try place.
Alberto was an amazing server! I love this place! Can't wait to come here every Thursday. Also a stunning atmosphere!
I love this place. The happy hour here is awesome, and the chips and salsa are addicting! Great ambience, a perfect place for a girls night!

Yum! First time visiting this restaurant.  I tried their grilled chicken burrito "wet style".  Love the presentation with the grill marks and the flavors of the dish! Will definitely have to make the drive back up here again.   The black bean dip is great along with the large chips they make fresh.

During a recent trip to the area my boyfriend and I had no idea what would be good but we both wanted Mexican food and this spot looked good so we decided to eat there. The restaurant itself was spacious but not cavernous and was attractively decorated. The hostess was sweet and our server Joel was excellent. They served black beans instead of salsa with the chips which were v delicious. We ordered shrimp taquitos, quesadillas, and one of the specialty tacos as well as a watermelon margarita. Everything was suuuuper good and the service was outstanding.

Came in during waste management, but it wasn't that busy.  We sat at the bar, ordered some apps & drinks.  I usually don't even think about doing a dine & dash, but we totally could have, and I don't think anyone would have noticed.  No bueno.

Ordered the steak tacos, received absolutely nothing that I ordered. Went there with a large group, two others did not receive what they ordered. Had to get the girlfriend shake shack on the way back to the hotel. Strawberry Margarita was HORRIBLE. Place is garbage. Find another Mexican restaurant, place is horrible.
I had the Carne asada torta and it was delicious. Not a big fan of their full tostada sized chips but the sandwich was bomb dot com worthy of the 5 stars.

Had high hopes when we saw this place,  but what a disappointment.   The gray-haired gentleman that seated us (I believe was possibly the owner or manager) was very blah...no smile,  no greeting,  no eye contact.   Food was below average.   The thick cut tortilla chips tasted stale and the salsa was bland.   I ordered steak tacos and my wife ordered fish tacos.   Both were lacking in taste.   Our kids' carne asada tacos and cheese quesadilla off the kids menu were better than our entrees.   The only good part of our experience was our pleasant and attentive waitress.  Due to the tasteless food and impolite host/manager/owner(?),  we will not return.

OK, so look: just come here. You'll be happy.  Sometimes there's a long wait. Sometimes there isn't.  Last visit arrival after 9 p.m. They close at 10. No stress visible from anyone as we were being seated. Prompt attention from server. Killer house marg for $5 thanks to Yelp check-in.  Solid performance on the chili verde and carnitas burrito. Very good guac that isn't complicated with stuff that should never be mixed in.  Consistent performer for years and years including their Newport Beach location.

Hey Guys ... the food is GREAT! Service is good too. Be aware that it Is reallly reallly REALLLLLLLLLY loud inside so if its not too hot and the weather is nice go outside away from the ruckus (Wu Tang Clan Brings the Ruckus).  Grab a margarita, mojito or a bottle of patron and let the fiesta bless ya. This place is classy with a good vibe and a quality (But pricy) menu.  Phenomenal Traditional guacamole! thoguh Im not sure what happened when i ordered the Sol Guacamole, the guac came with like pineapples and other strange condiments mixed, in. It wasn't bad but it was a bit overkill and cost extra.  down one star because i didnt have my sombrero, but ill be taking a siesta under the nearest palo verde after dinner at this place. the Fish tacos do the trick. Spice up the guacamole and tacos with a little lime and hot sauce and give your tastebuds the mariachi march to heaven.  Muy Sabrosa!  As far as servers go, beard guy is cool and speedy Gonzales is great. Baldy mcBig head annoyed me a bit for standing too close and ignoring me.  The chip n salsa guy is quick and attentive. But the water re fillers seem to be conserving due to the recent drought.  Getting the check on time is always a problem here. I know the atmosphere is chill but don't keep your guests waiting.
I've tried ceviche all over the world and never had any as good as the "hot and raw" ceviche at Sol Cocina. The rest of the menu is hit-or-miss, but the ceviche is truly world class.

The first time we came here was in August and if I would have written a review based on that visit, I would have given them 1 star for the poor service that we received.  I called and spoke with the manager after that visit and he apologized and offered to send me a gift card to have us come back and try his restaurant again.  We went again last night, different server, and the service was much better.  The salsa and bean dip they bring out with the tostada chips is heavenly.  Their guac appetizer is pretty good.  Their tacos are to die for.  Both times I've gotten the street tacos and I have not been disappointed.  There is so much flavor in their food and everything is really fresh.  Their Mexican rice is super amazing too.  I would definitely come back here again.

This review is just fr the bar...  I wasn't a fan...  Overpriced drinks... Didn't seem like a "real" Mexican cocina iny way at all...  Zero reason to go back with all of the other great choices in the area...

First of all I love their location. They are located in the middle of all my favorite stores. But the food here is great. They do happy hour 7 days a week. Service is excellent. The corn is a must try. The place is also very new and hip.
I have been all over USA and this is the best Mexican Spanish  the best, Taste amazing everyone is so friendly here. Enjoy your food guys,Ciao

So I would give their strawberry margarita a 5 stars alone !!!! It's was so delicious and refreshing. I will for sure be back even if just for drinks. As far as service and food quality is was just ok nothing great not bad but I was expecting to be wowed !!! Based off recommendations from reviews and friends. Our server was friendly but think she may have just been over run with tables because we hardly saw her. They brought out the wrong sides for my dishes not once but twice. Again not her fault she didn't make them and other severs where bringing them out. Will return and try to make their happy hour because the prices seem more reasonable :) but you must try the Margaritas !!!! Beautiful atmosphere and decor was nice.

We have been to SOL six times in this past year. The food is good but, overpriced for the size portions served. However, the service ranges from poor to average. They have NO systems for a server to know they have a table. They really operated with a very inexperienced small staff. Not great value!

OMG the Mexican food at this place is to DIE FOR! My husband got the enchiladas and it was the best as well as all the other food we ordered- also all the food tasted authentic which was a plus. We will be coming back :)

This place was the bomb! Stopped here after getting into town, and boy were we hungry. We were seated after a very short wait. The environment is casual and the decor is warm feeling. We were greeted by a nice waiter, and given some delicious black bean dip that would make you smack someone's momma for it. Fresh corn tortillas were baked for us to chip away into our own bite size peices. The menu is fresh, and unique but not so much you can't pick an item off the menu with ease. The infusion of flavors was great.   We chose the tacos and you must try: Ths sweet potato taco The crunchy shrimp taco The carne asada taco The yellowtail taco  All of these were cheap, and you can get a few different ones to try out. Two will fill you up but three will take you over the hill!  My only issue was the lack of ability to have options that did not have garlic in the foods or marinades. Don't come here if you need accommodations.  This is a great place to get some authentic food.

Had the luxury of attending a NCA event in the private dining area of SOL. It was on a Tuesday night, I arrived a little early, so I was able to sit at the bar and check out their Taco Tuesday menu + order a drink. They have an extensive list of imported beers, more than I am typically used to.   Location: Its right in the Scottsdale Quarter and located right next door to the parking garage, so its a short walk from the car to the restaurant entrance, extremely convenient.   Ambiance: I like the low lighting and the openness of this place. They have an indoor/outdoor bar and a great private dining area for corporate events, private dinners, etc. Also, the high top tables are great, and the lounge area outside with the heaters! Superb.   Employees: All very friendly, especially the bartenders, who made sure my drink was always full and made sure I was taken care of. Extra plus, theyre all attractive. eye candy for the win.   Food: The TACOS! So delicious. I had the steak and chicken tacos, with their extra spicy sauce. So delicious. I love that they make your guac from scratch, so everything is extremely fresh tasting. Plus, how do you go wrong on a taco tuesday? 2 street tacos for 2.50! You're full after 5 dollars.   Make sure you use the check-in offer, its 5 dollars off any margarita, wonderful.  Did I mention the live music on Tuesdays? Super legit. Its acoustic and not like a mariatchi band. I appreciate that.

Went with my family. Had heard great things about this place and it's all true. Very friendly and attentive staff. Food was terrific starting from the huge tortilla chips with bean dip. Ordered the grilled burrito and it was very flavorful. All the ingredients tasted fresh bursting with flavor. Will be our go to spot when in North Scottsdale from now on!

Food was okay. Drinks were average.  There was an hour and a half wait and I put myself on the wait list and sat at at bar outside.   Restaurant emptied out and I never got notified that my table was ready.   As I was leaving I stopped by the hostess stand to ask why I never was notified that tables had opened up.   She initially indicated she had text me.  When I asked what number she had on file for me she stumbled and said we probably had the wrong number down.   What was even cuter was both hostesses giggled as I walked away.  Mediocracy at its best...

Nice, casual ambience. Not too casual, not too fancy. Our server was friendly and helpful. The chips and salsa were great. 2 salsas (one mild and one spicy) and the chips were seasoned homemade tostadas. I had an absolutely perfect blended margarita with fresh strawberries and sugar around the rim! For an appetizer, we had the ceviche. At first, I thought it wasn't much, but it was definitely plenty. Delicious and fresh. For dinner I chose 3 tacos, the quesotaco, poblano, mushroom and corn, and the bufalada taco. All 3 were so good, but my favorite was the poblano, mushroom and corn. So good! Crunchy, greasy, tasty...like a fancier version of what my mom would make! I didn't get the entree, with the rice and beans, but the tacos alone were plenty! Based on what we ordered, I would recommend Sol for authentic Mexican food with a slightly fancier flare!

I really wanted to like SOL Cocina, but for me it was a big misfire.  I know, I know they've only been open 9 days, but there were rookie errors that should never have occurred with an experience restauranteur or issue that a soft opening should have handled.  We wanted to try this new restaurant for our friend's birthday, so I diligently made reservations a day in advance (they are not yet set up on open table).  We arrived on time, but they weren't ready.  They tried to set us up on a bar table, but we wanted a regular table which we had to stand and wait for 30 minutes.  The three hostesses blamed the problem on a failed computer system, but there seemed to be plenty of tables and they just wouldn't seat us, because they said the computer problem messed up their ordering system.  After waiting a half hour I finally demanded they seat us and take our order the old-fashioned way -- by hand.  To their credit, the restaurant decor is lovely.  The tables a beautiful real wood rustic hand-hewn tables.  The indoor/outdoor vibe is great for this time of year.  But they do have an issue in the bar area with the direction their tables are set up.  All the tables are set up in an east/west direction so when the sun sets you are literally blinded by the sun.  A simple solution would be to turn the tables to that they face north/south.  Also, once the sun set the restaurant goes to dark, soft lighting.  Not unusual for a restaurant, but with the poor lighting and the thin font on the menu, it is nearly impossible to read the menu.  Come prepared -- bring a flashlight and reading glasses because you'll need them.  On to food and drinks.  The appetizers were really good.  We had the Guacamole Sol which was good, but the Warm Goat Cheese appetizer was really outstanding.  I can't say the same for my husband's drink.  The waiter recommended the Grande Clase Azul Margarita.  We like margaritas, but we did not like the taste of this one which was more of a case of quantity not quality.  It was strong -- super strong, but all you tasted was tequila and very little of the margarita flavor that we know and love.  On to dinner, my husband and I ordered the Grilled Fish Zarandeado.  In my opinion very average and not much flavor.  Plus it was very wet below the tortilla so when I went to pick the taco up to eat it, the whole thing fell apart.  The rice was okay, but the black beans were really not to my liking.  All together and even with the sauces the flavors were very bland.  Which was extremely surprising for Mexican food.  One kind of tends to expect spicy and flavorful food.  However, our friend had the sweet potato black bean taco and she liked it a lot.  Lastly on to service.  While our waiter was nice and a dedicated educator about all the menu items, service was very slow.  We had brought in a specialty cake for our friend's birthday which they very graciously served.  We all promptly ordered coffee to go with the cake.  20 minutes later we were still staring at our cake waiting for coffee.  We finally called the waiter over and asked about the coffee and he said they were out of coffee and it would take another 5-10 minutes to make some more.  We promptly ate our cake without coffee and cancelled the order.  To the waiter's credit, he brought us 4 cups of coffee right before we were  gathering our stuff to leave and said the manager would comp the coffee, but by this time it was 9pm and we were ready to leave.   Interestingly, our original reservation was for 6:30 and we didn't leave until after 9pm.  We like long and leisurely dining when it is our choice, not when it's because of slow service, computer problems, etc.  I know the restaurant is only 8 days old, but it may be 8 months before we give it another try.  Hopefully, by then, they will have worked out all their problems.

Everyone loves Mexican food... SOL adds $cottsdale class. Culinary perfection meets an atmosphere so chill you can show up in shorts & flip flops. The manager Carlos is so friendly & attentive you'll believe its his home and you've been invited to a VIP dinner party. (Ask for him) #ArizonaGem

Excellent Baja-style Mexican food. Our server, Veronica, was incredibly knowledgeable and accommodating. I have extensive food allergies and she was able to answer all of my questions about ingredients. It is obvious she loves what she does and is passionate about being a part of SOL. THE FOOD WAS OUTSTANDING. We would recommend this place to anyone and we will definitely be back.

My hubby and I had lunch here over the holidays.  I couldn't wait to try this spot after reading the reviews.  We had a decent lunch-but nothing I would return for.  They are generous with the chips, salsa and bean dip.  How I long for the days of HOT, freshly salted chips.  These were not-sigh.  I had the queso with mushrooms and chorizo-almost too spicy.  My hubby had the Carne Asada Tacos.  It appears they have a more limited menu at Lunch-perhaps I would have enjoyed the Dinner menu better.

I had a really good dinner with some friends here recently.  We had their chile appetizer - which is a cheese-stuff chile wrapped in bacon and grilled.  It was so good that I got one with my dinner.  The chips are great - some spicy salt they put on them that gives it a good flavor.  We all ended up getting tacos - chicken, carne asada and carnitas - all on their Taco Tuesday special.  The portions were just big enough to fill you up without feeling too full.  The carne asada tacos had a really good flavor.    I had the watermelon margarita and a pineapple margarita - both were good although not very strong at all.    The service was good although we did ask for some grilled jalapenos and had to ask about them several times before they finally brought them.    I would definitely return to Sol.
Solid Yelp home run.  Had the carne asada taco platter and it was great.  Taste of the grilling really came out.  Nice outdoor area that would be nice if it wasn't 150 deg out.
Aside from the great menu the staff are very professional and friendly. Made my wife very "At Home" during our visit.
Ate out on the outdoor patio last Friday night. The food, atmosphere and service were superb! Enjoyed the eggplant taco and guacamole fresco. Thanks Arnoldo!

The food here is incredible! Desert nachos are to die for and I live for the black bean dip! It just seems to have pretty spotty service, from have an inattentive server or just plain rude. But overall the atmosphere is fun and the food and drinks are great!

SOL had a great veggie burrito bowl, with plenty of mushroom and avocado - mmm! I liked that they serve the  rice on the side side. We also tried sweet potato tacos, mushroom tacos, and the corn. The corn wasn't that good compared to other places so I would pass on that, but otherwise SOL seems fairly solid, at least for vegetarian dishes. The staff were also quick and helpful when we came in pretty close to kitchen closing, which I appreciated.
Terrible service and time estimate on table availability. Said 40 mins and waited 1.5 hours. Many tables sitting empty. Not worth the wait.

I am a big fan of this restaurant, even on their less-than-perfect days.  Let me start by saying that everything I've had is fantastic.  In particular, the ceviche is absolutely incredible!  So are the carnitas (pork) street tacos.  And don't forget the margaritas!  Only one time have I had an unfortunate experience with my food.  I'm not writing this to complain about the food, I'm writing to compliment them on how they handled it.  After I explained the situation to our server, he immediately sought out the General Manager who came straight to our table.  He immediately rectified the situation, offered to replace it, and took the item off our check.  That is what good service is all about!  I was very nice about the incident - I don't believe yelling and screaming are appropriate ways to handle things - and as a result everyone went out of their way to look out for us the rest of the evening.  Classy service and style all the way around!

I was here again tonight, with my family. Great food and service. Debbie, our sever was amazing and very attentive. The best experience we've had thus far. In fact, we took tons of leftovers home. SOL, you're phenomenal!

My boyfriend and I went here for date night last night for our first time and had an amazing experience! Everything from our drinks to our food was absolutely to die for. The ribeye tacos were the best tacos I have ever had. We had the nachos dulces for dessert and were in heaven. The ambiance was perfect for date night. Our server, Giovanny, made the experience that more enjoyable. He knew exactly what to recommend and was very attentive. We are definitely coming back again!!

Sol Mexican Cocina is a definite go to for lunch when shopping at the quarter. My server Marlena was really sweet and on top of things. There were loads of wait staff on hand to see to our needs. For instance Beth was so knowledgeable and explained many items on the menu making it easy for me to make a great selection. I had some kind of fish tacos with salad and guacamole. Yummy!! The best. Next a fellow came over to refill my coffee. He said he was going to make a fresh pot that would only take a few minutes. Turns out that was Matt and the coffee was delicious. I really loved the ambience and not feeling rushed at Sol MC. Thank you to everyone. It's so evident that you love what you do. We benefit!!

We discovered Sol Cocina last February when we came out to Scottsdale for a short getaway and LOVED it. We came back to Phoenix this week and knew we had to come back.   First the food was incredible. Creative pairings and unique tastes to everything, make this a wonderful  experience that is not  your typical Mexican restaurant. The soup was so good, the grilled corn was unbelievably good (still craving more of that) and everything we ordered was delicious.  Most importantly was the service we had from Leah. She was friendly and welcoming from the moment we sat down and made this a great dining experience that will have to hold us until we return to Phoenix again.

First time coming here in quite some time, and the service was amazing! Our servers name was Alberto and he was very welcoming and gave me and my sister excellent service even though the restaurant was packed. Although they no longer offer the Chicken viper taco, I will definitely be coming here again soon. The food was great and the banana bread pudding was to die for. Definitely leaving this place with a full belly that's for sure.
Amazing food, with a new take on Mexican. Everything was fresh, delicious, and left us wanting more... Too bad our stomach capacity limits us! We will return ASAP. And the Mexican Sweet Corn, WOW.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place as it is my favorite Mexican restaurant in north Scottsdale. I have been here many times for either lunch, happy hour, or dinner. Every time, service is very attentive and food tasty.   They have a really good lunch menu and happy hour. I consistently get the carnitas street taco meal with 3 tacos and rice. Their guacamole sol is another favorite made with mango, tomatoes, onions, goat cheese, pepitas. Fantastic. And the chips, salsa, and black bean dip? Fugeddaboutit.   I have had other dishes, some just okay, and others very good. The items I love keep me coming back for more...
Decent, fresh, unique.   The salsa is great, but stays with you for a long time. I've had the fish tacos and a torta. Both were good.   The location is great, service good.

Food is awesome, but the service sucks (especially the hostesses).  Their street tacos are my personal favorite there.  We really like most of the varieties we've tasted and they have good meat/vegetarian options.  We also like their guacamole a lot.  It's especially nice that the guac is served with homemade large chips.  I also recommend the calamari appetizer.  If you're a calamari fan - it's really great and unlike other calamari I've tasted.  The service is what keeps them from getting a "5 star" from us.  Their hostesses (on 3 different occasions) are snooty and cold.  They seem 'bothered' that they are there to help anyone walking in the door and they act like their seating us at the most exclusive club in town instead of a nice neighborhood Mexican spot.  They need to hire some host staff who are genuinely warm and friendly - it would make a BIG difference in people's willingness to wait for a table instead of walking away.  The servers are mixed.  I've had a couple that were awesome - and a couple that were forgetful and slow.  But they've all been friendly.  LOVE the food...  hoping they perfect the service.

Fun place to come and get some authentic coastal Baja California Mexican food. Which means they do a lot more  of  seafood  and other dishes rather than northern Sonoran food which is the taco burrito base that most are use to also known as Tex Mex.They have great happy hour specials on both food and drink, Plus  live music some nights of the week. Also is located in the Scottsdale quarter which has lots of great shopping restaurants and bars to choose from. Definitely should come by and check it out

The food is good.  where this place falls down is with the the service.  Our waitress acted like she'd was doing us a favor that she would not rather be doing.  I asked if they served plain black or green iced tea, no added flavors.  She replied, "No, I will bring you some water" and turned and walked away.  No I'm sorry or asking if I'd like an alternative.  Unfortunate, this type of crappy service has been the norm on the 3 times I've been there. The food is really deserving of a 4 (minus the fact that you can't get unflavored iced tea - what is the deal with that?).  However, the put upon attitude of the wait staff is a real problem.
Great food! My family loved it and we would recommend it to you. They had very good chips, salsa and guacamole,

This restaurant was pretty good. The ambience was modern yet cozy. I had the Kobe beef, which was delicious. My husband had the pork tacos,which unfortunately on the dry side. Our server Israel was wonderful and very attentive to all our needs.

I love that Sol offers a Mexican brunch but I'm a little disappointed in the quality of food. Chilaquiles were underwhelming - too chewy instead of crunchy with too little queso. I got mine with carnitas, which were too greasy for my taste. No kids items on the brunch menu so my daughter got the 3 eggs, bacon & potatoes from the adult menu. Her eggs were so overcooked, she only had one bite. Her potatoes were super greasy. No shredded chicken on the menu - only sliced chicken breast.  The good stuff: I loved the black bean dip, served to every table as a starter with chips and salsa. Cool, hip decor. Tons of tequilas available. Fun brunch cocktails on the menu. Very friendly service.

Only 2 small Vegan options. Shame. There are so many people who won't eat animal ingredients if it health or compassion reasons. But in this restaurant they don't care.  Update: April 3. Anthony. E. I believe is one of the restaurant owners or the chef (maybe not), send me messages that I'm "bitchin" for no reason.  Well. I promise.  If the restaurant will change their menu to have more Vegan compatible dishes Ill canch my rating. It's the easiest thing in the world to do that. It's not even a challenge.  It supposed to be prepared to order. Isn't it? Instead of chicken or beef put some tofu. Insted of Chicken powder use Vegetable powder. Insted of Lard use vegetable shortening.... But if the chef is arrogant and his decision to be loyal to animal ingredients more to his loyalty to his costumers... in that case one star is too much !  I truly believe they wont. I truly believe they don't care. I came with friends after I made sure they have vegan option. Drove half an hour. Paid for valet.  And stayed hungry.

Sweet potato tacos and the mushroom & pepper tacos were quite good.  Soups were tasty as well, and we liked the sample size portion that is an option.  Our margaritas were flavorful but a bit pricey.  Wish they had draft beer.
The food is lux Mex so it's great on ambience and service. The environment trumps the food taste but it still gets 4 stars. We're spoiled here with a lot of great tasting Mexican.
Excellent margaritas, service, and delicious street tacos!

I'd like to say this is our New Mexican go to place since my Boo loves Mexican food and making the hike to Barrio Queen is a chore.  But alas, not so much.  The Margarita was just ok.  I can't rate the  food since I'm allergic to onion and every single dish is pre made  with onion?! ...and per the manager, they couldn't make anything fresh?

This has quickly become a go-to lunch spot for us when we head down to Scottsdale.  My wife loves the Cerviche, but I'm stuck on the Tacos ala carte.  Beware of the Viper -- it will light your fire!  Good 'ritas, good chips/salsa and good food!  Lovely patio dining on the nice spring afternoons.  It's just what the doctor ordered for Mexican food starved Prescott residents!

So we went for Happy Hour to give this place a try. The hostess said martinis were on happy hour, the our server said they were not. The server proceeded to bring us the saltiest salsa we've ever had. When ask if it's always that salty, our server said yes that's the norm. I ordered Dos Tacos for $5, one pork and one chicken off the happy hour menu. I got 4 tacos and was charged $10. I asked for salsa verde, and our server said they didn't carry it. I asked the gentleman who brought our food and he said yes they had it, but then he never brought it. Then I asked our server again about salsa verde and she said it was a $2 up charge. I think what makes this a 1 star is the fact no one can get their story straight, the chips were horrible, and the salsa was almost inedible. As a Mexican restaurant, I'm a bit concerned they can't get salsa and chips right. The tacos were okay. However great people watching, just bring a flash light because it's super dark.

Great outdoor bar.... and the skinny high end margaritas are great, that along with the full tostada style chips with beans and salsa.   A great way to start off the any meal.  Even tho out in Scottsdale and not like its sister site off Jamboree and PCH in Newport Beach, still the Ceviche Kicks butt major... a for sure recommendation.  As for the tacos, well did the fish battered ones... lets just say, no frills no thrills.  Overall good experience and staff pretty attentive.

Great food, I had Baja corn chowder with crab , really good! the carnita street taco very good too, I also had a green pepper filled with cheese..  wasn't to crazy about it, and my Bloody Mary really bad.. services was ok, but a really nice environment, I recommended but don't ask for bloody merry drink.

I wish I'd gotten the waiter's name. He was incredible. The drinks were 'well balanced,' i.e. not watered down.  I got the naked guacamole. It was super bland but I mixed the salsa in and it was better.  Also got the shrimp tacos and they were great. The rice was overcooked but whatever.  I wouldn't recommend it to friends but I'm not upset about the experience. The waiter made the experience good even though the food was nothing to write home about.  Beyond the food, my other complaint is seating.  The raised seat limits my parents and my in-laws from attending.

Overall - definitely avoid if you're going on a date - might be okay for a group if you guys are into chain-like restaurants and don't care about quality food or drinks.   In regards to the food and drink (1) Beware the Calamari - unless you are in the mood for fish sticks, then by all means, enjoy! (2) And I'm sorry, but since when did using a sour mix (house-made or otherwise) for margaritas become something work advertising? Their drinks were cloyingly sweet and syrupy and a far cry from anything remotely authentic. (3) Then there was the guacamole - maybe the standard version was better, but we were highly encouraged to try their specialty guacamole which had goat cheese in it. I love goat cheese, and I LOVE guacamole, but I couldn't really see how the flavors would work together. Just like I had thought, the flavors made a rather disastrous marriage - but beyond the sad mismatch, the flavor was down right bland (even after adding salt & their special spicy sauce, it just tasted like mush). (4) And while the concept of the tortilla rounds was cool, they failed again to execute (they chips were stale & flavorless, not crispy & lightly salted like authentic chips should be).   The atmosphere is loud and upon settling into it, mostly unimpressive - the lighting is dim (which I normally don't have a problem with, but their tables are a size that makes it awkward for two people to see each and have an easy to understand conversation).   This place misses the mark on so many levels it's straight up sad.

To start the nachos and salsa you get to start are amazing!  House margarita made with Patron!   I had two tacos, short rib with blue corn tortilla...get it, you will not be disappointed. Also had the vampiro taco which was spicy and so favorable.  Bartender Devin was great super nice and great recommendations!   I wish I lived closer to go every week!

We tried Sol for the first time last night and it was EXCELLENT.  The watermelon margarita was easily the best I've ever had and their carne asada street tacos were divine.  Mmmm my mouth is watering just thinking of it. My husband had the viper and vampiro tacos and loved every bite.  Service was great. Overall, a fantastic experience. We will definitely be going again soon.
This restaurant is nothing more than a glorified and expensive taco bell.

Weird how food so bland must have been salty as I've been downing water as though I have been lost out in the Sahara desert for the last hour since we arrived home. I had their short rib with tortillas and baby serving of onions, cheese accompaniments. The salsa was bland and boring, not the slightest bit sweet or seasoned. Chips were not flavorful either. The queso dip ended up a hard, dried cheese ala mozzarella sticks after 15 minutes. The corn tortillas were dry and unflavored. My daughter's carnitas tacos tasted gamey. I am not sure what type of Mexican restaurant this is supposed to be but our money would have been better spent and tastebuds better satisfied at Blue Agave or Rubios.

Perfect location within the Scottsdale Quarters and a nice outdoor seating space. We arrived at a perfect time for their happy hour and enjoyed some house margaritas. Ordered the Carne Assad's Torta and was very impressed, especially with the freshness of the bread.
